Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, location, comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela D
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed here in late March. We wanted a place that had a great location for doing lots of exploring on foot, and close to the museums--this hotel was perfect for us. We had a room with 2 single beds. The room was larger than I expected, had a complimentary fruit basket, and a refrigerator. It's a short, pleasant walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and many other places. The staff was excellent--always friendly and very helpful. The hotel was very quiet, and was a wonderful respite after being out and about all day. Everything was very convenient. We didn't have breakfast here, but got croissants and other items from a patisserie/boulangerie just steps away. There's also a small convenience store about one street over that was good for snack items. Just delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Springtime 2012”
Reviews.Author: Tusztoke
Reviews.Content: Well-managed boutique sized hotel w/uniformly courteous staff, cleanly maintained and situated on a quiet one-way street offering 24/7 tranquility. Nearness of a major Metro hub allows for added convenience for what isn’t, by location, in easy walking distance, along with a taxi stand less than 50 meters away at the Place du Chatelet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SPDS1
Reviews.Content: Great central location with very helpful staff, e.g. restaurant bookings, airline check in and late check out. Yes rooms are small, however you do not go to Paris to be apart from the one you love. Request upper floor rooms with balcony either standard or king dependant on budget. Very stylish and sumptuous lounge area which serves drinks till 9 in the evening after that we were allowed to drink our own champagne locally purchased. We did not eat breakfast however other guests thought it was very good. Local restaurants worth visiting: L' Auberge , Au Bougnat and Le relais de I'isle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ivan P
Reviews.Content: We were with my girlfriend in Hotel Britannique end of March 2012 for three nights in double room and we are very delighted of our stay in this charming hotel. First of all the location is just amazing - walking distance from a Louvre, Notre Dame de Paris, Champs-Elysees and even if you like to walk longer :) you can reach the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are a may be a little bit small (my opinion) but extremely clean and very cosy with comfortable bed. The breakfast is very tasty and the staff is kind and helpful (speaking very good English). I recommend this amazing hotel to everyone who is going to visit the most romantic city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Safe.”
Reviews.Author: Anbadev
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It was a little difficult to locate this hotel especially because it was my first trip to Paris. However, no regrets staying there. The location was ideal for all major tourist attractions. Hotel was clean and well maintained. Staff were very helpful. We felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Annette W
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel in a ideal situation for exploring Paris. The staff are extremely helpful and have good advice about where to go and how to get there. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate, the beds are comfy and the rooms have nice little touches such as fruit and toiletries. The walls are a little thin so you can hear your neighbours some times. Other than that we had a great stay and would recommend it. There is a lovely cafe/boulangerie just around the corner if you don't want to spend €14 euros on breakfast every day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bikincin
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly helpful English speaking staff!

Reviews.Title: “Katerina T”
Reviews.Author: KaterinaTs18
Reviews.Content: Nice location,comfortable clean room,very helpful staff, free wi-fi. We hope to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Adrian B
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to the Hotel Britannique by friends and were thrilled with our five night stay. The central location is brilliant and the staff are very friendly and helpfull. The bedrooms are well appointed and very clean. Sure they are quite small but this is part of the ambience of Paris and we have stayed in smaller. We requested a bathroom with a shower and it was excellent. The bed was very comfortable and the location is quiet at night. The hotel is surrounded by many excellent restaurants and cafes within a very short walk. If you have bulky luggage it may take two trips in what must be the worlds smallest lift! We would certainly stay at this hotel again; loved it! Miles of Adelaide

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: OZDavid13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in mid March. When we left the USA to travel to Paris, American Airlines lost our luggage for three days. The hotel reception staff could not have been more helpful to us in dealing with the airline. The location suited us down to the ground being close to the Seine and the other major attractions in Paris. The hotel recommended a wonderful restaurant nearby. We selected the hotel based on Trip Advisor advise and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotels”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: A small, elegant hotel centrally situated in a quiet street close to the River Seine, Notre Dame and Chatelet. Metro is close by, easy access from airports too. Good local restaurants. One of my favourite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: VivaHampshire
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay from the 9th March to the 12th March 2012. We couldn’t fault the facilities or the staff and the location of the hotel is excellent. I would certainly recommend this hotel or stay here again. We stayed in a second floor room at the front of the hotel which even had a small balcony (from memory there were only two rooms at the front that had a balcony). If I had to make one small negative comment it was that the room was on the small side but you don’t go to Paris for a long weekend and stay in your room. Having said that my wife loved the decor in the room and thought it was very romantic. So apart from this everything was very good, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and functional. One of the real plus points for this hotel is the location which is ideal for all the city centre attractions and travel links.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find, we are glad we trusted the T.A. Reviews”
Reviews.Author: ButchChicago
Reviews.Content: For this trip we were not looking for a Marriott style. This is a very nice small hotel. I think you could say this about many areas of Paris, but this is an ideal location. Very short distance to streets St Honore, Rivoli, St Germain. Nitre Dame is very close, as is Louvre. Rooms are VERY small, so downplay your expectations. Clean. Bathrooms are nice enough. Staff is helpful. I'm sure there are many great places I could say this about, but I would return... Unless on future trips I wanted to be spoiled. Then I would go to Manderin Oriental and spend 5 times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. The room was lovely, spotlessly clean with real attention to detail. The hotel has a relaxed, comfortable, welcoming atmopshere and very quiet for such a central location. It was easy to get to all the attractions and so easy to get to on the Metro from Gare du Nord. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Although the breakfast may seem initially expensive, compared to everything else in Paris it was worth doing for a couple of mornings. Good selection of food. There is also a great bakery just around the corner. We hope to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nopy999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 3nights. The location is central and at a walking distance to many sights, restaurants and shops. It is located in a quiet street. The staff were extremely helpful to us and had perfect English. They were aware it was our honeymoon trip and on entering a very comfortable (although small) room with large balcony, we were surprised to discover vases of roses, a bowl of fruits, sented candles, rose petals over the bedspread and a welcoming card in our names. Such attention to detail showed great customer care. Breakfast was a feast with a buffet catering for all tastes and large appetites. The lounge downstairs was a treat to the lovers of Agatha Christie's novels and the times of luxury travels. A bonus was the free access to the Internet and daily free newspapers in French and English. We will not forget our trip to Paris especially because of such a wonderful stay at Hotel Britannique.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: italy1234
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a better hotel than Hotel Britannique! The location was perfectly situated near the metro, many major attractions and lots of fun food and shopping options. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful in providing restaurant reservations and travel directions. The hotel is clean and lovely, providing a sense of comfort after a long day of sight-seeing. We absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Antonio L
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research here on tripadvisor and amongst other websites, after reading numerous reviews and looking at photos we went with this hotel. It was for my honeymoon and my wife and I enjoyed very much our stay there. As others mentioned the rooms are not big but we love the little balcony we had on the fifth floor. Overlooking below Avenue Victoria, which is quite a wide street compared to many local streets in Paris. so adjacent buildings are at a good distance from our window. We love the breakfast too, simple yet delightful. The staff there were all very helpful and friendly. Croissant, pain Au chocolate, toast and various jam, yogurts, cereal, etc etc. for the price of 14€ it's a steal, taking into account the prices of local Macdonald's. All the reception staff were extremely helpful and very fluent in English (almost native I would say), so communication has been a bliss. The sitting area / lounge is very beautifully decorated with music playing almost everytime I was there (playing Enya at the time). And wifi is free, just need to get an access code from the reception. Last but not least, we got a honeymoon present from the hotel, fresh fruits and a Fauchon chocolate box! Not to mention the red roses set on a glass vase and red rose petels set around the room. My wife and I will definitely come back to this hotel on my next visit to Paris. Thanks hotel britannique for giving us Memorable honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Tripadvisor find!”
Reviews.Author: Ramzilla
Reviews.Content: What a super hotel and such a fabulous location! There was a problem with my 1 night reservation booked via Booking.com i.e. they didn’t have it. Reception handled the problem promptly, provided a very satisfactory upgrade as part of the solution and I was in my room within 15 minutes of arriving. Although the room and bathroom was compact (fine for 1 person), it was spotlessly clean and very nicely appointed with little extras I hadn't expected in a French 3* hotel e.g in room tea & coffee making facilities, robes. They very kindly agreed to a late check-out; much appreciated given the prospect of 24 hour trip back to Australia. Breakfast was reasonably priced with a good selection. As a solo traveller, I thought the hotel good value for money. It’s top of my list for my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt6680
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after researching hotels in Paris here on trip advisor, and certainly weren't disappointed! Upon arriving at this immaculately presented hotel, we were greeted by very pleasant and friendly staff. The room was of an ideal size, with all the amenities we needed. The room was romanticly presented and extremely clean. Bed was very comfortable, windows have blinds on which completely black out the room.Air con in the room made the temperature ideal. The lounge area just down from the reception desk was a great place to sit and relax with a coffee. The hotel is ideally situated for everything. 5 min walk to Notre Dame, 1 min walk from the banks of the Seine. Will definately return both to Paris and Hotel Britannique

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Chippitmint
Reviews.Content: Our last visit to Paris was 25 years ago on our honeymoon and we chose Hotel Britannique to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. And what a choice it turned out to be - fantastic. The hotel is very well located close to the River Seine, Notre Dame, and within easy walking distance of The Louvre. There is a metro station within 3 minutes walk which enables you to reach the rest of Paris very easily. The hotel is set in a quiet street and the rooms are very well soundproofed. Our room was on the top floor and had a street view. From the window we could see across the rooftops from the Hotel de Ville to the Eiffel Tower. The room was very comfortable with all the amenities you would normally expect - air conditioning, mini bar, safe, TV, free wi-fi, fresh fruit, courtesy tray and kettle. Plenty of hot water in the bathroom. The staff were extremely welcoming and always on hand to help. Nothing was ever too much trouble. Based on our experience, it is definitely a hotel I would recommend to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlennyBrandimarte
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a four night stay. I can't say enough about how good this place is. I stayed in one of the mid-sized rooms ... can't remember the category name. There are four rooms up a half flight of steps from the front desk. I stayed in 4. The room was very pretty and they kept it extremely clean. It was very quiet and very comfortable. For Americans, the room would be considered small, but it was all I needed. There's a bed and a small desk and a double wide closet with hangers on the left side and shelves on the right side. I was traveling for business and the shelves were perfect for allowing me to keep all my papers very organized. While the room is small, basically a bed and a bathroom with shower, everything is very nice. The shower worked really well, great water flow and temperature control. And, if you feel like you need some room to sit down in a more open environment, there is a beautiful, tastefully decorated room downstairs ... what would be a lobby in American hotels ... but this is so much more cozy and homey than a lobby. There are two or three couches and four or five or so very comfortable chairs. Saving the best for last, the staff at the front desk was exceedingly friendly and helpful. They make you feel welcomed. They are friendly and very pleasant ... the best I've seen. The Chatelet metro station is across the street from the hotel, and if you know how to use the Paris metro, you can go anywhere quickly. One warning, though, about the Chatelet metro stop. This stop connects underground with another stop called Les Halles. Between the two, it seems like there are a dozen ways up to the street level, some of which bring you out fairly far from the hotel, especially when you entered the metro by walking across the street. If you find the street exit (sortie) for Place du Chatelet, you are a half a block from the hotel. The sortie that is across the street from the hotel is ..... the name is escaping me now. Anyway, when you go into the metro, look at the name of sortie where you enter, then you'll know where you need to exit.

Reviews.Title: “C'est fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: AFCBcherries
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights at the Hotel Britannique recently. It was 25 years since we last visited Paris (when we were on our honeymoon) and we certainly made a fantastic decision on our choice of hotel. Hotel Britannique is in a fabulous location just a few minutes from the Seine and the Hotel de Ville. Our room was extremely clean and although small had lots of storage space with all amenities you would expect (mini-bar, safe, air conditioning, TV, free wi-fi, fresh fruit, kettle and courtesy tray). We had a front facing room with a view of the Eiffel Tour. The breakfast was good value, with lots of choice and my husband was especially impressed with the coffee machine! The staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Miicheese
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, helpful staff and good location. I enjoyed staying. I'd like to back this hotel next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotell Britannique”
Reviews.Author: europetravelerUSA
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is excellent in every respect. I always try to stay there when I am in Paris. Lovely rooms, a very helpful staff, a great breakfast and a prime location--what else can you ask for in Paris? I'm not making this up--I've been traveling to Paris for thirty years and brought some of my students with me to this hotel in June, 2012. They thought it was great, too. Stephen Husarik

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT Hotel - PERFECT Location”
Reviews.Author: Sembuscado
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Tripadvisor and was THRILLED with how beautiful and cozy this boutique hotel was. My husband and I went to Paris for our 20 year wedding anniversary in January. This hotel is located in the perfect location just north of the Seine, near Notre Dame and Louvre. It is also conveniently located near the RER and Metro Station (Chatelet).

Reviews.Title: “Haven”
Reviews.Author: Heart1010
Reviews.Content: I broke up with my French boyfriend and needed accommodation. Brittanique was my haven. It's more a guest house than a hotel, with a calm ambience, everything just works seamlessly: helpful staff as far as new travel arrangements and work documents were concerned, but perhaps most notably, my extended stay, twice at short notice, was accommodated by management, inspite of extremely heavy bookings. I didn't give them the reasons for my change of plans, the mere fact that i needed to extend was good enough reason for them to somehow juggle the capacity demand on rooms. Rooms were scrupulously clean, and location is superb. It is in a quiet little street while the Metro station Chatelet is bustles below.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Joshua R
Reviews.Content: Loved this place - the location was excellent and the room was very nice. A little on the small side, but very comfortable. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful - they recommended two restaurants to us, one was great and one was pretty bad. But there are a lot of little restaurants/cafes/bars nearby to explore. If you want to walk Paris and have easy access to the Metro, I'd definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: saranLondon
Reviews.Content: Given its location, right opposite the Chatelet theatre and therefore in the centre and an easy walk/metro from everywhere, this hotel is astonishingly quiet. I think it's because the rooms face onto a little cul de sac - though you wouldn't know that to look at the exterior. Our room was pretty tiny - but Paris bedrooms always are if you dont pay a total fortune. It was well-appointed generally - and had an exceptionally comfortable bed (though see below) - with a fruit plate too which was nice...and robes which I love. And there is a cosy lounge as well as the breakfast room which again is quite unusual. Plus the staff are helpful Two criticisms: the bedside lamps were so poor, neither of us could see to read in bed - boring. Plus my particular hate: a plastic undersheet. I can't sleep on these at all -waking after an hour in a great puddle of sweat. So I always rip them off before getting into bed - which makes them wholly counterproductive. I'm not a baby or incontinent and do not expect to sleep on rubber. You can get perfectly good undersheets that don't have that. Anyhow - two little quibbles but otherwise a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Kelly O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Britanique from 28th-30th January 2012. The location is perfect for all of the major tourist sights. All major shops just around the corner but a very quiet neighbourhood, although it has bars and restaurants close by too. The Chatelet Metro Station is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel itself was excellent value for money, very pretty, extremely clean and well maintained to a high standard. The rooms were warm and inviting. The hotel staff were very helpfull and very knowledgeable on the sights and metro stops etc. We both enjoyed our stay at Hotel Britannique and Paris is a fantastic city, will definitely be back. I have never written a review before, this is just to express how impressed I was with the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Hotel Britannique”
Reviews.Author: Todd S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon which included four nights at the Hotel Britannique. The hotel is lovely and in a GREAT location. It was quiet and very romantic. The only room available was a junior suite. We were welcomed with roses and a bottle of champagne. The room was large for European standards and had a comfortable king sized bed along with a pull out couch - which we did not use. We were on the first floor overlooking the street. The windows did an excellent job blocking noise from the outside street. The room was very clean and had everything was a great place to come back to after roaming around Paris. The staff was very helpful and very friendly and spoke great English. My wife and I were VERY pleased with this hotel and hope to return the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Beautiful Settings”
Reviews.Author: AlanandJim
Reviews.Content: I cold not believe that this hotel is only a 3 star. I have stayed in many a 5 star worst than this. The location is excellent very near the metro and also the notre dame and within reasonable walking distance of the louvre and the main areas. The lounge is very attractive, warm and inviting and the bedrooms are exactly as described. The hotel receptionists could not have been more helpful. The only down side was the small lift. you can just get two people in with a medium size case. I certainly will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mundaykent
Reviews.Content: This hotel fully deserves its high rating. Its location, all round quality and the exceptional service of the receptionists are outstanding. The attractive lounge is a real bonus in a French hotel, plus the thoughtful attention to detail throughout the hotel e.g. the quality of the toilet paper, and the volume control for the TV is limited to prevent unwanted noise for neighbours. Given that rooms are pretty well sound proofed it is hard to understand complaints about noise from neighbouring rooms. And - the mattress was one of the most comfortable and properly supportive we have found in any hotel. It was a real pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It is one of a kind in Paris”
Reviews.Author: arctickoala
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel that is located right where you want to be, this is a steal. I lived in Paris around 10 years ago for 8 months, love the city. I have probably visted Paris at least once a year, probably twice since then. Majority of the time places I stayed were a bit stinky or a bit far away or too small . . . etc. Anyway this one is slightly pricier than the average but I think if you book in advance you might get good deals however it is worth every Euro. It has the perfect location, 5 mins to Louvre, 5 mins to Marais, 5 mins to Notre Dame, on line 1 ( the line you want to be on). It is very very clean and I have never seen such helpful, service oriented staff in Paris, (love the French but these guys can not be French sorry). If the light is bothering you get yourself a room from the back. But if you dont mind street lights coming into your room, I think the Victoria Avenue rooms has the most charming Paris street view. Breakfast is obviously a bit expensive for what it is. But if you ware staying one or two nights this is definatly worth it . If you are going to stay for a week or so , I think it might be a bit too expensive. You should be able to fine something else slightly out of the action maybe around 5th, 6th or 10th, 11th for around 50 Euro cheaper. But just for 2-3 nights it really is worth the slight expense.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Mainekerner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times - twice for business and twice for vacation. In all cases the staff was friendly, helpful, spoke as much or as little English as you needed and ensured that each stay was comfortable and problem free. The rooms are quiet and comfortable, but be prepared for the relatively small size of both the rooms and the quite comfortable beds - but after all this is Paris and you should be wandering the streets more, and in your room less. These are small rooms in most cases with limited room for luggage. The closets are good sized and have shelves and a personal safe to make sure you can take care of all your belongings. The showers are good and the water temperature and water pressure are adequate. If your room faces the street, you have a classic view of a typical small Parisienne street scene - especially if you get one with a small balcony. If your room faces the "courtyard" you will find it incredibly quiet and conducive to terrific sleep. Either way I have never had a problem with noise. It is clear the ownership is paying attention to the quality of the rooms and public spaces. Each time I have noticed upgrades to furniture, televisions, plumbing and the cleanliness of the overall hotel. The breakfast served is quite good, and very complete, but I believe it is currently 14 euros per meal extra....just something to consider if you are trying to manage costs. On the backside of the hotel is a wonderful boulangerie that opens at 7am and has great baguettes and croissant. Around the corner is a small grocery store so you can get some basics if you want to stock your hotel room with some snacks. The Chatelet metro stop is literally all around you, with several entrances within 50 yards of the hotel,so getting anywhere on the metro is a snap. I will continue to use this hotel, assuming availability (only about 35-40 rooms in total) and look forward to future stays.

Reviews.Title: “J'adore Hotel Britannique”
Reviews.Author: ROSIE4313
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming hotel for 8 nights over the Christmas period in December '11. We had 2 rooms on the second floor: our room was a larger double facing Avenue Victoria and our teenagers had a twin room at the rear which was very spacious. The rooms were beautiful; the beds very comfortable and the bathroom always very clean and well stocked with toiletries and the robes were a lovely bonus. The staff were exceptionally welcoming, friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was delicious. The location was perfect and we were able to walk to most of the places we visited. Our visit to Versailles was easy: just a few minutes walk across the river to the St Michel RER train. (Tip: there is a laundrette - Lavier- on the Rue du Roi de Sicile which is parallel to Rue de Rivoli in The Marais. The Lavier is near the corner of the Rue Vielle du Temple) We loved our stay at the Hotel Britannique.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: maureen288
Reviews.Content: The staff were very welcoming and helped us with all our sight seeing questions and, as well as, the best places to gain tickets etc. Our room was beautiful and clean ; yes small but to be expected in Paris. We asked for the romantic upgrade and it was such a shock to open the door to be greated with a fantastic array of goodies such as chocolates, champagne and fruite bowl, all beautifully presented. It was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gasa1956
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip from the US to Europe and to Paris. I have to say we were a bit intimidated before we arrived. We could not have been happier staying at the Hotel Britannique. The staff made us feel very comfortable. The hotel character definitely made us feel like we were in Paris, which was exactly what we were hoping for. The good reviews of this hotel are right on, particularly the location. There are so many things to do within walking distance that you could spend weeks just exploring the sites and neighborhoods by walking. Or, the metro station is just down the street, then a short ride anywhere. We also found the people working at the cafe's and shops in the neighborhoods near the hotel to be very friendly and helpful. The food in Paris is awesome! We will be returning to Paris and next time no need be intimidated before we arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Right bank charmer”
Reviews.Author: MegaKay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel in April (just prior to Easter), having already had a fortnight in an apartment near the Champs de Mars the month before. The location can not be faulted, particularly if you want to be in walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame and the Musee d'Orsay. There's an entrance to the Chatelet metro almost just across the road from the hotel (although be aware that Chatelet and Chatelet Les Halles are big metro stations and can be a bit confusing). We caught a taxi to the hotel from Gare du Nord and the taxi driver was initially a bit confused as to where avenue Victoria was - good thing we had a photocopied map with us! We also had a short delay getting in to our room but this gave us the opportunity to have a free drink in the downstairs lounge area, which looked and felt like someone's private library - very cosy, and would be a tempting place to curl up with a book on a wet afternoon. The room itself was lovely. I've read a lot of reviews of Paris hotels where people complain about how small the rooms are, and I'm puzzled as to what it is people expect. No, the room wasn't huge, but I could walk around the bed without difficulty (and I'm not exactly a stick figure) and the bathroom was well appointed. Our room was on the first floor looking over the avenue but we barely heard any noise from outside with the windows closed. My favourite touch were the red geraniums on the small balcony outside our window - perhaps a bit of a cliche, but one I really appreciated. We had breakfast at the hotel on our first morning (mainly because it was gratis as an apology for the delay we had getting in to the room) and it was OK but I don't see why you'd pay for a hotel buffet breakfast when the area simply teems with decent cafes - get out and mix with the locals! In summary: if you want a comfortable bed in lovely surroundings, charming service and an unbeatable location, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Craig S
Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique hotel. Fantastic location and friendliest staff. Rooms lovely decor and clean. stayed 3 nights early Dec 2011. Just got back to Australia and telling everyone the Hotel Bittanique was a great choice and we chose based on trip advisor reviews. Will stay here again when next visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Nathan W
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique (and TripAdvisor!) treated us right. As someone who knows Paris intimately as a traveler, I knew I wanted to be right in the 1st or 2nd arrondissement instead of out by the Tour Eiffel in the 7th,and preferably near a bridge connecting to my favorite area, the Quartier Latin. HB came through for us with all the bells and whistles. Our room was intimate, beautiful, and since we told them it was to celebrate my wife's 40th b-day, came with a basket of goodies and wine. I CANNOT recommend Hoel Britannique highly enough. US travelers beware: rooms are smaller than Vegas. US travelers take heart: there's an incredible Belgian brewpub less than 1 block away. Have fun! Nathan

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & superior staff”
Reviews.Author: moodiemary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Britannique for 5 nights and absolutely loved staying here. The staff is wonderful and helpful with whatever request you may have. Everyone at the hotel greets you each time they see you and the front desk staff was superior to any we have encountered. The hotel is absolutely charming and decorated beautifully. Calming music (i.e., Enya) plays all the time, another nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteB49
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting Paris for a number of years now and have stayed in various hotels in the city, but the Britannique is definitely my favourite now that I've had the pleasure of staying there for 3 nights recently. My room was just up the stairs from reception and it was very pretty and well-equipped, including a complimentary tray and delicious bowl of fruit, and a basket of lovely toiletries etc in the bathroom. The room was clean, comfortable and warmly welcoming from the cold outside. I would have liked to have opened the window now and again for a change of air but it seemed to be locked. The buffet breakfasts were excellent, with plenty of choice of good, fresh food. Reception staff were so friendly and helpful. I would happily spend another of my Paris trips at the Britannique!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly little B&B”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a relatively quiet street yet it is within easy walking distance from Ile de la Citè and Quartier Latin as well as to the main shopping Rue de Rivoli. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes all around. Of course, the location makes the venue relatively expensive. The hotel is tastefully decorated and oozes charm. All rooms come with safe and the mini bar – there is no hotel bar or restaurant. Bathrobes are also provided. The staff are very friendly and very attentive. We followed their recommendation as to the restaurant and were very pleased with the choice. Lift is a bit claustrophobic – could be a problem if you are struggling with stairs and stay on upper floors. Breakfast, at EUR14, was ample and varied with good selection of cheeses and fruit. Certainly much better value than anything you can get outside of the comparable quality. In the winter try to reduce the room temperature as with double glazed doors permanently shut (it can get noisy at night – there is a cocktail bar right opposite) it can get rather hot. When first getting there by metro – try to get outside of the Châtelet station as quickly as possible, looking for exits to Rue de Rivoli, otherwise you will be endlessly wandering along the bewildering maze of tunnels and stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katandapickle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Britannique for 3 nights this December. As we hadn't been to Paris before, we wanted to stay at a comfortable and centrally located hotel and this hotel did not disappoint. It is just around the corner from the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay and Notre Dame and while the rooms are small (like all Paris hotel rooms) they are very comfortable, and there is a very comfortable lounge to relax in as well. The staff are truly excellent and very accommodating; my sleep was disturbed on my first and second night at the hotel room by drunk American guests in the adjacent room and the staff did everything possible to make them be quiet and when that failed, thry upgraded us to another room at no extra charge, which was much appreciated. Idiot guests aside (which isn't tbe hotel's fault) we had a great stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cjblonde
Reviews.Content: Staff were always very helpful and friendly. The rooms were always well maintained and the size was good (classic double). We will be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: crissiec
Reviews.Content: I learned about the Hotel Britannique on Trip Advisor and I am so grateful to all who posted comments leading me to this fabulous hotel. Truly, I cannot say enough about how pleased we were with everything. Throughout our stay, I was impressed with the attention to detail in the decor, the quiet warmth and charm of the hotel, the friendliness of the staff and the centrality of location, allowing us to walk to so many sights and attractions. It was a perfect - clean, lovely, gracious, affordable and in the heart of everything - the Hotel Britannique is superb in every respect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service...Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: MilanNewYork
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The location of the hotel is fantastic. Right in the center of everything, yet set on a quiter end of the street. We walked to so many places.. There are numerous restaurants and shops right outside of the door - and many of the main attractions are also walking distance.. Notre Dame, St Germain shopping, Louvre, Museum d'Orsay. We even walked down to to Champs De Elysee and Arc de Triomphe. And if something was too far to walk to, the Chatelet (metro station) was one block for the hotel and nearly every major metro line ran through this station. In addition, there are several bus lines within a block. We saved so much money on taxi fares as we were able to connect to all major transportation lines. SERVICE: Excellent staff. We arrived earlier than the stated check in time. They were able to hold our luggage for us and give us some cafe recommendations. They had our room ready immediately upon our return (earlier than planned). They went out of their way to make sure every detail was taken care of. We ordered the "birthday package" - The champagne, fruit and chocolate was waiting in our room with a lovely vase of roses. HOTEL: Small, boutique property. Very quaint. The rooms are quite small, but lovely. The decor was nice - room was very clean. Ask for a higher floor. The windows are almost floor to ceiling height and they fully open so that you can look out onto Avenue Victoria. The rooms do get quite hot so its also nice to open them for some fresh air. We loved everything about this hotel. There is a great bakery around the corner for some treats and a cafe au lait. Also down the street - Cafe Zimmer has some great wines.. awesome cheese platter and mmmmmm creme brulee. Overall... Amazing experience. Highly recommend staying at Hotel Britannique. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !”
Reviews.Author: kellyrila
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Britannique in Nov2011. Location is perfect at Chatlet metro station, walking distance to les halles, hotel de ville, convenient to visit both left/right bank of Paris. Room is 'compact' parisien standard with very comfortable bed. Bathroom is relatively small, however provide "Annick Goutal" bathing set. There's a balcony overlooking chatlet area. The only bad thing is you can hear noises from other rooms, lift or water pipes sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Donna_G71
Reviews.Content: I loved Hotel Britannique. I had a standard double on the second floor, with a little balcony facing the street - perfect for a week by myself in Paris. The size of the room was a pleasant surprise - not huge but certainly not tiny, and perfectly comfortable for me on my own. Charmingly decorated, clean and comfortable (including a most welcome bowl of fruit on arrival). Public rooms were lovely as well. I had breakfast in the hotel a few times and it was much better value for money than the local cafe. The young woman at breakfast was very friendly and welcoming. Excellent and safe location, with the Chatelet metro station just around the corner which can take you anywhere. Also just around the corner near rue de rivoli were ATMs and a good little supermarket on rue bourdonnais. So why not five stars? First, staff - almost all were friendly and helpful, but there were a couple of chilly exceptions. Asked one to recommend a restaurant and she was utterly at a loss. Second, the walls are thin and I had a lot of noise from other rooms. Maybe I was unlucky with insomniac neighbours who had a blaring TV at 2am and 5am, but the noise levels were not good. However, I had earplugs so my sleep was not affected. All in all, I would recommend and would probably stay there again. The overall charm and pleasantness of the experience more than compensated for the couple of niggles.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: sw01bgn
Reviews.Content: We've been here on a romantic w/e and the choice was just right. Very central to main attractions and just by the Seine. The rooms were very nice and modern and service quite professional. Hassle free and as we are planning to come back to Paris on another short break we will be staying at this hotel without any hesitation. Book with confidence is our advice based on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before my honeymoon in March. I was debating on where to stay because this was my first time in Paris and I wanted great view of the Eiffel Tower from the room, so we wound up splitting our time between 2 hotels. The first 4 days of the trip we spent at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel (HDE) in the 7th district right by the Eiffel Tower. The last 3 days we stayed at Hotel Britannique (HB). HDE was newer with a better breakfast, but I wish we would have stayed at HB the whole time. The location of HB is PERFECT. The street the hotel is located on is quiet and charming. It's a quick walk from the hotel to the Louvre and Rue Montorgueil (the "farmer's" market). It's only a couple of blocks from the river, so it's an easy walk to Ile St. Louis, Ile de Cite, and the Left Bank. The hotel was beautiful. Our room was spacious by European standards. The only reason I'm not giving the hotel a perfect rating is that it is older, so the elevators are super slow. You also have to check your key into the front desk when you leave, which we thought was strange. Other than that, our stay was delightful. It was our honeymoon, so they hotel sprinkled the room with rose petals and gave us a bottle of Moet et Chandon, fruit, and chocolates. The staff was friendly. And as I mentioned before, the location can not be beat. We will definitely stay here again the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tony_No
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in 3 rooms with family. This is a small hotel of c 30 rooms. We had one suite for my wife and I and our 2 children and 2 double rooms for the rest of our party. The rooms themselves are decorated extremely nicely and are in good condition- the photos on the hotel website are very representative. breakfast was fine without being exceptional- a few basic hot items plus lots of pastries, some nice cheese and a little fruit and the dining room is a little cramped. The location is absolutely fantastic and is easy walking distance to Norte dame, the louvre etc. also only 2 mins walk from chatelet metro which is a hub station with links everywhere round Paris. By Paris standards the hotel is reasonable value. I knocked one star off my rating because some of the front desk staff, while friendly, didn't seem that well trained and not that keen to help with my tourist queries and also because of an ok but not exceptional breakfast. But because of the rooms and location I'd happily go back

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Patti W
Reviews.Content: We booked this great little boutique hotel online and were not sure what we were going to get though friends from Australia reported that they always stay there and love it. We were not disappointed. Our first room was a bit small and had a stall shower - by day 2, we were able to get a larger room with a tub. Both were spotless and comfortable, though we obviously preferred the larger room. Heard they have a junior suite which we will try for next time. Service was great - we got referred to a great restaurant every night. Location is fabulous - you can get breakfast either at the hotel or a block away, you can sit at Cafe Zimmer and watch Paris go by, and sip coffee with Notre Dame in the background. Have referred a few friends there who have also been very pleased. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “We'd Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: FromAwayCT2ME
Reviews.Content: For the first four nights of our honeymoon, I didn't want to be disappointed with the hotel. I scoured Trip Advisor's reviews for hotels within our budget and based on the many positive reviews, booked the Hotel Britannique. The friendly Front Desk Staff all spoke English which was wonderful to be able to count on easy communication when their assistance was needed. There are many charmng hotels in Paris, but, I agree with all the previous reviewers, this location is a HUGE plus. So easy to get around from this location. All the areas that a tourist wants to see are close by. We walked far more than took the Metro because we didn't have to resort to the Metro. The public areas are very nicely decorated. Very cozy. More like a living room. The buffet breakfast was as described and a wonderful asset to have available, as needed. The rooms are very nicely decorated. As previously mentioned, on the small side by American standards. I regretted not splurging on the Junior Suite. The King was very comfortable, but snug. Clothes storage was challenging. We emptied our luggage into the closet and stored the empty suitcases in the hotel's luggage room to free up space. The bed was very comfortable. We were on the back courtyard. I think, perhaps, the ideal would be a high floor on the front. The street is not busy so I don't think noise would be a problem and you'd have a view of treetops instead of looking across at other hotel rooms. The bathroom was tiny, but adequate. The only thing that frequently annoyed us was the internet connection which required repeated log-in's. There is a laptop available for guest's use in the living room but it had a European keyboard which makes typing laborious. We were always happy to return to the Hotel Britannique after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Maisyandlilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Britannique in early November, 2011, and would definitely recommend it to future travellers. First, the location could not be better - close to the Louvre and the Chatelet metro stop that connects you to all of the sights. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and the room was very clean with a minibar, safe, tv, and wireless Internet. The bathroom was a decent size with a roomy shower - newish fixtures and tile. We were in room 25 which was Quiet - it looked like the windows were double insulated for noise reduction. As with other Paris hotel rooms, our room was small,but we expected that. The front desk staff spoke English and were helpful with restaurant reservations and airport transfers. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel preferring the patisserie around the corner. As a side note, I recommend two restaurants: L'Auberge Bressane close to the Rue Cler and Sud-Ouest Monceau. We ate at L'Auberge Bressane this same time last year and returned on this trip - the food and service are excellent. By 9pm it was packed so get reservations and go early if you don't like a crowded dining experience. Love the dessert souffles! The second restaurant - not as conveniently located - was recommended by a foodie friend. This restaurant was a little more difficult to navigate on our limited French but we are adventurous and enjoyed it thoroughly. It looks like a small gourmet food store is connected to the restaurant for those who want to get snack supplies for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: OzzieAJ
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in strategic location of Paris. Travelled with my wife. The "romantic package" highly recommended with fruit, chocolates and champagne , and nice touch with rose petals over the bed. Do not expect a spacious room. But as you are in Paris you should not spend time in your room. Nicely decorated. In a quiet tree lined street. No traffic noise, great sleep. Buffet breakfast with some variety, more like a B&B. Staff very helpful and with good Enlish. Highly recommended, would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drewtremblay
Reviews.Content: We spent our 20th Wedding anniversary in Paris and choose the Hotel Britannique. The location is perfect, right in the middle of everything. There is a Metro station right there and great little Cafe's and Bistro's around the corner. The staff at the hotel were fantastic and they all speak english. The room was decorated for a "romantic" escape, which I ordered and my wife was really surprised and happy. This quaint little gem exceeded our expectations. I choose this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor. The rooms not big but that didn't matter.We stayed six nights and enjoyed every minute. Check out the "boulangerie" around the corner for breakfast. It was a 10 minutes walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame. It was our first time in Paris and we are going back and staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Padddy”
Reviews.Author: susan m
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with the Britannique Hotel. I found the hotel to be very charming and the staff to be knowledgeable and very helpful. The location is very near all attractions and the metro. I would highly recommend this hotel and wish I could be back there right now.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel, Excellent Location, Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Britannique is located directly in the heart of Paris, just one block from the Seine. My wife and I were able to walk everywhere we went, though if you're not into walking, it is located very close to the metro, the RER B, and the RER C. The staff was welcoming, helpful, and more than willing to oblige all of our requests. The decor was absolutely exquisite, and the room very comfortable. My wife and I agree that overall, this is the best hotel we've ever stayed in. The price was also within our budget. Very few complaints: The elevator is very small, which was quite charming, but also made it difficult to bring up all of our luggage. The mini bar was over priced, but you'll find that anywhere you stay. Also, I had never seen this before, you have to check your key at the front desk every time you leave. Again, not real problems, but I wanted to let everyone know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Merryl T
Reviews.Content: The friendly ,helpful reception staff ,delightful atmosphere throughout Hotel Britannique and a beautiful (moderately sized ) extremely well appointed ,comfortable front room with a balcony and nice view enhanced four wonderful days in Paris. Prior to our arrival the staff had fulfilled all our rquests promptly and very cheerfully, and on arrival we were extremely happy with not only the service, but the charming hotel.The situation, very close to the Metro and main attractions ( Notre Dame , Sainte Chappelle, The Conciergerie etc) is ideal. Breakfast was more than adequate ,but a little expensive.The elevator, secure luggage room and free Internet access were an added bonus. Hope we can return soon . Would recommend this Hotel without hesitation. From M.T. Queensland , Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: btlp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Hotel Britannique for the second time and it was just as wonderful as our first visit. Our room was small (cozy) with a very comfortable bed, and the hotel's common areas were lovely. The hotel staff were warm and friendly, and made us feel very much at home. The hotel has a perfect location, just a short walk to the metro and to a variety of wonderful neighborhoods. I look forward to staying at the Hotel Britannique again when we return to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best place in town”
Reviews.Author: Marcos F
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend the Hotel Britannique, just between the Louvre and the Notre Dame. One can access the metro in the same road where the hotel is. But, being splendidly located, it´s not the best part. The best part is... the hotel itself. It is a place to feel at home. The staff is so attentive! And the cleaning, the breakfast, the common rooms... are just perfect. We stayed there for 9 days. Every day was great. As we were in honeymoon, we booked an special romantic package. So when we got there there were rose petals everywhere in our room, from the bed to the bathtube. Ahah, and there´s something unique about this hotel. It has a differente charm, that comes from the colors, the art works, a kind of mixed french-british elegance. If you aren´t fluent in French, you will find a staff that speaks fluent English. So... I am a new fan of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent One Year Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Andrea W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Britannique the last week of October. We are from Virginia and found their website online. We were pleased to see the location is central to one of the biggest metro stops in Paris, and also within walking distance of many cafes and Notre Dame. My husband and I barely used the Metro because the hotel was centrally located. It was safe, very clean, and even included a Romance Package with flowers and champagne to celebrate our anniversary. The staff was kind to us, because we are not fluent in french. They even helped provided us with an adapter so that we could charge our computer in our room. Very friendly, clean and would stay there again. Rooms are small, but it added to the charm of the hotel. Would also recommend to any friends that will be going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet P
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Hotel Britannique. It is located on a quiet street walking distance to many of the Paris attractions. We were only 1 block from the subway which is very easy to take. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. We had a small balcony with a table and 2 chairs that was just delightful. The staff was welcoming and very helpful. The elevator is so small, my husband and I had to go up individually with out suitcases. I thought it was charming. I would return to this hotel any time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: jjp644
Reviews.Content: First I must say that the hotel location is perfect. You are right in the mix of everything you need to see on a trip to Paris. While the hotel location is great the hotel itself is average. The rooms were small, (even by Europe standards) and the elevator could barely fit two adults. Our room was clean but being that our room was so small it seemed dirty the second we settled it. The hotel lists that they have an airport shuttle. They do but it is run by an outside company with several pick-ups, (at other hotels) on your way to/from the airport. Make sure you account for this time. They charged 20 euros per person per way. They also offer a breakfest at the hotel but it is not free. It was 14 euros per person. The hotel does offer wifi which worked well. The service at the hotel was hit or miss. Everyone spoke english which was a big plus for us. We had a room on the 5th floor with a small balcony. With beer being so expensive in Paris we ended up stopping at a nearby grocery store, (front desk clerk can direct you) and picked up some beverages. We enjoyed them while sitting on our balcony. This was probably the highlight of our hotel stay. I don't want to discourage people from staying here. With so much to do in Paris you probably won't spend that much time in the hotel. It worked good for us for a 3-night stay. If our stay had been longer this hotel would not have worked for us. If you get a good price and don't plan on spending much time in your room this hotel might work well for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: VancTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in September 2011. The location was superb and convenient for sightseeing and shopping. It was also convenient for arrival by train from CDG airport even with luggage - it is a short and very manageable walk. The hotel is old-fashioned and the rooms are a comfortable size, not large, and furnishings are basic. The bathroom is small but functional. Everything was not fancy nor luxurious, but works and works well. Breakfast was good and inexpensive, front desk was very helpful, price was reasonable. At the end of the day, you just get the feeling you got good value for your money and you were comfortable in your stay. There are many restaurants close by but I would particularly recommend Au Vieux Comptoir - a bit expensive but very good traditional French food and very good service - and L'Auberge Cafe - surprisinly modern take on French cooking, inexpensive set menu and everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Jody1009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here on two occasions and both times we had excellent experiences. The hotel is quaint and peaceful but in a wonderful location. As another reviewer said, although only rated 3 stars, we find it to be more in line with a 4 star hotel. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff is knowledgeable and eager to help/provide recommendations. We hope to return for more stays!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OddAmanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in May on our honeymoon. When we arrived we were greeted by english speaking staff which was very helpful as my French is not the best! Our whole room had been decorated with roses and rose petals and we received a beautiful fruit basket, chocolates,a bottle of Moet and a lovely card. The location of this hotel is fantastic, right across the road from the Chatelet Metro and close within very close walking distance of Notre Dame and the Louvre Museum. The staff were very helpful and friendly and booked a tour and taxi to the airport for us with no problems. They even taught us a few french words. I completely enjoyed my stay here and would definately stay here again if I go back to Paris. Thank you for making our stay so special!!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay just as good”
Reviews.Author: danlev
Reviews.Content: My second stay in this excellent property. The staff takes pride in addressing any issue that may come up, and this attitude makes for a relaxed, enjoyable stay. Again, my room (65) was very quiet. A 3-star hotel that has the look and feel (and service!) of a 4-star. And, of course, it could not be more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “A reason to come back to Paris”
Reviews.Author: david4455
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Hotel Britannique was wonderful. It was our 20th anniversary and we arrived to find our small well-appointed sun lit room filled with red roses and candy in honor of our special occasion. After a long transatlantic flight we immediately felt comfortable at this very special hotel. The staff was friendly, informative, and never tiring ( or at least appearing to never tire!) of my many inquiries. We found the location to be perfect. Close to everything and on a broad quiet one-way street. The small superb bakery around the corner was the quintessential Paris experience. Our trip to Paris was so lovely made even more so by our choice to stay at the Hotel Britannique, that we have already booked another stay for 2012, this time bringing friends to share the magic of this city and lovely hotel. While this review may sound over the top I do tend to be honest and critical if warranted as seen in my past reviews of other hotels ....there was nothing to be critical of the Hotel Britannique. It really merits it's " excellent" rating.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: desireeSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for seven nights and were very happy with our room. The hotel was quiet with a minimum of street noise and the black-out shades helped us recuperate with a good night's sleep. Our room was small but clean and with very comfortable bedding. Upon arrival, there was a bowl of fresh fruit in the room, also a tea kettle and small fridge that we made us of daily. The hotel's location is excellent, very central to many major museums and other sites, and we were able to walk everywhere. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, and an excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: PomPerth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because of the comments made by TA and we were not disappointed!! We were in Paris to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary, and the staff at Britannique made sure we had a brilliant stay. The staff had left a bowl of fresh beautiful fruit, Maxims chocolates and a lovely card, which was a very generous and kind gesture. :-) Our room was 41, on the fourth floor and we had to take the lift, which was small,(as commented on in previous reviews,) BUT it was not a problem. We have stayed in hotels where we were on the 4th floor and it didnt have a lift and we had to cart the cases up and down, so we were pleased that we could use the lift which was easy. Our check in was very pleasant and we found the staff helpful, friendly, spoke good English to our poor French!, and helped us with directions, and especially when we needed a launderette, they gave us information and it was great to be able to wash and dry at a close location so that we were ready to go forward to Dubai with clean clothes! We loved our room and you could open the windows to look onto the street front. We didnt hear any noise at all, and we faced the busy street. Our bed was very comfy, and it was a delight to climb into it every night after a hectic sightseeing day :-) The bathroom was very clean and the toiletries were always stocked, as well as the tea and coffee every day. This is all before you look at the location! We walked everywhere and because the Metro was literally around the corner, we took that to places we couldnt walk to, and got ourselves a metro pass, which meant we saved heaps on taxis. There are restaurants everywhere surrounding this hotel, so the choice was endless, and thats not to mention the shops which are all at your doorstep! We both didnt want to leave, and have already decided to start saving for another holiday to Paris, so we can return to this wonderful hotel! Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great as Always”
Reviews.Author: Sean H
Reviews.Content: We having been staying in the Britannique regularly over the past 15 years. We initially went there because of the location(walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame and sitting on top of the largest metro and RER station in Paris, Chatelet-Les Halles). We have stayed again and again for the comfort. This visit was no exception. We arrived just after 9.00am following an overnight train journey. At that time on a Sunday morning we did not expect to get access to our room. However the reception and housekeeping staff arranged a room within an hour. We have always found staff to be very helpful. Like many French people they are more reserved than than Irish/British/American people are used to. Ironically they seem to be at their most talkative when guests are leaving, checking how ones visit went and what things guests did during their stay. While some of the rooms may be small they are beautifully appointed and comfortable. The superior rooms are more spacious if extra space is important. Breakfast is buffet style and one can eat as much as one likes. This will set you up for a day's sightseeing. The lobby/resident's lounge is a lovely quiet oasis which has a laptop for guest use as well as Wi-Fi being available throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTownYank
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night en route to the Champagne region. The location was great for us as it was convenient to where we were having dinner. We were very excited about staying here after reading all of the wonderful reviews, I guess we set our hopes too high. The room was VERY small and the decor was average. We were situated in a corner room at the front of the hotel and the noise from the street was unbearable, despite requesting a quiet room at the time of booking. Considering the fact that we live in a busy city, this is saying a lot. The bathroom was tiny as well with a compact corner shower and no bath tub. The toiletries and other products were poor, and like most French hotels, they did not stock hair conditioner. The blow dryer was appalling and in this day and age, you just expect better. They also had plastic cups instead of glasses, which just felt cheap. They seemed to be cutting corners all around. To top it all off after a sleepless night, the breakfast was substandard, especially for the price of 14 euros per person. In a city famed for its pastries, the ones at Hotel Britannique were flavorless and the rest of the breakfast selection was disappointing. You couldn't even get a decent glass of fresh juice or coffee and I left hungry and disappointed. On the upside, the location was convenient, the staff were friendly and helpful and the lobby lounge was cozy and comfortable. However, this is not enough to persuade us to return...

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: nennyl
Reviews.Content: Loads of character in this charming hotel, complete with geraniums in window boxes and a winding staircase. Steps from the metro and minutes from Ile de la Cite, Ile Saint Louis, Notre Dame, The Louvre, and the Seine. Double room was bigger than expected, with plenty of room to walk around the bed. Room was clean, nicely decorated and well equipped. Tiny elevator, but nice to have an option when one has heavy luggage. Professional and courteous front desk staff. Good restaurants nearby. Breakfast was rather pricey so we ate elsewhere. Otherwise, highly recommend this hotel for those wanting great location and ambiance at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BernardLow
Reviews.Content: Was there with my wife on honeymoon from Sept 9-Oct 4. Location's superb with Chatelet Les-Halles around the corner connecting major lines. The room is small as most people have already mentioned, but, everything is neat, tidy & working perfectly. My wife was very pleased with the pretty well decorated room. Will be back again. Regards, Bernard

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Front desk staff were wonderful and very helpful and spoke English for us. We only stayed the one night. Comfortable bed and clean room. Close to the metro stop and tons of restaurants and shops. Within walking distance to the Louvre, the Seine, Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, etc. They have a large locked luggage room which was especially helpful for us to store our suitcases before our train later the next day after we checked out that morning. Would highly recommend this hotel if staying in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great time”
Reviews.Author: dgpow
Reviews.Content: THIS IS AN EXCELLENT HOTEL. Did you hear me? THIS IS AN EXCELLENT HOTEL. How do I know? You can tell an excellent hotel by what they do when things go wrong. We had booked 6 nights, the first nite in one room, the next 5 in another larger but more expensive room. After we had packed to move, the front desk said they were fully booked and had no other rooms. We pointed out that we had a confirmation, although we were satisfied with the room we had. The hotel then offered to provide us complimentary breakfast for our whole stay! In addition, the hotel notified us a week before we arrived that due to some maintenance issues beyond their control, the hotel would be without hot water for one of the days we would stay. They voluntarily offered to drop the room rate 30% or to cancel the reservation without penalty. We obviously chose to stay. My spouse and I spent 6 nights here, our first trip to Paris. It is clean, exceptionally well maintained, and QUIET even with a balcony overlooking Victoria Ave. (Triple pane glass window will make sure it is quiet.) Not super spacious, but downtown Paris hotels rarely are. Breakfast is good, some won't find it worth 14 euros/person but it is ample and the wait staff is helpful. The front desk staff are very professional and well organized, in spite of the issue with our room. Everyone speaks English well (although I thought they appreciated our efforts at French, meager as they were). Free WiFi in the hotel is very good. The location is excellent for catching the Metro (305 meters to Chatelet station entrances), the RER train (5 min. walk to Chatelet/Le Halle), and being only 1 block from the Seine, easy access to the island. 400 yards from the Louvre, 10 min. from Notre Dame, several cafes and restaurants around the corner, this is an ideal location. If you want to take off in the morning, stop for a pastry or quiche at the corner, then start seeing the sights walking through Paris, this is a great place to be. There are several good cafe's and brasseries within the block for dinner if your tired and don't feel like venturing far after a long day walking and sightseeing. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right on... This is a charmer”
Reviews.Author: LuvItaly08
Reviews.Content: First of all... Big thanks to the Trip Advisor community... You always steer us to the gems and Paris was a delight with your guidance. Highly recommend this sweet place located in the middle of all the action for day trips and evening neighborhood walks. Staff were very helpful and there are no problems when you slip back into speaking English. Room 55 was large (relatively speaking) quiet, clean and comfortable. Welcoming small hotel.. Would come back for sure. Ou

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MzGeez
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excelelnt location, easy to get to all major attractions in the city via extremely convenient and easy to use metro. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JDK12345
Reviews.Content: Nicely located, near hustle and bustle yet tucked away in a quiet one-way street. Many amenities and shopping nearby. Hotel is clean, well run, rooms appear recently renovated, bathroom was nice, shower hot with good water pressure. Rooms, as most in paris, are on the small size, especially considering we had a cot and several large suitcases. Hotel seemed to attract couples without kids so noise level was good for us, although walls are thin so if you do have someone loud down the hall you will hear them. Grabbed breakfast both mornings at the boulangerie right around the corner. There is also a starbucks a couple blocks away. Shopping nearby. A few minutes walk to the Conciergerie and Notre-Dame. Several blocks to the Louvre but still walkable. Metro is right nearby, very convenient if you do not have a stroller and are mobile. Chatelet-les-Halles RER is close but undergoing renovations. Business travelers or those with minimal luggage could easily walk to the station in 15 minutes to grab the RER to CDG, however if you have a lot of luggage this is NOT a recommended option. Would heartily recommend the Moroccan restaurant (forgot the name) just across the street. It was fabulous. Also, la Poule au Pot is another nice French restaurant a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend in Paris and at the last minute I secured a book at this lovely small hotel. I wanted a hotel that was a straight shot on the metro from Gare du Nord train station and that is how I choose Hotel Britannique. I was really happy when I walked and and discovered the friendly staff, cozy library downstairs and my charming little room overlooking Avenue Victoria. I thought it might be noisy, but it was a very quiet street. I loved being there because it was a 2 minute walk to the metro. I could go shopping, zip back and drop off my purchases, then go straight out to another shop or museum. I used 20 metro tickets in 3 days because it was so easy to get everywhere from the hotel. There were a number of nearby cafes, one wasn't very good, but another was. I was travelling alone and being in a small intimate hotel worked well, I felt looked after. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: polsson
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. The rooms are small but beautifully appointed with a fresh fruit basket and bottled water in the room as a welcome. Very quiet but also close to everything. A metro stop is around the corner and the Louvre is two blocks away. The Seine is one street over. The lift is quite funny...about 2 feet by 2 feet 4 inches so only one of us could use it with luggage. The staff really didn't know how to direct us to places such as currency exchanges, bakeries and were unable to obtain a taxi for us to the rail station when we left. We were forced to take the Metro which was a bit hard with four suitcases. We had a little balcony off our room which was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel we just had to go back to”
Reviews.Author: RonOAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: I should have written this review when we visited Paris three years ago. On the great advice of tripadvisor members we stayed there and all the good things that were said about it were true. This past week we traveled to Paris again. We thought we would stay at a different hotel to try something new but changed our minds and we're glad we did. The Britannique was an outstanding choice again. As the first time, we had a balcony view. This hotel is in a great area of town close to several metro stops, nightlife and many restaurants. The service here is outstanding! Anytime we had questions, wanted advice or needed something, we were greeted with a smile and excellent information. All the clerks speak English. Highly recommended. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel is overrated”
Reviews.Author: maddyChicago
Reviews.Content: It's rare that my husband asks me whether I planned to write a review about a hotel and he made a point of it. The good: Hotel is located in a convenient area, close to metro and a few blocks from the Seine and Notre Dame Cathedral. There are are some very nice restaurants around the corner for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The lobby has a nice lounge to relax in. The exceptional: The gentleman who staffed the reception desk in the evening. He was professional and had knowledgeable. The not so good: In our opinion, the rooms were not "quaint" or well appointed as others have described. The decor was no better than a Super 8 (exception curtains). The bathroom was small and there was no counter space. The shower was small and awkward. The room had no instructions or guides on the hotel offering, the room amenities or the area's attractions. The elevator was quite small, it could only hold one person and two pieces of luggage at best. My husband referred to it as a converted dumb waiter and refused to use it. The front desk during the day was but did not seem well informed and lacked enthusiasm.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bidders01
Reviews.Content: If you are after a traditional french hotel then this is it. Period furnishings and artwork. Nice and close to the Metro and an easy walk from the Louvre. Our room had a little balcony with a view out onto the street. The rooms are a little small but that seems to be the norm in Paris. Probably not the place for a family but great for a couple. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: trip4suz
Reviews.Content: We choose this quaint boutique hotel based on previous TA reviews and we not disappointed. The location was perfect (tucked away from busy streets), close to the Pont Neuf, great restaurants and the metro. We stayed 7 nights and each of the staff members we're so very nice and helpful in every room. After our busy days out, we sometimes sat in the lounge sitting area and listened to the nice relaxing music they had playing. The ambience was great as well. The room was very comfortable and we enjoyed our king size bed which is a rarity in Paris. The breakfast is 14E busy worth it with a nice assortment of eggs, sausage, yogurts, bread, croissants, cheeses. Air conditioning was also available on those warm evenings, although we liked to open the large windows for the nice breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Style at a price”
Reviews.Author: katehp
Reviews.Content: Very well-appointed and equipped, but pricey. Breakfast buffet only average, and no information in the room for TV channels, on how to use the telephone, or how to adjust the air-conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three night in September 2011 after reading recommendations in Frommer's and on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a cute neighborhood close to the Seine, Louvre, and all the sightseeing buses. The staff was incredibly helpful, and our room was spacious and pleasant. Bathroom was nice too. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: toronto4
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this delightful hotel in early September. The location is superb for walking to the tourist sites and for taking the metro. The room was charming and we were pleased to find Annick Goutal toiletries in the bathroom. Around the corner from the hotel (turn right as you leave), is a delicious patisserie for breakfast, lunch or an afternoon treat. The staff were helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great, location really great”
Reviews.Author: RobertBG
Reviews.Content: There are many reviews about the Britannique elaborating its charm, its small rooms, its lovely sitting area, its helpful and courteous staff, its TINY elevator, even its very French shower without a curtain. It was great. And if you're tired and you just got off the red-eye as we did, the (expensive) full breakfast brunch was delightful. But the location on Ile-de-France means that you are in a quiet neighborhood surrounded by interesting restaurants, and you are in walking distance of many, many important tourist sites (and a central Metro station for those you don't have the legs for).
