If you're spending a lot of time in Paris, I could think of few better places to decompress than the Hotel Britannique. If you're looking for a central location, it's also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms but I'd choose another next time.”
Reviews.Author: Tvldreams
Reviews.Content: We arrived very tired from the overnight flights from Tampa. It was mid-week, and I don't think the hotel was sold out. We were told check-in was 3 pm - but most hotels, if the room is ready, they let you get some much-needed rest. We walked around - had a bite and then came back at 1 pm. I sat in the lobby and started to doze off. About 1:30 pm, the room was ready.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: fabiana a
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great--room size was perfect for 4 people. Would have liked a shower curtain in the tub. Room and hotel was always clean. The welcome fruit basket was a lovely touch. Staff at the front desk spoke English extremely well, and were able to answer all of our many questions. The hotel is in a great location--close to great shopping, restaurants and the metro. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly my favourite hotel room ever”
Reviews.Author: violetvale
Reviews.Content: I feel bad about being late with this review, because my 5-day stay at the Hotel Britannique was wonderful. I picked the hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. I *loved* my room. It was a single room on the top (6th) floor of the hotel. The windows opened, there was a huge pot of geraniums outside, and a wonderful view of the rooftops. It was just lovely to sit on my bed at the end of the day or in the morning and watch the changing light on the buildings outside. I could also see the top half of the Eiffel Tower twinkling at night. Although my room overlooked the street and I kept the window open, it was quiet, even at weekends. This hotel has the most amazing housekeeping staff--my room was always spotless and gleaming. There are so many little things I liked about the hotel--the bowl of fruit in my room on arrival (grapes, peaches, nectarines, and bananas), the little fridge where I stored macarons and the lovely French yogurt that comes in jars, the little kettle for making a cup of tea, the Annick Goutal toiletries, the free wifi. The hotel is very close to the Seine, the Louvre and Notre Dame. The yummy falafel places near Rue des Rosiers are about a 10-15 minute walk away. There's a little supermarket about two blocks up the street on Rue Sebastopol.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthAussie19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central - only one street back from the Seine and a block from the Louvre. I had a balcony and a lovely view of the street from the 5th floor, which I wasnt expecting, being an internet booking. The room was tiny - I am not sure how 2 people would fit their luggage and themselves in, but if you are only there to sleep, it wont matter. The bathroom was excellent, a good size and all the little extras that I needed i.e. kettle, excellent internet connection and friendly, helpful staff. There is a great little boulangerie around the corner (go for breakfast) as well as some nice restaurants. I had a delicious meal at Au vieux comptoir. This hotel is ideal for anyone wanting a central place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: applepieroad
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the convenience of this hotel for touring the top sights of Paris. Small rooms but quiet, comfortable sleeps and that matters a lot to me. As others have mentioned, attention is paid to cleanliness. Service is spotty. Asked for a restaurant recommendation and arrived to find it closed for renos. Other restaurant recommended was more of a smoky bar. Very strange. Found much better on our own. Bakery, tearoom next door is wonderful as is Tete D'Or beside it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Britannique!!”
Reviews.Author: luvztravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at HB for 4 nights in July 2011. It is so pretty from the outside!! We had a small but beautiful room overlooking the quiet street, with a tiny balcony and flowers on the railing!! Not a lot of extra room to move around, but enough space for our suitcases and the bed was big and comfortable. The sheets and pillows were amazing. The bathroom was updated and big enough for our needs. We were welcomed with a fruit basket and bottles of water - which was greatly appreciated after a long flight overnight. The location of the hotel is fabulous. we were a half a block from one of the main metro stations - Le chatelet - and a quick walk across the bridge to the entrance to Saint Chapelle. We could walk to restaurants in the Marais, over to the Latin Quarter and towards the Louvre. if we wanted to go a bit further afield, the metro was right there!! The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations and calling a cab the day we left. Breakfast was quite good - a nice variety of food and beverages - hot and cold. The A/C worked very well and there is a tiny elevator to help with the luggage. We would definitley recommend this hotel to our friends and would return again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Vert. British, warm reception, it has ererything”
Reviews.Author: Decosterhans
Reviews.Content: Excellent, I was here for the European Heart meeting. It was Mike coming home.

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel, super location”
Reviews.Author: 2airdogs
Reviews.Content: Took the train from the airport, walked about 4 minutes from the station to the hotel with 2 heavy bags. Hotel was very easy to find. It was on a nice quite street, but close to so much. Walking distance to cafes, shops, sights and the river. The bus stop for the hop-on, hop-off was pretty close, about a 7 minute walk. The fruit basket on arrival was so welcoming, just wish it would have been refilled each day. Room was standard European size, nice, comfortable, clean and welcoming. Staff was so helpful and kind. Definitely, would recommend to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: EandCinLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Britannique for our honeymoon. When we arrived, the room was decorated with roses, rose petals, wine, chocolate and fruit as part of the romance package we ordered. They did a lovely job with that. It made our arrival feel so special. The location was perfect. Around the corner from Chatlet Les Halles metro station with access to the RER as well. It was easy to get anywhere we wanted to go from here by train or by foot. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. Before our trip, we e-mailed several questions and they were very prompt in responding. They were very helpful in helping us figure out how to get around, booking airport transfers and restaurant recommendations. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The room and bathroom were not overly large by American standards, but they were big enough. Overall, we couldn't ask for a better experience in Paris and Hotel Britannique will be at the top on our list when we return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ajijiclorie
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to so much. Nice area, lots of restaurants all around. The rooms were small, but very clean and quite cozy. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. One gentleman in particular on the night shift, his name was Wolf...very friendly and helpful! Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Justin815
Reviews.Content: Wonderful atmosphere, service, decor and location. We could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vikramvasu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Britannique for one night on a business trip. As others have commented, the room was small, but not any smaller than I would expect in Paris. Check in was smooth, and the basics were more than addressed (wi-fi, satellite TV, coffee-making facilities). The location is very convenient, close to the metro and tourist spots. Overall, a very decent option in Paris for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: ag2rsdft5
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean, very friendly and multi-lingual staff, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: gill s
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Britannique was the perfect choice for our family party of six. We had rooms on the first, third and sixth floor, and we were all very impressed with the standard of cleanliness, and with the facilities provided, especially the bowl of fruit and the tea-making equipment – an extra plus for British visitors! The staff were unfailingly pleasant and helpful. The location of the hotel is brilliant for touring Paris. It is only one street away from the Seine, the Louvre is very close by, as is the Ile de la Cité, and the Chatelet metro stop, yards from the hotel, provides an easy way to reach other parts of the city, not to mention a direct line to the Gare du Nord. There was a good choice of food for breakfast and the buffet was constantly replenished. For other meals the area is amply provided with bars and restaurants. Coffee in the comfortable sitting room was a relaxing way to end the day. All in all we would thoroughly recommend the Hotel Britannique.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: SouthHedlandShatz
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent nothing was a problem even to printing off boarding passes for ongoing travel. Room was well maintained and comfortable. Close to local sights such as Notre Dame and Louvre and close to the Seine for that romantic stroll with your partner.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Noslen2010
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after research on Trip Advisor and in the Lonely planet guide. It lived up to our expectations and would recommend it to others. It's location is perfect for easy access to all the major attractions either by walking or using the Metro Chalet. Staying in smaller boutique hotels has become a high priority for us because you no longer feel like just another room number! and the staff here were both friendly and attentive with very good English. Both our room (on the 5th floor) and the common areas were well appointed with a lovely homely feel about them. This place really had a 'soul' as I like to say. We included breakfast in our booking which was excellent value for money, all the usual continental choices plus at no extra cost scrambled eggs and spicy chipolata sausages. Unfortunately for us our weather was rather inclement and we never left the hotel without a raincoat. The hotel had some umbrellas for guest use and on one day when the rain was particularly heavy and they were all taken a staff member went out and purchased more. On our last day we had a evening flight (10.30pm) so really appreciated the late check out and being able to go back to the hotel and relax in the lounge for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: Tash077
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with helpful staff and a quirky, unique feel to it. Good choice at breakfast, a comfy bed at night and, best of all, just a block away from the beautiful Seine.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Juli1964
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay - all was perfect. Small but unique colonial style rooms, very comfy beds, clean bathrooms - good help from kind receptionists both before about parking and more + during stay. Breakfast was certainly worth it . Soothing classical music in lobby and more - and not on the repeat button as far as I could hear. Great restaurants near by - "BAM" for one, Grissli around the corner was also over the top - well done Paris! No need to look for Michelin stars when you can find food like this just around the corner. We would certainly come again (- but don't tell anybody I said all these nice things, or it might be fully booked;-))

Reviews.Title: “A New Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Incentive362
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Paris for a quick "girls' trip" before she returns to college. We have visited Paris before and have stayed at Relais Christine and the Ritz. I was looking for something less expensive and more low key. Hotel Britainnique was great. The location is perfect for sight seeing - on the right bank close to the Seine. Very close to Notre Dame. Very convenient. We walked everywhere. It is surrounded by nice cafes. It is a small hotel and it is charming. Our room - with 2 single beds and a private bath - was small but it had everything we needed. AC, flat screen TV, coffee/tea, mini fridge, internet, hair dryer, etc. We were very comfortable. Off the very small lobby is a nice lounge that looks like a cozy living room. They have a nice breakfast room with a simple buffet for 14 euros per person. This may seem steep but we paid just as much if not more in a cafe. The staff was nice, helpful and spoke (some) English. So, it isn't the Ritz and it isn't Relais Christine, but it is a very nice little hotel. And I'll take the savings! We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Finally - a Paris hotel I will return to!”
Reviews.Author: h111
Reviews.Content: This was my 12th trip to Paris over the past 7 years and the 12th different hotel I've stayed at but fortunately, I finally found a hotel I will go back to! Hotel Brittanique was in the perfect location right next to Chatelet metro station so extremely convenient for getting around the city. It is also located within walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Latin Quarter, Jardins du Luxembourg and right next to the Seine. Room itself wasn't huge but it was very clean, had aircon & 2 large windows that opened, good use of space within the room (plenty of lights & mirrors), adequate closet space & bathroom counter space. I was sharing the room with a friend and while the 2 twin beds were spaced quite closely together, room never felt too cramped. Hotel had a nice feel to it and friendly staff. Other Paris hotels I've stayed at have been either too far away, too grungy, not good value for money, too small or too sterile. Hotel Brittanique was none of those things and also located on a quiet street so no noise issues. Only negative I can think of is that breakfast was not included. I paid €230 per night which isn't ridiculous for Paris but certainly isn't cheap either. Breakfast was an additional €14/person so we chose to go to the boulangerie around the corner instead.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: snspencer
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Britannique and will definitely stay there again! The staff was helpful and shared in our excitement from the time we walked through the door. The front desk team went out of their way to make our stay special when they found out it was our honeymoon. The first night we were upgraded to the presidential suite - it was fantastic! It was not available the rest of the week, though we would have loved to stay in it the remainder of our stay. It was very spacious with 1.5 baths and a view of the street below. We didn't hear any outside/hallway noise when sleeping. The remaining 3 nights we were in a deluxe room and the day manager surprised us with rose petals, bouquets of roses, and chocolate. This room was very comfortable and offered space to move around. I loved the rain shower heads in the bathrooms and the geraniums outside our windows. The location of the hotel is outstanding! We walked or took the metro station a couple of blocks away - perfect for us. This was a great find for us - a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, breakfast, and location. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JT88
Reviews.Content: We booked a Standard Double Room but we also added their Romantic Package (60euros) which provides a free upgrade if available, so our room may have been upgraded to a classic king. In any case, room was very very clean as was the bathroom. Nice hot shower. Quiet. Wifi internet was fast enough that I was able to use Skype on my mobile phone with little problems! Downside of the internet was that you had to use a long-randomly generated password given to you from the front desk, and their router kills your connection with inactivity so if you use your mobile phone to connect to the wifi, it'll drop out if you don't use the internet for a few minutes and you have to log back in with a long annoying password. Front desk however had no problems giving us multiple passwords since we had 3 devices (laptop, 2 cellphones). Bed was comfortable. View from the miniterrace was really nice. We really enjoyed the romantic package and thought it was worth it with the half-sized champagne, wonderful heart-shaped container of chocolates, and rose petals/flowers scattered in the room/showers. Scented candles were also placed around as was a nice basket of fruit. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary (4th!) there and had informed the hotel staff at time of booking, and there was a wonderful 'congraulations/happy anniversary' card waiting for us with our romantic package, but the card had a picture of a woman and man kissing in front of a Paris montage which we found humourous given that we are a same-sex male couple. Not totally their fault as I didn't go out of my way to point that out during booking (despite our names being James and Geoff), but given their proximity to the Marais (gay) district I'd suggest they should use genderless congratulation cards instead (ie. cards without photos of couples) to cover all their bases. Location was fantastic - right across the street from the Chatalet-Les-Halles metro stop, and walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and Marais district (the main gay village). Breakfast was also wonderful - good plentiful supply of hot and cold foods, cheeses, espresso machine with I think 12 different types of insertable espresso coffee picks. The hotel's front door is locked at night and one night we got home late and had to ring the bell. The only downside of the hotel was that I found myself wishing I had access to some sort of gym or workout room. We had brought our own pushup bars but cold barely find any floor-space to use them. Would we stay here again? Probably. But if we could find a discounted rate that was similar to Hotel Britannique's at one of the large chains (ie. W, Intercontinental) I think we might consider giving that a try as well.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately stay here again and again and again..."”
Reviews.Author: jof58
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a most memorable and absolutely wonderful,wonderful stay!I was a little apprehensive staying in Paris on my own and a lot jet lagged when I arrived on the doorstep of the Britannique but on entering the hotel I felt I had immediately made the right choice with my hotel booking!The staff were extremely helpful with not only my check in but also with helping me find places to eat(the location of this hotel is amazing! so close to Rue de Rivoli shopping,Chatalet metro,the Seine,Bistros...),locating a battery for my camera,and dealing with my transfers as well as graciously tolerating my attempts at speaking French..It was also my birthday early that week and they had decorated my room on arrival with rose petals,a complimentary fruit basket and a birthday card!That and the fact that when I opened my 2 windows I looked to the left and saw the Hotel de Ville and then to my right was the Eiffel Tower...I didn't want to leave my room!Room service was excellent as was the buffet breakfast.I didn't feel rushed to finish and both the breakfast room and lounge were very elegant and beautifully furnished ...especiallly the red dining room where I used the laptop provided with free wifi each night.The hotel being small was very intimate which I liked very much after all the hustle and bustle of the Paris streets.I would definately stay here again and again and again..."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mb_private
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for all the key tourist sites. Less than one block from Metro for easy access. Hotel itself is cosy and intimate. Never had breakfast as there are loads of cafe's within 5 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!!”
Reviews.Author: betsykNYC
Reviews.Content: A wonderful find...based on everyone's comments from Trip Advisor. We could not have stayed in a more friendly, conveniently-located, and charming hotel. Wonderful and helpful staff, cozy, immaculate rooms and overall the best! Will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome choice, location and service”
Reviews.Author: CanadianAlandLori
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Britannique on a solo visit to Paris. Location, can't say enough. Two blocks from Louvre, walking distance to absolutely every other major attraction. The rooms were exactly as pictured on this website, cute and clean. I had a single, facing the river side and it was noisey until about 11 at night and then quited right down. Bathrooms were clean and well appointed, with lots of room for all of my "girl stuff". Staff were fantastic (all but one at check in) and spoke perfect english. I took the train from CDG, got off at the Les Halles station and only had to walk a few blocks to find the hotel. Suggestion. Buy a Paris Pass. For no other reason then it gets you past the line ups at all the major attractions. Every Museum / Gallery had what I would guess to have been a several hour line-up and with my Paris Pass I sailed right in. Ask someone official, showing them you pass and they will point you to the special entrance...it's not well marked. I also used my pass to hop on and off the "hop on and off bus tour" just to get around. If I was at the Champs Elysees and had sore feet, on the red bus I jumped and it took me almost right to my hotel (stopped at the Louvre of course). Eating in Paris was a bit tough for a single person, I hated taking a table all for myself during the very important dinner hour. Nice thing is the hotel has a great breakfast and lunch was easy. I kept some emergency rations in my room just in case. Last piece of advise, unless your a real museum / art lover, 4 days in Paris is plenty. I stayed 6 and it was too long. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “A balcony with a view.”
Reviews.Author: HMM2011
Reviews.Content: After a rather terrifying cab ride from CDG, (pedestrians beware; taxis rocket through the streets, squeeze into lanes that give scant inches leeway, and will merely honk - not slow down - when you're in their way), we were very relieved to arrive at Hotel Britannique. I chose this hotel because of it's location in the Premiere arrondissement and the possibility of getting a balcony room. We were slightly disappointed to find ourselves assigned to a Queen room because they didn't have any Kings available. It was our honeymoon and we wanted everything to be perfect, and we're both very tall, (yes our feet hung off the edge of the Queen bed). There was only room for my husband and our luggage in the tiny elevator, so I offered to walk up the 5 flights of stairs to reach our room and just meet him there. The stairs were fine and not too treacherous, but I was a little breathless when we opened up our door to reveal... the tiniest little room I've ever stayed in. We purchased the "Romance Package" so we had rose petals on our bed, rose vases and candles around the room, a small bottle of champagne and a basket of fruit. It was a lovely presentation and I found myself not feeling quite so disappointed with the petite room size. The bathroom was immaculately clean and very serviceable, again resulting in a feeling of "this isn't so bad." We sidled along the edges of the bed to reach our balcony and viola, there was the city! GORGEOUS! We could see the Eiffel Tower to the west and in the east, a stone angel guarding the bridge to the Isle de la Cité. Don't get me wrong; this is not an unobstructed view. You're a block away from the Seine but you can't see it, the Eiffel tower is small vertical line in the distance, and your best view is of the treetops on the street below and the large building across. However, it was still quite lovely and we found the gargoyles on the building across very charming, quite enjoyed the trees waving in the breeze, and liked hearing the voices and laughter emerging from the restaurants below. We loved having our wine on the balcony reveling in the warm Parisian summer nights. I highly recommend this hotel for tourists (especially those who don't speak French), who would like to be within walking and biking distance to many of the main tourist attractions. We biked to the Eiffel Tower, walked up to the Arc de Triomphe, down Champs Elesées, saw the Grand and Petit Palais, the Louvre, boated on the Seine, climbed to the top of Notre-Dame, strolled the Luxembourg garden, and much much more. All are fairly close to the hotel, but you can rent bikes or catch the Metro if you're not up for all the walking. Believe me, after our first day of walking the city we were absolutely waiting for the elevator, and we quickly tossed out our reticence of sharing such a tight space with strangers. You can fit 4 people in there if you're literally chest to chest! We did not partake of the hotel's continental breakfast until our last day. There are plenty of restaurants close by and we didn't see the need until we realized everything was still closed in the early morning and we had a plane to catch. We were pleasantly surprised. It wasn't the best breakfast we had, but it certainly wasn't the worst! The food was fresh, hot and convenient. In retrospect, we probably would have eaten there a few times and saved ourselves some of the not-so-good breakfast experiences. We asked the hotel to set up a taxi for us the night before, but it wasn't there at the specified time. The staff were very quick to get things straightened out, but I'd recommend following up with them about an hour before it's supposed to arrive. I found myself oddly disappointed at the rather sedate cab ride back to the airport, but it's still a good idea to line up your transport ahead of time rather than relying on hailing a taxi at the last minute. We had an absolutely lovely time at this hotel. Overall: it's a good value, especially if you get a balcony. If you're looking for lots of amenities, you won't find them here. But if you're primary concerns are location, convenience, cleanliness and courtesy, then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: torontoana
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here last week and it was perfect for us! We especially enjoyed how close it was to everything without being 'too close'. It's in the Chatelet area which couldn't be more central. 5 min (max) walk to Notre Dame, the river, all major train and subway lines, shopping on Rue Rivolli, the Louvre etc. I have stayed in Paris before and this was far better value for the money. We paid 230Euro per night for a good sized room with two twin beds. It wasn't huge but enough closet space and room for all our stuff. The bathroom was quite generously appointed and the whole place was very clean and fresh. The staff are very attentive and helpful. The breakfast was 14Euro each per day so we skipped it and had breakfast at a great little Boulangerie about 40 steps outside the hotel. The free WiFi was good and the TV had decent channels. It was quiet at night and the room, despite facing a courtyard had a lot of light.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, quiet”
Reviews.Author: 001Slo
Reviews.Content: The beds are comfortable, and the location is quiet while convenient, especially to the louvre. The staff was competent and helpful. The room we had was small, but others were smaller. Still, we slept with the windows open in a very busy part of Paris and were never disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the 1st.”
Reviews.Author: oliverandharry
Reviews.Content: Chosen because of prior TA reviews, Hotel Brittanque does not disappoint. We were first timers to Paris, so to be a block from the Seine, two blocks to Notre Dame and close to the Pont Neuf was perfect for us. We did choose a larger king room, beautiful furnishings and wonderful large, spotless bath. Lovely to have fresh, delicious fruit when we arrived. Gorgeous common lounge room, with a free computer for guest use. I particularly would acknowledge the front desk staff who answered every question, gave us great ideas and were always cheerful and tolerant of my French. We never strayed far for an evening meal - the streets bordering Ave Victoria have delicious offerings, and the boulangerie around the corner is a must. Thank you all for a truly wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price for a Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angel9096
Reviews.Content: Hospitality of the front desk staff was excellent. A young man worked with me for a time to get my ipad online. The room, although small, represented good value for the money. Decor is charming. Bathroom updated.Loved the room darkening shades and the terry cloth robes. Enjoyed breakfast in the cozy breakfast room. Enjoyed sitting in the British style parlour room. Location is ideal-walking distance from Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. Can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: BhmAL
Reviews.Content: Great location, very helpful staff, excellent room. This was the start of a long business/holiday family trip to France and it set the bar very high for the remainder of our time. It was an excellent introduction.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOTEL IN THIS PRICE RANGE”
Reviews.Author: europetravelerUSA
Reviews.Content: You cannot find a better location in this price range with such charming decor and friendly people at the desk! I've stayed here before and think this is the best place in this price range that I've stayed in over 30 years of travel to France. Also, the breakfast is excellent--buffet style in the manner that you would find in Vienna. I highly recommend it and my traveling colleagues were also completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: amt55
Reviews.Content: This friendly and comfortable hotel is ideally situated for visiting Notre Dame, the Left Bank and the Centre Pompidou. The staff are knowledgeable and welcoming, in English and French. The hotel serves a very good breakfast, and for all other meals there is a great choice of bars, cafes and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The rooms are not large but provide everything that a visitor needs for comfort, convenience and a good night's sleep, including very efficient air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nevers
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, close to everything and a major metro station. Staff was very helpful. Rooms are small but very comfortable. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good as expected”
Reviews.Author: aussie5514
Reviews.Content: Reviews lived up to my expectations of this hotel. Excellent location in a quiet street. Walking distance to many attractions. Staff polite and friendly. Only comment is that it appears that they will not let you into your room before the checkin time but you can store luggage. It may be that rooms are not ready but at other hotels I have often been allowed into the room early if it is ready. Not a big deal though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, quiet and location!”
Reviews.Author: KinRMCA
Reviews.Content: After a short stay at HB last fall, my wife and I were able to spend 8 nights there just recently. As everyone points out, the location is optimal, the rooms clean and nice (and large enough) and the staff excellent and helpful. Returning to the hotel each night after long days of walking, shopping and seeing the sites felt like coming home. The staff was helpful throughout the trip, helping us with restaraunt suggestions and making the arrangements for our trip back to CDG. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: GothicTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was recently there for research on a school trip and was amazed by the service of Hotel Britanique. The rooms were always clean, the breakfast was awesome, and the staff--Wow, I cant say enough wonderful things about them. They went out of their way to help plan a transportation route for my room mate and I, and anytime we needed help with our French they would take the time to help us. The hotel is small, but I think that's what makes it seem more like staying family than at a hotel. And as other travelers have stated, it's within walking distance of some of the main attractions (Notre Dame Cathedral, Louve...ect), as well as some great places to eat! I would most definitely stay there again, and would recommend anyone going to Paris to stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aahaddon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Britannique for 3 nights. We arrived about 9:30am and we stored our luggage in their storage room and when we came back at 1 pm our room was ready. We stayed in Room 55. The lift was quite snug but adequate. A fruit basket was provided. The bed was extremely comfy and the bathroom was very nice. The window looked out into a tiny courtyard and allow nice natural light in. The hotel has a lovely lounging room downstairs and is cozy and pleasant. The reception folks were very accommodating. This little hotel is located on a quiet little street about a block from the Seine and 2 blocks from Notre Dame and only a 2 minute walk to the Metro. The decor mixes French and English styling nicely with lots of JMW Turner prints. Nice touch; umbrellas are provided. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, lovely rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_JaneK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fantastic location. Easy walking distance to Louvre, Pompidou, Tuilleries, great shopping and of course wonderful restaurants. Rooms were not huge but extremely comfortable, nice furnishing and decent sized bathroom. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, all spoke excellent english. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends. We didn't eat at the hotel, opted for breakfast around the corner at one of the many boulangeries. The hotel breakfast setup did look nice though. Wonderful room to come back and relax in after a day sightseeing in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “It Was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sparkledallas
Reviews.Content: Very quaint, lovely, clean hotel on a side street near the Seine, Notre Dame, and too many other noteworthy sites to mention at this time. The staff was superb, friendly, and always most helpful. We felt safe and loved the location. There wasn't anything missing in order to make our trip complete. I highly recommend staying here. We met many great people while staying here and I have every intention of staying here next time I visit Paris. As I said -- it was PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: annemarie1980
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a 5 day trip to Paris. Staying at your hotel was the best thing we could have done! We had a wonderful room with small balcony, which we loved! It was our honeymoon and our room looked lovely with the flowers, chocolates and fruit...a real surprise! We will tell everybody about your lovely hotel and hope to stay there again when we'll have our anniversary! Kind regards, Annemarie and Hugo

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient, and clean”
Reviews.Author: rickdare
Reviews.Content: In June 2011, my partner and I stayed at this top notch boutique hotel in the 1st arrondisement on a beautiful, quiet, tree-lined street one block from the Seine. Our "standard double" was tiny but immaculately clean and included a small balcony with table and 2 chairs overlooking the leafy green street scene 2 floors below. Located a few blocks from the Chatelet/Les Halles train station, it was perfect for our sightseeing in Paris and the day trips we took by rail. We paid 198 euros without breakfast (relatively inexpensive for Paris), but there are boulangeries and supermarkets nearby for quick breakfast supplies. An added plus is that because the hotel caters to English-speakers, there was never any problem or embarrassment communicating when our few phrases of French failed us. There is a free laptop for guests' use in the parlor, but we found the internet connection spotty -- sometimes it worked and sometimes it didn't.

Reviews.Title: “We always feel welcome at Britannique”
Reviews.Author: barbgoodkin
Reviews.Content: When we visited again in May we felt like we had never left, even though it had been two years. Everyone was warm and welcoming and made sure our visit was pleasant. The location is ideal for those who like to walk in Paris. Rooms are not large, but one doesn't visit Paris to sit in the hotel room. Buffet breakfast is wonderful, too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannique......should be Hotel Fantastique!!!”
Reviews.Author: shoefreak
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two night/three day trip to Paris with my daughter, mum and mum in law. I reserched many hotels and finally chose the Hotel Britannique from the tripadvisor comments.....I wasn't dissapointed...This is an amazing hotel for it's rating. On arrival at 11.30am, we were pleased to find one of our rooms was already available, which meant we could leave our luggage and get changed...we had rooms 2 and 3 just up a few stairs from reception...great because the lift is very small. The room was immaculate and a good size with a good sized bathroom over looking the ave. victoria. Fresh fruit was left plus a courtesy tray of tea, coffee and water. Staff at this hotel are friendly, knowledgable and professional. Nothing was too much trouble. Even when a strange noise was coming from a wardrobe the engineer was sent immediately!!! The rooms are very quiet and windows have been soundproofed, however, Friday nights get very roudy in the bar across the road so be prepared...I always use earplugs anyway!!! Also the only negative is that the walls are quite thin and u can hear the people next door...my two mums in my case so i could tell then to keep it down!!! :) Just to point out...the room was a good size for Europe. Visitors from the USA will feel that they are small, but they are larger that most i have stayed in! Breakfast is not cheap at 14 euros, however, it is plentiful with lots of choices. Croissant, Brioche, Toast, cheese, ham, scrambled eggs, sausage, yoghurts..also a choice of juices, tea and coffee. Just to finish..there was no probs with the WiFi, or the laptop in the lounge..used both with no probs at all.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Masstravelers4
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from the staff. We could walk out the door and be at key spots on the Seine in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory - would be glad to return”
Reviews.Author: joehearst
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable, with good bed and plenty of hot water. English-speaking staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. They found several things for me in Paris, and printed Google maps to the places. Location is excellent - on five Metro lines, close to a taxi stand, and a ten minute walk from the Louvre and the Left Bank. Good restaurants very close also, though one should have a reservation (which hotel staff will make for one.) They serve a huge English-style breakfast with good scrambled eggs! A few nits: like most hotels of its class there is no good reading chair or light, and the elevator is very slow to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Schwodda
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more pricey than I usually stay in, but the location couldn't have been better. We loved the little cafe around the corner. Our room wasn't ready at check in time (previous tenants wouldn't leave!) so they comped breakfast the next day.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rvb10
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel stay on a 3 country 8 city tour of Europe and what a delight it was to find such a wonderful nugget from the beginning. Any accolades given to the staff would be grossly understated. There is nothing that you could want or need that they will not deliver and they do it with a happy and pleasant attitude. Now, I know that the rooms are small, but how much time do you really spend in your room in a city with all of the charm and ambiance of Paris? The hotel is centrally positioned near a major Metro station that will connect you to anywhere in the city. It is walking distance to the Louvre, Opera house and ½ block from the Seine. Since Paris is our favorite city in Europe we will certainly return and we would not even consider staying anywhere other than Hotel Britannique. Oh, by the way, if your visit is with that special someone definitely consider purchasing the romantic package for 60 euros. It’s worth every penny. Also, I know that the management team reads these reviews so I will apologize for leaving with the key tassel and return it by mail.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simplegifts
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel more highly. First of all the location is fantastic, a few blocks from the Louvre in the 1st Arrondissement, but yet on a quiet little side street with almost no noise. Indeed we were amazed on exiting the metro (half a block away) to find ourselves on one of Paris's most bustling shopping streets. We walked to almost every attraction and restaurant we wanted to (including the Orsay, Notre Dame, the Latin quarter, etc.), and took the Metro to the rest. The staff couldn't have been more welcoming or helpful (only suggestion - they didn't seem to know much about area restaurants). The breakfast was lovely and ended up being less expensive than eating at nearbye bistros. The room was indeed small by American standards (but no smaller than those in NY or DC that we've stayed in) and immaculately clean and very pretty. Bathroom was new and sparkling. Only qualm is that the bathtub is not for the elderly or faint of heart as the sides were quite steep and a bit difficult to get into, but again that seemed to be standard wherever we went.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and good charm”
Reviews.Author: rossharris
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location for the purpose of our trip. We only had three days in Paris and I wanted to give my girlfriend a "taste" of Paris. This hotel being six blocks from the Louvre and 4 blocks from Notre Dame, did great. A few tips on the area: -There is a great pastry shop which is just around the corner from the hotel. Go west on Victoria, take a right. It is 2-3 doors down. I found it the last day. This saved my gaining 5 more lbs. -The Cafe Zimmer on the corner does a great job. Don't pass it up just because it is in a high traffic area. -Two blocks down Ave Victoria to the east is a cafe on the corner with a Crepe stand facing the intersection. For the love of mike...get a Banana Nutella crepe for yourself. The hotel room pricing is typical Paris pricing for a great locale. That is...high The hotel offers free Wi-Fi. It is slow as Christmas. We had lots of trouble trying to Skype calls home. The rooms are quite small as you would expect from a small Parisian hotel. Get ready to be very close with your partner, should you have one. There is a bar across the street that gets really loud at night on the weekends. If you are staying over a weekend, you may want to consider a high room to avoid the noise. The staff is quite friendly and helpful with any needs that you may have. They even do a nice romance package, if that is your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: deysjy
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff, excellent location, very comfortable and appointed room, good breakfast. It was a good choice and have rebooked

Reviews.Title: “I love the Hotel Britannique!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel222
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Paris (and Europe). My experience with the Hotel Britannique was so wonderful that i want to share it with others. Finding a great hotel in Paris was a bit intimidating for me because i am completely unfamiliar with the neighborhoods, the standards of European hotels, etc Hotel rooms are very important to me......cleanliness comes first....but I also want a room that is pretty, comfortable, and affordable. Since the George V and the Ritz were not in my budget, I relied upon the reviews in TA and chose the Britannique. The location is about 50 feet from a Metro stop (but I do not recommend the Metro...a bit confusing and scary. It is one block from the Seine and the bridge by Notre Dame. And, there is a delicious pastry shop just around the corner from the hotel. The hotel is small and lovely as was our room (we booked the smallest room.) If your budget allows, I recommend booking a larger room so that you will be more comfortable during your stay (our friends with children had a large room that was decorated the same as ours, just had more space for luggage, etc). The two rooms I saw were immaculate and pretty (the bedrooms and bathrooms.) The entire staff was pleasant and helpful Of particular note are Wolf, the gentleman at the front desk in the evening....extremely kind and helpful.....and the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Ever”
Reviews.Author: samanthalynn15
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here for our honeymoon and the hotel was perfect! Clean, beautiful, great location! Would def. return.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and lovely”
Reviews.Author: NurseEmily
Reviews.Content: Aesthetically, this hotel is very pretty, beautifully decorated, and CLEAN. The rooms are a bit small (as you come to expect in any European city) but most (if not all) rooms have large, tall windows that open wide to see and hear the street below. It was a little loud at times (restaurant across the street, cars and motorcycles going by) but with the window closed you couldn't hear a thing. The hotel is right across the street from a metro. This particular metro station has a lot of trains going through so it is a little confusing as to what exit to get out of the metro to get to the hotel at first. The hotel is a short walk from the Seine and Notre Dame, close to many restaurants of differing price range and in a very safe neighborhood. There is a sweet little cafe around the corner from the hotel for croissants and espresso. We really enjoyed coming "home" to this hotel after a long day of walking around. Don't bother splurging for a room with a balcony we we did. The balcony is so small and can barely fit a table and chairs and it isn't comfortable staying out there for very long. The big open windows are charming enough. The wireless connection wasn't that great from our room, the connection kept going in and out, but they did have a laptop for patron use in the lounge/sitting area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: NaomiNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides excellent value. Location is perfect. We could either walk everywhere(Notre Dame, Beaubourg, Louvre, Ile St. Louis, Boulevard St. Michel) or take the metro, which was steps away. Also, a taxi stand is across the street; ask the desk. We emailed early asking for early check-in and received back prompt reply saying yes. Upon arrival before ten a. m. after evening flight from U. S., our room was ready. The service was excellent. All staff spoke English and were eager to help with any questions. Room was small but that's typical for this city and was certainly adequate and attractive. Large umbrellas available in lobby. I didn't try the breakfast but if you want to save money, skip it as it cost over twenty dollars! If you want quiet you can ask for a back room as I did. This hotel lacked nothing and cost less than it should have!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Paulhfischer
Reviews.Content: Such a wonderful hotel. Great location just minutes from the louvre. The breakfast superb, very comfortable and I loved the staff. Friendly and helpful. Would stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and beautiful decor..”
Reviews.Author: lollygobbleblissbom
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful with holding a booking for friends who had been delayed by ill health. The location is excellent so convenient to most attractions within the cbd of Paris. The rooms were small but beautifully furnished and all very French.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Rhona56_4
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was first class. The hotel staff were so helpful and friendly, our room was on the top floor very comfortable and so quiet at night. We enjoyed our trip to Paris and will not hesitate to recommend the hotel and next time we visit will stay there again. Breakfast was very good and the service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gem in the heart of the 1st”
Reviews.Author: Muhlyssa
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of one negative thing to say about this hotel. The location cannot be beat. It's close to the Louvre, two different Metro stops and tons of buses. The room was very comfortable and quiet. The staff was exemplary on every level, everyone spoke English and was very helpful. The hotel is quaint and homey. Our bed was comfortable. Yes, the room and bathroom was small (by American hotel room standards) but it's to be expected unless you stay in an American chain hotel and spend twice as much. The breakfast (sometimes included in your room rate) was a great buffet that included breads, pastries, yogurt, a meat and cheese selection, fruit, fruit juices, eggs, sausage, cereal, coffees, espresso. It was great to start the day not having to worry about finding breakfast and the dining room was a great place to meet your fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Fossetti
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a place--terrific location, lovely sitting area, beautiful and clean rooms, outstanding breakfast, nice staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay and would go back in a heartbeat. We were celebrating a major wedding anniversary and the hotel provided treats which were greatly appreciated. After many trips to Paris and hotel experiences that did not add to the pleasure of such a wonderful city, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioned paradise in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: DEGSeattle
Reviews.Content: PROS: Air conditioner that worked perfectly -- amazingly! Fantastic breakfest buffet. Shower with a curtain! Plush towels and bathrobe. Excellent location. Large room, comfortable bed, blackout shades. Free internet. CONS: Flat pillows. Toilet splashes all over the rim of the seat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, extremely helpful staff in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: stevegrant76
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. We asked about booking in at a restaurant for the evening and they took care of arranging that for us. It was my wife's birthday and in the room they had left her chocolates, a fruit basket and a personalised card, which was extremely nice of them. The room itself had a balcony and a lovely view of the nearby area of Paris. My only complaint is the décor of the room, the reason being my wife like it so much that she wants the same at home and it will cost me a fortune. No complaints at all in reality! The room was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean and pretty spacious for Paris. The bed was very, very comfortable and we had two great nights sleep. The breakfast is self service, but is excellent and worth having. The location is great for Notre Dame and the Louvre and the Metro is seconds away, but you can really walk to almost anywhere from there in good weather. We had a perfect stay and thank you to the staff of Hotel Britannique.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home In Paris”
Reviews.Author: GotDrums
Reviews.Content: When first searching for a hotel in Paris I found this little gem with big service on Trip Advisor. One thing that concerned me was the reviews on the size of the rooms. Once arriving at the Hotel Britannique my fears were instantly quenched because it was like walking into my home. The decor was almost as beautiful as the staff here. Two real shining stars in the Paris universe were Aimie and Audrey. The whole staff was great but these two really stood out. They instantly made myself and my wife at home. When staying here you have to consider this as your home with a lovely living room that you can find quiet tranquility in and a very nice dining room where you can enjoy a wonderful breakfast to start your day off every morning with great choice's of food as well as a wonderful choice of cheese and breads. Well worth the minimal charge. The beds were to die for very soft and always got a good night sleep. Make sure you get a room with a balcony it overlooks the beautiful Ave Victoria and its really like being in a movie it it so picturesque. Also make sure if you are spending a romantic time with your loved one make sure you order the romantic package. Well worth the very small price which you get back alone from the product you are served . I took pictures but I'm sworn to secrecy by the staff (not really) not to show how they decorate your room. Well I choose not to show the pictures so your loved one will be surprised. Trust me though its a great value and worth every penny. The location is perfect and you are also near at least 2 grocery stores where you can buy water and food. Many places to eat within walking distance as well from bistros to fine dining. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to the Louvre as well as about 10 to walk to Notre Dame and the Left Bank. Its really the best location you could possibly have in Paris. Again you are made to feel like this is your home what kind of price tag can you put on that?I cannot say enough about this place. Both my wife and I were genuinely sad when we had to leave here. You can really tell the owner genuinely cares. Read some of the older (2006 and on) reviews. The problems bought up in the reviews have all been addressed and taken care of and are no longer a problem. This shows a great spirit of entrepreneurship and shows the owner cares about your stay in his fine hotel. Please keep in mind its not out of sorts to remember to bring a gift when you stay there (not that its required). Might I suggest some fine macaroons from Laudree if you visit there. The staff loves them. Again Hotel Britannique we already miss you and we will be back. Thank you Aimie and Audrey and the rest of the staff for making us feel so much at home on our first trip to Paris. And thank you for making myself and my wife's anniversary such a memorable one. Now we can truly say. "Ahhh we'll always have Paris. Your hotel is truly the heart of this fine city. Tim and Donna

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: svbur
Reviews.Content: We took the RER (train) from CDG without a problem and the location of the Britannique is perfectly central to seeing Paris. The rooms were very nice - large for Paris and the staff was very helpful. Bus 69 is close by and gives a quick tour of Paris on the way to the Eiffel Tower. After buying a carnet, our teenage grandghildren wanted to use the bus system even more than the metro so they could see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Julia7UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were very satisfied overall. It was actually our honeymoon and the hotel had made our room very welcoming - with flowers, a basket of fruit, chocolates and a half bottle of good champagne as gifts. The room was quite small (to be expected in Paris I think), but nicely decorated. The position of the hotel is very convenient - only a few metres from Place du Chatelet metro. However, it's so close to many of the major attractions e.g. Notre Dame, Louvre, that we walked to most. Our only grumble was with the bed! It was a latex mattress - comfortable in itself but 'sweaty' and then to compound that problem it had a plastic mattress protector on top. Ugh! I know why hotels use them - but I wish they wouldn't!

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel with an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tsamh
Reviews.Content: This is a charming, small. simple hotel. The desk staff is helpful and speaks excellent English but the scope of their services and advice is pretty limited, i.e., not like a conseirge desk that will make restaurant recommendations or other types of arrangements. The rooms, like the lobby, are small and simple. We had various mechanical problems in three different rooms, e.g., an air conditioning unit that leaked water all over our clothes in the closet, a second a/c that rattled annoyingly and a portable shower head that kept slipping off the wall. The best thing about this hotel is the location which is walking distance to Notre Dame, Latin Quarter, the Louvre and the Chatelet Metro stop, which is a crossroads for north-south and east-west subways. The worst things about this hotel (typical of small ones) are the room size, limited services and inability to respond quickly to mechanical issues.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Elena_A13
Reviews.Content: Kind warm atmosphere of old Britain in the center of Paris. Small rooms with all you need to enjoy the trip. Сompetent and friendly personnel. Many little things which made the rest comfortable. Minute on foot to the metro-station, close to Louvre, Notre-Dam, Hotel de Ville. Nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: MKaforey
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Paris. It was our first visit to Paris and we plan to visit every year!! The hotel is located in the heart of the city. There are three Metro entrances just steps away from the hotel. There are numerous cafes/restaurants in a two block radius. And all were very good. The Seine river and the famous book sellers are only a block away. And we walked to many of the famous locations - Notre-Dame, Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, and more. We never ate breakfast at the hotel as we found the MOST fabulous patissiere shop just around the corner from the hotel. FABULOUS cappuccino, freshly squeezed orange juice, and the pasteries...to die for!!! The rooms were good size for being in Paris (as space is a premium). Many amenities. The staff is knowledgable and helpful. There is a money exchange place a few blocks away (do NOT use the one in the Notre-Dame area - they give you 10% less than other places). We had a balcony off our room with a bistro set...we used it many times to enjoy the sounds of the city or to eat. For our first visit it was perfect!! We plan to return to the same hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Giocomatavu
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, location, comfort. You can see the accuracy and the love that the staff use in managing the hotel. The best: the breakfast, including a coffee selection really unique in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “We had a most wonderful stay at The Brittanique”
Reviews.Author: fed57
Reviews.Content: Our room had very tasteful French flare, was small but spotlessly clean, which is a priority for us. Breakfast was delicious and convenient for us. The hotel location is very convenient to major sites; we walked everywhere. And, an evening stroll on the Seine....what more is there? The staff was marvelous...friendly, helpful and accomodating. We will stay again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception, central location, relaxing calm stay”
Reviews.Author: RMason_11
Reviews.Content: We were made very welcome during our 4-day stay - the suite was so restful- quiet and cosy. The staff provided a complementary surprise package in the suite for our 25th wedding anniversary. Location is great for visiting all the main attractions. Breakfast is served in a small dining room - clean, warm tones; nice buffet selection, particularly the French cheeses.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMM1109
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated to see many of the sites in Paris. The staff is very nice and very helpful. Although our room was small ( many in Paris are), it was perfect for our stay with lovely linens and a nice size bathroom. The sitting room and breakfast rooms are warm and inviting. The buffet breakfast had a wonderful selection of food, teas and juice. How nice it was to receive a fresh fruit platter upon our arrival and the fruit was fresh and delicous.

Reviews.Title: “My first trip to Paris was incredible, thanks in part to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FIlmGirl55
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris, and after thorough research, I am upon this hotel in a books and websites, and looked it for 5 nights, and I was not disappointed. The location is outstanding (2 minutes from Notre Dame, 5 from the the Louvre, 2 from Pont Neuf), and the staff are always friendly and helpful. Also, I only speak English, so it was wonderful that all the staff were fluent in English. The room was lovely, and I was provided with many small touches that made my stay that much more pleasurable. I really enjoyed this hotel, and simply wanted to pass the message along.

Reviews.Title: “Over all nice place but just for a couple of days.”
Reviews.Author: robert4704
Reviews.Content: Rooms too small for more than a couple of days. Paris is so expensive anyway you would do better to see the rest of France.

Reviews.Title: “A 'diamond' of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaPearl
Reviews.Content: During our two night stay, we were so impressed by the staff, who were so very friendly and extremely efficient. We were celebrating a special occasion, and got very spoilt! Our room had a little balcony with a table and chairs, which looked out over Paris, a lovely place to sit and watch the world go by. The room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean {as is the rest of the hotel}, lovely crisp cotton sheets on the bed which you could just sink into it was very comfortable, it was well equipped with anything you could want, and a lovely bathroom and plenty of wardrobe space. Breakfast was excellent with fresh breads, a good choice of croissants, cheeses, cold meats and very fresh fruit and cereals. Set in a perfect place to sight see as it is on two Metro stations and has so many lovely eateries all within walking distance of the hotel. We can't wait to return, and hope to do so in the very near future. Thank you to all at the Hotel Brittanique for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “Most definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: beyondflowers
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, beautiful building, clean, courteous and friendly staff, excellent breakfast. Most importantly, clean and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in an excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: Sanskemp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is traditional in style and very comfortable. I had what i think they call a "classic" double room, with a bath (I asked for this particularly because I don't like showers). It overlooked the street, but the Avenue Victoria is not busy so there was no problem with noise. The hotel's situation is very convenient indeed. You are just across the river from the Sainte Chapelle and the Conciergerie, with Notre Dame a little further away. The Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay and the Pompidou Centre (if you are into modern art) are easy walking away, and there is an entrance to Chatelet Metro station just across the road. The staff are pleasant and helpful and there is free wi fi for the use of clients (if you don't have your own computer with you, there is one available for use in the lounge). Of course, in this situation eating and drinking places abound in the vicinity. Speaking of which, breakfast is fine: I've known more lavish breakfasts, but for 13 euros it is good value. Altogether a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful quiet charming hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: NTP55
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel and location, just as advertised, staff helpful and friendly, within short walking dictance of enough main sites to make this the ideal base for your trip, cannot wait to return and won't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little gem of a hotel, with a great location”
Reviews.Author: fran09090
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly, helpful and professional. The hotel is clean and charming. My room was very pleasant with lots of light and able to open windows if warm. The beds ( twin bedded room) were very comfortable and the linens were lovely against the skin. Good closet space for 2 and a safe. Good breakfast to start the day. Requests for anything additional were responded to with gracious speed.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin-Todd
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the hotel and the service was superb! The staff is refined and attentive, always eager to assist. The housekeeping staff was also most excellent and the rooms wonderfully maintained. Quite simply, a great value, a great location and great service. Looking forward to returning this summer on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking and start booking”
Reviews.Author: Stefan14
Reviews.Content: This hotel breaths quality and romance. The interior, the rooms, the staff, the breakfest. Wow. If you travel with your partner and look for a romantic weekend you can stop looking and start booking. I doubt you will find a better hotel for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and a very warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: GAB056
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well situated for visiting many of Paris' great tourist sites. The hotels staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms lovely and clean. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, French ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Raffaraf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights on a business trip. I was very positively impressed. The location was perfect, very central (close to Chatelet), yet peaceful as the hotel is located in a side road. The atmosphere is very cosy and French. Rooms are small, but everything you need is there, especially free wi-fi access. The only disappointment was for me the quality of their breakfast. Not very fresh and not a particularly varied choice of food. French croissants were not there either. So that aspect can be hugely improved. Staff was very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great room, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TraceyBee67
Reviews.Content: Such a nice place and will definitely go back. I'm so glad I checked on Trip Advisor and found it, and wanted to add to all the nice comments so that someone else is persuaded to go too!

Reviews.Title: “great location in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: annhig
Reviews.Content: Sadly we only had two nights here but would happily return for a longer stay. For the price, the hotel facilities are very good - we had a room overlooking the street with no street noise at all, small balcony with a roof-top view of the Hotel de Ville, bathrobes, and joy of joys for Brits - a kettle, milk, and tea. Oh yes, and a very welcome fruit bowl.The hotel was spotless and the staff very friendly and helpful. But perhaps better than all of this was the position - very close to the metro, with loads of restaurants and many major sights within walking distance. A definite hit.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of charm, comfort and character”
Reviews.Author: aplondon
Reviews.Content: I booked Britannique for a surprise trip to Paris to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. We were not disappointed. The staff were friendly, efficient and not only upgraded us to a kingsize room with a street view but added a few little extras gifts to the champagne I had ordered. The rooms aren't huge, but they well laid out, attractively furnished and very comfortable - and I'm very fussy about the quality of matresses, pillows and sheets. We liked the fluffy towels and robes in the bathroom, and the small tub (as well as shower) was a bonus. The public areas are similarly cozy - a small lounge with squishy red sofas is great for relaxing with a coffee. It is in a central location near the Louvre, Pompidou Centre, Notre Dame and the Hotel de Ville. You can walk to the shops on Rue de Rivoli and to the bars and restaurants of the neighbouring Marais district, take the metro to anywhere in the city from Chatelet station (a direct line to Eurostar) at the end of the street or if you are feeling adventurous hire one of the city bikes stationed on the road. We'd definitely stay there next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delicate French experience, in the heart of lovely Paris”
Reviews.Author: Shams_Shammoussa
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of Paris, almost everything you want to see in Paris is at a walking distance from the Hotel: Louvre museum, Saint Michel, Notre Dame cathedral, the Bateaux Mouches cruise on the Seine.. It is also 2 minutes walk from the biggest Metro station in Paris, which has connections to every single destination you want to visit. In a secure neighborhood, you can enjoy the cozy, tidy rooms of the hotel, or the Authentic French decorated lobby to read a book while drinking your cup of coffee or tea. Last but not least: the personnel is simply the most friendly and helpful you could ever meet. Always smiling and available to help/advise and answer questions. In a separate note, this is the second time in less than 6 months, I go and stay in this hotel.. I think this tells as much as all the description above :) Enjoy it, Paris lovers!

Reviews.Title: “Return visits recommended”
Reviews.Author: Francais50
Reviews.Content: From our first stay at this hotel in 1992, each time we've come back our expectations have always been met. This charming hotel is in a fabulous location, within walking distance of the Louvre and Notre Dame and down the block from a great Metro station. The staff is always pleasant and helpful, the public rooms inviting and the rooms are all comfortable. After 7 stays at the hotel, I'm already looking forward to my next visit. If I could change anything at the hotel, it would be to add a little bar to the sitting room for that evening drink and include breakfast in the room cost.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ShellyWyatt
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent several days in Paris during Christmas week 2010. I am the travel planner in the family and did a lot of research before I decided on Hotel Britannique. We were not disappointed. Hotel Britannique is a lovely cozy hotel near everything you need to have a wonderful time in Paris. As first time visitorsm it was important to us to be close to the Metro as well as restaurants. Happily, Notre Dame and the Louvre are within easy walking distance from the hotel. Now, for some specifics: Staff - - Very friendly and helpful. Staff spoke very good English and were very kind in helping me practice my French. As a student of French language, it was a nice opportunity to practice my speaking skills (hard to do in US). Staff also was helpful in arranging taxi for us when we checked out. Getting there - - We arrived in Paris on the Eurostar from London. The station is not far from the hotel and I suggest you take a taxi rather than the metro unless you are in very good shape. The Paris metro does not have many escalators or elevators so handling luggage up and down stairs was a trial for me. A taxi from Gard de Nord is only about €25 and it's totally worth it. Hotel and room - - The hotel does have an elevator (great!) and was nicely heated. There is a nice lounge and the staff will stored your luggage if you need it, Our room was comfortable, with a very comfortable bed and pillows - and it was clean, I also did a bedbug check and it passed inspection! The bathroom was clean and had a full bathroom, with a tub. Very nice. For technology geeks - - please note that Hotel Britannique is in a historic building and so there are not many electrical outlets. My boyfriend and I are techies and brought iPhones, an iPad and MacBook. We just took turns charging out devices and did't have a problem. And the Internet connection was excellent (very important to us). I would definitely recommend Hotel Britannique to anyone visiting Paris, and especially first time visitors who might find Paris a bit overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, spotless, friendly and beautifully situated”
Reviews.Author: jakki333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely great. The welcome was gentle and friendly providing a really stress-free start to our stay. Spotlessly clean in every respect, everything you could possibly need and the best sheets I have ever slept in. They even left us some lovely little unexpected extras as it was a special occasion. The hotel is easy to find and very near shops / attractions but situated on a quiet little square with a very Parisian atmosphere. Breakfast was good, usual buffet style but nicely presented. Reasonable rates and definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: bobdubob
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay over the summer. The breakfast in particular was well liked by my group. The only down side was the stair case, a bit dark and a little scary for mom. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannique is a diamond!”
Reviews.Author: BobbieJeanJones
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for a Hotel for our stay in Paris we could not have found a more elegant european hotel with such history. With only 36 rooms this hotel and its staff is outstanding. The location is perfect to all the main attractions. The metro is just around the corner. Bakery and grocery stores are an easy walk. The experienced staff are friendly and will go out of their way to meet your every need. I will add the breakfast is the perfect start to your day. Yes, we will return to this fabulous hotel. We have stayed here for twelve days and could not have had a more pleasant experience. Highly recommended!!!!!! HE & BJ Jones

Reviews.Title: “Parfait !”
Reviews.Author: renatajaffar
Reviews.Content: I was just walking around Paris looking for a place to stay when I was welcomed by this charming hotel in the heart of Paris. This was my forth time in Paris and the first time I stayed so well located that I hardly needed to go on metro. Walking distance to St. Michel, Pompidou, Hotel de Ville, Louvre and probably the most bohemian area of Paris with very nice restaurants and entertainment. On top of that, the hotel facility, staff and breakfast were great. I will definitely return and I recommend t everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: ch5082
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel in the center of Paris. Staff spoke English as well as several other languages. Very close the Notre Dame and Louvre. Just past the Notre Dame is the Latin Quarter and St Germain area with many shops and restaurants. Hotel is on a quiet street off the Rue de Rivoli which is quite busy with many shops. Fairly expensive, but a very popular location for the surrounding attractions. The Chatelet metro is very close. Here you can catch the RER to CDG airport or nearly any metro line.

Reviews.Title: “Merci mille fois!”
Reviews.Author: clementine14
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel with outstanding staff in a fantastic location - quiet, but steps from the metro (Chatelet) and easy walking distance of Notre Dame, the Louvre and the Champs Elysée. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, who charged our appliances when our adaptors didn't work, booked an airport shuttle and rescheduled it when our flight was changed, and even organised a surprise gift for my mother after I mentioned it was her birthday in passing. It was this warm and personal service that made our stay. The rooms were beautifully appointed with comfy beds and high-quality linen, spotless bathrooms and free wi-fi. We would definitely stay here again, and mention it to any friends travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great!!”
Reviews.Author: bond74
Reviews.Content: i love it!!!great hotel,great staff,in central PARIS.Excellent service,every body is very professional,very kind,it 's clean every where you go inside the hotel,the rooms are very cute.We really spent a wonderfull moment in the HOTEL BRITANNIQUE,and for my next stay in PARIS,threre i will go for sure.I really recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fine for a budget trip”
Reviews.Author: americantravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a business trip because I had an event to attend at the Theatre du Chatelet. This hotel is right around the corner, so it's perfect if you are going to the Theatre. It's also very convenient for many tourist attractions. The rooms are tiny, but nicely decorated and you do feel like you are in Paris. The walls are a little thin, so you can sometimes hear your neighbors (hence my lower rating on sleep quality - the bed was fine). The only hiccup in service involved booking a taxi - this seemed problematic, requiring multiple people, repeated requests, and eventually no taxi. The desk manager was very solicitous though and sorted me out with the Metro. I would recommend this hotel to someone visiting Paris for the first time and on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A place of it's own,- far away from bling, bling attitude.”
Reviews.Author: carakiri
Reviews.Content: Silent in location, small street near by Pont Neuf. If you are looking for a place, which has "this" - what fancy location, expensive decor, and faked smiles from staff, can't give you... then hotel Britannique, oh so chick, a little world of it self. A place of its own, at a spot of silence and blue sky, but only for the few.

Reviews.Title: “a dream come true !”
Reviews.Author: douglasbb
Reviews.Content: i am in my late 30s and have wished to visit paris - and the eiffel tower in particular - since boyhood. when the opportunity arose to visit this amazing city i followed the advice of a trusted and good friend - THE most travelled person i know - and stayed at hotel britannique as he did several years before. i emailed the hotel and requested a great view. upon arrival i was greeted by friendly and attentive staff - the entire time - and a charming little room on the 6th floor overlooking the street and all paris. most amazing was the view of the eiffel tower from my little room. each night i drank wine with cheese and crackers and enjoyed this view. each morning i had a lovely little breakfast at the property, also. YES. there are bigger hotels. there are more luxurious hotels. there are more design oriented and slick hotels. BUT... i will return to the warm and traditional charm of hotel britannique for my return to this stunning city. the location was central and could not be beat. overall a wonderful and charming experience i will never forget. never.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brittanique is a charming reflection of Paris”
Reviews.Author: papanap
