Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Brittanique were nothing but excellent. They were very helpful and professional. My wife and I enjoyed our initial stay at the hotel so much we decided to return and end our last night of traveling Europe at Hotel Brittanique. Our rooms were charming, nicely adorned, very clean and appropriate in pricing. We liked our rooms that faced the street and both times had balconies overlooking the street. The location was superb and central to many of the attractions( museums, Arc de Triomphe de l'Etoile, the famous Opera House "Palais Garnier", Eiffel Tower, Avenue des Champs-Élysées, Notre Dame and river Seine . Many wonderful eateries nearby too. The metro is just across the street or you can catch a taxi. We walked to many of the attractions or used the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Hail Britannique!”
Reviews.Author: RahulAkerkar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique was just what we wanted; extremely well located - walking distance to just about everything and Metro across the street; warm, cozy, clean and comfortable; courteous, friendly staff; and it didn't burn a hole in the pocket either. The breakfast could improve easily though - same thing each day got a bit tiresome. Overall, we had a fabulous stay and we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 60th birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: leuca
Reviews.Content: this was our second visit and we came to celebrate both our 60th Birthdays which occur very close together- in October and November we chose this hotel for this celebration because we had such a happy time the last time when we came to Paris for our wedding anniversary and stayed with you the welcome was very warm, the room was very comfortable and the location is fantastic would we come again? can't wait! see you soon I hope thank all the staff for looking after us so well Charles and Jean Blair

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: adstew
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here -- the final night of our honeymoon in Paris. But leading up to our stay here, the hotel staff was very communicative. When we arrived for our last night in Paris, the staff had upgraded our room and provided complimentary champagne and roses for our honeymoon. Overall, great service and great location. Right near plenty of shopping and sights in the city, and close to a few different Metro stops. I would happily recommend Hotel Britannique to friends and family visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem - excellent quality, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: danlev
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! First, let me tell the story of how well they handled a small glitch in the booking. I had booked my room 3 months in advance, and stipulated a quiet single room. It turns out, however, that all single rooms are on the street, which is not very quiet. After I talked to the management the next morning, they bent over backwards to make it good, offering me an interior double room at a substantial discount, plus free breakfasts for the rest of my stay. I was very happy with this accomodation, which earned my loyalty. This is in contrast to how a very similar situation had been handled by the Morgan Hotel in London the previous week. Everybody makes mistakes sometimes, of course, being human; it is how they then handle them that makes the difference. Anyway, the Britannique’s rooms are elegant and really lovely, and the staff is extremely professional and helpful; the overall experience verges on being a 4-star rather than a 3-star one. Also there is a laptop PC in the lobby free for guests to use. The location is incredible, extremely central, with the Chatelet Metro stop literally across the street. However, a word about the street; although it is a side street with not much traffic, the hotel is 80 metres from an extremely busy street, with the authentic big-city noise one would expect, not directly under the windows but audible in the streetside rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: sneo223
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in October. The best thing about the hotel was the warmth and friendliness of the staff, nothing was too much bother for them. It is also centrally located near all the attractions: the Louvre , Notre Dame the seine, the Latin Quarter and St Germain des Pres. Rooms were charmingly decorated, quiet, had comfortable beds and fast wireless internet. Bathrooms were spotless and very clean. We really enjoyed the breakfasts. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannique is in a perfect location, clean and good service as well.”
Reviews.Author: kgkgkgParis
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were more spacious than expected. The location was convenient for travellers who want to explore the City. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Great staff; lovely room; very good deal”
Reviews.Author: JRJRMaryland
Reviews.Content: Great location: One and a half blocks from Chatelet RER/Metro stop. Very convenient for people taking RER from CDG. Close to the Marais. Lots of reasonable restaurant and stores within two blocks. One block from the Seine Great staff: Friendly, did not mind my bad French, spoke excellent English, helpful Room: While typical Parisian size, well done, quiet, very clean, well decorated, comfortable Very Good Deal: Price was fine and value exxcellent I have stayed in many hotels all over Paris and this is one of the best values and best places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: TAZMOUCHAKES
Reviews.Content: We found this place through trip advisor and were really pleased with it. The room was very clean and nice. There is a small balcony overlooking the street below, which is a great place for breakfast. The staff at the front desk could not have been more helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about how wonderful this hotel was!”
Reviews.Author: HappyOne38
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 4 days, traveled to Luxembourg and then back to Paris. We stayed at Hotel Britannique the first week and I can't tell you how disappointed I was that we weren't staying at Britannique the second week! There truly isn't a better location, it was amidst the bustle but located on a very quiet street. The staff was so accommodating and polite, they helped us find cafes, called taxis and even served me coffee after the kitchen was closed. The rooms are small, it's Paris, that's how it is. Do NOT listen to any complaints about this hotel, my guess is those guests were rude to start and don't understand that Paris is pricy and the space is limited. I would choose this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal1956
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat - close to attractions, the metro, and wonderful neighborhood restaurants. The staff is courteous and helpful, and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: frefutravelor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 25th wedding anniversary and could not be more pleased. The staff always helpful and spoke english, location close to everything. Boutique feeling and rooms well decorated and comfortable. Would not stay anywhere else when we return. Love this hotel and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, friendly staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BossaLesja
Reviews.Content: Before we went to Paris, I used a lot of time finding the perfect hotel for our stay! Google Earth is a very good thing to use! I was very pleased when we arrived! The hotel was clean and cosy, with a perfect location for a weekend trip! And I got the balcony that I wanted! The staff was friendly and very polite. The breakfast was very nice with a lot of different food to choose from. Our room was a bit small but I guess that is usual for Paris hotels. And what a view outside on our balcony, the Eiffel Tower! Louvre was only to blocks away and the Seinen was right down the street. I´m pretty sure that we are coming back to this hotel someday soon! I will recommend this hotel to a travelagent that I know, she is always interested in new places she can recommend to her customers.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent stay in a very well located typical Paris hotel with nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: dorotea083
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique was a very nice surprise to me: atmospheric, welcoming, clean, with pleasent rooms and very good service. And a really good breakfest! And the location is great ! No question I shall come back soonest I can.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nicely appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: ishyGK
Reviews.Content: Great location to the metro as well as walking distance to the siene and all sites easily. Rooms are nicely decorated and the bed are very comfortable. Rooms are large. Windows have awnings to shade teh sun while having the windows open. Quiet street. Nice staff and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with friendly people in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: RandB_80
Reviews.Content: The Britannique is a terrific small 3 star boutique hotel, pleasant and comfortable, in a great location. Located on a short one-way street near the Place de Chatelet, it's a quiet neighborhood yet also near excellent Metro and bus connections, the Ile de la Cite, the Rue de Rivoli, and plenty of good cafes, patisseries, a good wine bar, and even a small grocery store. The staff was helpful, friendly, and accommodating. While our room was extremely small for a double, even by Paris standards, it had a private balcony overlooking the (mostly) quiet street. The lobby was overstuffed-comfortable in a British clubby way, and the breakfast buffet (additional cost) was very good and a fair value. Spotlessly clean and inviting. We would go back in a flash--only thing we might change would be to upgrade to the Classic (superior) double room, but then we might not have the balcony. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: VCJ-DLJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and were very pleased. Rooms are small, but very clean and comfortable, and has free Wifi. The location could not be better--1 block from the Seine, on a quiet street bordered by the much more hectic and noisy Rue de Rivoli. It's about 3 blocks to the Louvre and 3 blocks in the other direction to Ile de La Citie where Notre Dame is. The hotel staff was helpful in giving us directions to parking (which turned out to be cheaper than taking a taxi to and from Charles De Gaulle), and in checking to see if our flight would be affected by the strike. We only opted for the 13 euro breakfast one morning, but it was very good and included eggs and sausage.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal060156
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at the hotel. We love the location and the staff is pleasant. The rooms are typically small but comfortable and clean. The friends we travelled with stayed in the junior suite and it was very nice and more spacious. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great find!”
Reviews.Author: fellipemxo
Reviews.Content: Very nice and cozy hotel. Friendly staff always wiling to help. Centrally located, close to subway station, museums but on a quiet street. Very good breakfast. Rooms are a bit small, like all hotel rooms in Paris, but still comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Janetlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: We found this lovely hotel in the Frommer's Paris Day by Day guidebook. Based on the description and reviews on TripAdvisor, we decided to take a chance. We were not disappointed! Our rooms were immaculate, comfortable, and very quiet. The staff were very accommodating. Special thanks to Madelyn at the front desk for accommodating us early when we arrived after our overnight flight from Canada and to all the front desk staff for their courteousness during our stay. We enjoyed breakfast each morning and chatted with other very satisfied patrons of the hotel. The location was perfect for getting around to the places we wanted to see - all within easy walking distance. And the Metro was only a short distance away. We will definitely return to Hotel Britannique!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Britannique was a wonderful hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Todd1961
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Britannique was simply delightful. The hotel was very clean and nice and the staff at the front desk could not have been more helpful. They assisted me with my tourist plans and logistics and helped me manage through a transportation strike as well. All were very helpful but a special thanks to Magdalena and Aime for their special attention to our needs during our visit. Tres Bon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: janetrochemont
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique is a small, unique hotel perfectly situated so one can easily walk to the major attractions in Paris,, enjoy shopping and dining of all kinds. The staff are friendly, polite and helpful and speak to you in your preferred language. Rooms are cute and welcoming. A perfect place to enjoy a wonderful city. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; charming hotel; so very lovely!”
Reviews.Author: nhhomebody
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. the location is great-near the Seine-a short walk to the Louvre; next to a subway stop-and yet quiet and felt safe. We had a king sized bed which was very comfortable, but the room had little space for anything else. Bathroom was fine and clean and newly done-the hairdryer kept overheating . Front desk staff was pleasant and helpful. the morning breakfast was such a treat and a nice way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “extraordinarely good”
Reviews.Author: Gertjan88
Reviews.Content: Thursday 7 oct 2010 I spent one night in the hotel, it was excellent!! a very nice room (not too big) very clean with a very nice atmosphere (english mansionstyle) and a really friendly staff, which is not always the case nowadays. The only drawback is , there is no private parking. The location of the hotel is in a real parisian (lively, vibrating) neighbourhood, plenty restaurants, bars and other touristics topics ,although inside the hotel its very quiet. The price-quality ratio is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for all kindly support & service...for everything..”
Reviews.Author: MyMouMick
Reviews.Content: Well, my trip was unsmoothly as soon as I got noticed Strike at CDG on my departure date from Barcelona to Paris..but I didn't feel worried or uneasy at all because Staffs at Hotel Britannique tried to support me anytime I called, update information about strike, held the room...etc. The greeting words staff (pretty lady ^-^) approached as soon as see me was "Finally!! You must be tried, welcome and please take a rest..") I felt really relief and relax at the first step at Hotel Britannique.. I would like to thank you your kindly support in everything... since my flight was canceled on 7th coz of Strike at CDG, your warmness welcome on my marriage anniv.. your kindly information for my trip untill I flew back Japan. I and my husband watched VDO we taped your hotel and I remind nice atmosphere of Britannique..Especially interrior and music at guest area..that's so nice.. ^-^ Thank you for everything and I do hope I will have chance to visit Britannique again. Best Regards,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect English-style boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HatterAtherstone
Reviews.Content: As only a 3* hotel we were not expecting the best. However, Hotel Britannique turned out to be far superior to most 5* hotels we have stayed in. Our Junior Suite appeared to be recently refubished. Attention to detail was 100%. Even the shower tap was turned to the correct temperature, so no scalding or freezing. There were soft white bathrobes for each of us and the bed linen was crisp and inviting. If I have any quibbles I would say that staying on the first floor left us exposed to the street noise which went on most of the night. Other family members said that they could hear other guests through the walls. The breakfast room was rather cramped and we were astonished when we found mould on a piece of bread. But these are only quibbles. The staff were very attentive and all spoke good English. The lounge area was beautifully furnished in English country-house style with deep sofas and muted opera music to aid relaxation. On our next visit to Paris we shall certainly stay at the Hotel Britannique.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish and elegant hotel situated near the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: kenmcc25
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a great ambiance with antique furnishings in the foyer and loungeroom, and the buffet breakfast was sumptuous and the staff very friendly and helpful. Great value for money. One negative - the hotel room walls are VERY thin, and you can hear conversations from next door. Comfortable bed and great location to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should travel to Paris with someone they love!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy60859
Reviews.Content: This was a fine place to stay and the location cannot be beat. We stayed here the last two nights of our 2 1/2 week trip and it was by far the nicest. It is amazing the things one comes to appreciate when one has been doing the budget travel thing. We got excited about things like Kleenex, shampoo, washcloths ( no other place had them), a really nice clean and well maintained bathroom (be forwarned bathtubs are small here) that delivered a nice pressure and hot water quickly, a safe we did not have to pay extra for, reading lights that you could actually read with on each side of the very comfortable bed. The rooms are large by European standards and we had a nice tiny patio with table and chairs for morning tea or coffee and view of the street. The common room is wonderfully comfortable and I enjoyed hanging out reading the paper and drinking my morning tea there very much. The breakfast is marvelous - I expected weak or bad coffee, tang passing as orange juice and stale croissants. What was ofered was fabulous coffee and an assortment of tea, fresh croissants and other French baked goods, thin slices of various French ham and British style sausages, scrambled and soft boiled eggs, 3 kinds of fresh juice, an assortment of French cheeses, toast ( but why would you?) cereals fresh fruit and fruit cocktail. And it is open from 7:30 to 11:00am! I am a light sleeper and could hear the man next door snoring and his very loud TV in the afternoon. I did not howeve,r hear much traffic from the street but bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The staff were unfailingly kind. generous, helpful, and courteous. I especially want to thank Nadim, the concierge on the night shift for helping us with our travel snafu. Our shuttle failed to arrive and he helped problem solve and got us a cab when it became clear it was not going to arrive. He also set us up for breakfast before the dining room opened as we were leaving at 6:30 am. Thank you Nadim!!!! the cab driver you got us was great and we got to the airport safe and sound. An aside for Americans. Don't expect the French and Parisians to be like us. They are not. Be prepared to feel inadequate in comparison and just be accepting of that and open to the adventure of it all. If you can do this Paris will yeild herself and teach you many things about life and pleasure. She will win your heart - as she has mine. Have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Trip987_10
Reviews.Content: We found this place through trip advisor and were really pleased with it. We were only 2 or 3 blocks from the Louvre and right near the Sein. Also a short walk to Notre Dame and the Metro was right across the street. Room was spacious (for europe) and nice, clean bathrooms and showers as well very friendly staff. You leave your keys at the front desk every time you come and go which was weird, but easy enough to get used to. All of the front counter people spoke wonderful English which made it very easy to ask for suggestions on places to eat, or how to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time around”
Reviews.Author: GoCB
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row we stayed at this hotel -- last year just the 3 of us; this year we dared to bring our extended family for a total of 4 rooms. As before, the location is perfect to walk to many traditional attractions and the metro stop is on the corner to get to the rest. The front desk staff is gracious and helpful to a person and all speak English. Rooms are small but sufficient and scrupulously clean. And the breakfast -- especially when included in the room price as with the internet special -- is truly excellent with many warm and cold choices and sufficient tables. The croissants there ruined me for any offered state-side. If I get to return to Paris again which I hope, I would not even consider going anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Hadleightraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris many times before and this time wanted a romantic hotel in the centre. This is certainly in the centre - 5 minutes walk to Notre Dame - but that is all. We arrived to find a boutique style hotel, and the check in staff were very friendly. However, the room was miniscule - with the king size bed in it we could hardly open the door to the tiny bathroom. Whilst the room was clean and quiet and the bed, to be fair, very comfortable, the whole was tired and in need of refreshing. The courtesy tray was spartan and there was no access to hot water for tea except by contacting reception between 2pm and 9pm. The bathroom had an old scratched bath that was narrow and the shower attachment was low pressure. If you need to iron anything you have a laundry service that charges 6 euros to iron a shirt! To add insult to injury we ordered a cab via reception to take us to the Gare du Nord for our Eurostar connection and they did not bother to order this for us. Half the staff are friendly and the other half waste of space. At book price 221 euros for a double, room only, this is a rip off. tThe only justification is that it is in the centre. Stay further out, like Montmartre, where you get much better value, and use the wonderful Metro system

Reviews.Title: “"We thought the Brittanique was lovely"”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveler060
Reviews.Content: We thought the Brittanique was lovely. We booked three double rooms for our family of six (they do have some larger rooms, as well), which were clustered at the end of a hall. It felt like we had our own suite, and because we booked three rooms we were offered a reduced price plus breakfast. The rooms were clean and charming with comfortable beds and air conditioning. I thought the one with the street side view was the nicest and noise was not a problem. The staff at the hotel was very helpful, and the Cafe Zimmer across the street had great service and food -- a step above any other brasserie we visited. My teenage boys appreciated the free wifi and use of a computer in the lounge. They were able to post messages on Facebook about what a great time they were having!

Reviews.Title: “To be revisited”
Reviews.Author: elizesteyn
Reviews.Content: After many visits to Paris, even before my daughter started living there 3 years ago, this is the hotel we will revisit and recommend to friends, who have similar interests to ours. The situation, close to a Metro that connects to several lines and close to many must see sights and the Seine and great shopping, including Les Halles, is perfect. There are many nearby restaurants and it is a short walk to Rue Monterguille, which is charming in all respects. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast, the best I have come accross in Paris. The rooms are small, but clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom we had was tiny, but adequate and the robes were a nice touch.The view is wonderful and not cramped in, like I have experienced. The rates over the internet were excellent value for money. The mini bar is useful. The only aspect I would have liked to see added is a kettle to make tea or coffee, as it is a nuisance to request hot water. My son's single room was perfect. The reading room downstairs, with free internet, is lovely to sit in and to see friends. The hotel more than lived up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: jtzsaltlake
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique was in a great location and their staff was fantastic. They answered endless questions for us and made our experience in Paris so enjoyable. They even served breakfast for us early on our last day so we could eat before we had to leave for the airport. The rooms were small but comfortable and well decorated and they had a very nice seating room as well as other thoughtful amentities like umbrellas. They have a computer available to guest, but it is older and very slow which was the only drawback. We would highly recommend Hotel Britannique and will stay again when we get back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FamilleKillick
Reviews.Content: Great location for Le Louvre, Centre Pompidou (10 mins walking distance) and the Champs Elysées (a few stops by metro just outside the hotel). Queues at the Louvre can be horrific so it is definitely an added bonus to be able to get there when it opens at 9am. Lack of good restaurants in the immediate surrounding, more choice towards le Marais and Place Concorde/Rue Cambon/Ste Anne for Japanese. Young front desk staff pleasant and helpful. Cosy little lounge which was useful to read the paper (complimentary Le Monde or Guardian) once the kids were in bed. Room was quite small but beds are confortable. Very good quality breakfast, which I have to say is quite rare for a 3 star hotels in France: good selection of fresh juice, pastries, breads, nice cheese board and cold meats, scrambled eggs, cereals etc. Overall a good address.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Gnome_Travels
Reviews.Content: Hotel is next to the Chatelet Metro so traveling throughout Paris is easy. Walking distance to Louvre, Marais area, Notre Dame, Latin Quarter, and just a street away from the Seine. Stayed 5 days and had comfortable bed with the standard room. Would return and recommend this to anyone who wants to be in the heart of the Right Bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lv2TravelDelafield
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, small but nice. The location is fantastic. So much to see and do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotels, comfort, warmly, welcoming and reception staff lovely”
Reviews.Author: Rubydooby_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in June. The climate outside was quite cool. But as soon as you walked into the hotel foyer it was like a world away from anything else..So welcoming, warm and friendly. It was central to everything we wanted to see. The staff were lovely, breakfast beautiful. Reception staff were more than helpful every time we had a question they did their best to answer it. They helped us with directions and buses to catch to certain sights. Only thing we would complain about is its a 5 story building and the one lift holds 3 people. It is required to accommodate the morning room cleaners, the people booking out, with their luggage, and just general use. Sometimes in the morning we had to wait 10 minutes to get the use of it. But we know that can't be changed, its just a shame it is a demerit. All in all a wonderful hotel, would recommend friends or family stay there. Laraine and Les, Gold coast, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lopezjo
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Location, Clean, Friendly Staff. Pictures on Hotel website are a good feel for what it looks like - no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel with helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bienvenue54
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique is a fabulous small boutique hotel which is in an excellent location. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished. The staff was friendly, very helpful with directions and information. Beautiful sitting area with computer. It is located on a fairly quiet street which was also nice. The breakfast was not so good and is expensive. Would recommend going to the bakery around the corner which has a vast selection of fresh baked pasteries and coffee. The hotel Britannique is very charming with alot of character. We really appreciated all the helpful information and directions the folks at the front desk were able to give us. You were all great and really made the place seem very warm and welcoming . I plan to come back to stay at the Britannique next summer. .

Reviews.Title: “small well located and well kept hotel”
Reviews.Author: ethertor
Reviews.Content: Well decorated and clean hotel located in central position with pleasant staff. Had a breakfast room although we did not use as cafes abound. No kettle in room but hot water available on request. Room safe in room. Hot water and safe were 2 of our requirements when looking for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay in Paris, closer to the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Douglas_Ranieri
Reviews.Content: This is a small and intimate hotel located closer to the main turistic attractions in Paris. It has a very well served breakfast, staff that is perfectly able to speak with you in English language and very good rooms with a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny box room with miniscule shower for euro 200”
Reviews.Author: Anita2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was great - and room was fairly clean and quiet - however it was tiny and the shower / bathroom miniscule. You could hardly get into the bathroom it was so small. Room was also very dark as it was the first floor at the back. Frankly I would have been disappointed if it was half the price - poor value for money. Staff friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Merops111
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Britannique was most enjoyable. The room was tastefully furnished, and although it overlooked the street, double glazing kept out noise. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Location is close to Ile de la Cite, Notre Dame and The Louvre, so many of the main attractions are within walking distance. Chatelet metro station is just at the end of the street, and there were plenty of local restaurants to choose from. We would stay here again when visiting Paris, and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Well managed, lovely place with charm and outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: xebral
Reviews.Content: We have had a wonderful time in this lovely hotel for the second time now. It is a very nice decorated place, perfectly clean, well managed, and most of all with an outstanding staff! Everybody was so friendly and polite, that we (my family and my friends) could all experience the positive vibrations of the team and feel'd very welcome and respected all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: rndavies
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Britannique sits on a very quiet street in the heart of Paris. From the hotel we were able to walk beyond the Invalides on the west; to the Sorbonne to the east, and south. Our last morning we took a quick walk to Notre Dame and back before we had to catch our plane. The hotel is very tastefully appointed. The room we had was very comfortable and very quiet. The staff keep the hotel spotless and were eager to assist us with suggestions for nearby restaurants and sights. I have travelled to Paris on business and pleasure a number times but I will always wish to return to Hotel Britannique in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at Hotel Britannique”
Reviews.Author: chris93003
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently spent 12 nights at Hotel Britannique. We had rooms 45 and 46 which are considered Classic Double Room with Queen Size bed and Classic Double Room with 2 Twin size beds. Our rooms were next door to each other. Our rate that I booked over the internet included breakfast. Both rooms were on the back side of the hotel looking at the back of another building (probably an apartment building but I never saw or heard anything back there). The Queen room(46) had one large floor to ceiling window that opened like French doors plus the bathroom with combo bath and shower had a large window that opened wide. Immediately outside the window was a window box of flowers to enjoy. We had a desk with small stool and a kitchen type chair. Also had mini frig that we used for our wine and veggie and cheese storage. Beside 2 very tiny built in bedside tables there was a radiator cover on one side that acted as a shelf for alarm clock camera,tissue,etc. Also included was a tray with teacups, teapot and a couple of glasses that was refreshed daily (hot water is available from the front desk). Small screen tv on desk received CNN in English. Bathroom had shelf that was plenty big enough for my husband and I to share. Terry bathrobe was a very nice touch that I made use of. Room 45 with the 2 twin beds was similar in size but had 2 floor to ceiling windows that opened (with window boxes!) and an internal bathroom with just a shower but had the same storage shelf that my adult children made work for them. They had a more generous easy chair compared to our kitchen-type chair. Closets offered enough hanging room along with shelves and a free safe. Beds were so comfortable, neither too hard nor too soft. Crisp white linens were fabulous and rooms were made up daily. Newer double paned windows were easy to work and did the job. Noise was never an a problem. We were next door to the elevator on one side and I never heard it. Breakfast was excellent for us since it was included. There was something for everyone of my picky eaters! My daughter delighted in hot chocolate made with the hot milk always available. Yogurts, cereals, canned fruit, fresh fruit, sausage, scrambled eggs, soft boiled eggs served in the little egg cups with a cozy on to keep it warm, breads, cheeses, jams Nutella, coffee and tea and a couple kinds of juice. The breakfast room was small but there was always a table available for us. It was a wonderful place to linger over coffee (usually while I waited for the kids to come down) and plan our day's activities. Kitchen staff was very friendly. I really appreciated the front desk. We were always greeted with a friendly smile and anytime I asked for advice it was given freely and warmly. We made use of the free hot water for tea a number of times but the hotel also has wine by the glass or bottle that I ordered a couple of times. We could take it to our rooms or just enjoy it in the pleasant room near the lobby that had plenty of seating. This room had a laptop that served the purpose of keeping in touch via email. Everything about our stay was perfect, starting when we arrived jet lagged at 9am and were invited to drop our luggage and enjoy a relaxing breakfast before going out to explore and ending when we were checking out at 8am and I realized I had left my glasses at the cute little wine bar around the corner the night before. They are now in my possession because the great staff hunted them down and shipped them to me. How's that for service?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: avullo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Britannique when we visited Paris to celebrate our 1st anniversary. We checked into our room and were surprised with a gift of chocolate and a bottle of champagne. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The staff were all very accommodating and helpful with every request for directions, calling a taxi, etc. Most of all, I enjoyed the small yet well-appointed feel of the hotel and it's prime location in the city - close to sights, close to the metro station and good restaurants, shopping and markets, etc. When we come back to Paris, this is were we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently situated charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireAdventurer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days and enjoyed the hotel very much.The situation of the hotel is ideal for accessibility of public transport and local shops.The nearby boulangerie/patisserie tea room is excellent.We found the staff here pleasant and helpful from the front desk to the cleaning staff.The room was comfortable and clean if a little hot at times but there is air conditioning to deal with this.The ambience of the hotel is charming harking back to the days of England at its magnificent best.Overall,we loved every minute of it here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: bobbie18
Reviews.Content: A friend of a friend recommended the Hotel Britannique to us for our April in Paris vacation. It is a hotel we will continue to recommend to many more friends. The staff was lovely, the rooms charming, the location beyond terrific (walking distance to Notre Dame, the Louvre, Le Marais, and everything else imaginable. The street was quiet and the entire staff extremely helpful in restaurant recommendations (a fabulous little bistro around the corner) and in helping us get passes to exhibits on-line. They answered all and every question we had. The hotel has an old world charm about it, and it is neat and clean. Hopefully we will return to the city of lights and the Hotel Britannique very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, location and boutique mini-chic.”
Reviews.Author: Windsock-heiress
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Britannique for over three weeks last October through to early November and thought the location was brilliant. The reception and kitchen staff were wonderful. The room was kept clean and fresh each day and generallyall of the staff were keen to help as much as possible. The room was at times too warm, even if we turned our radiator dial right down, we would open our balcony doors to let some fresh air in. The room was also very small...our twin beds were placed together in the space normally taken by a Queen sized bed. The beds were comfortable and the linen always very clean. The balcony doors have double glazed glass and the street noise was not an issue. We did become aware of the activities of other guests with adjoining rooms a couple of times...Whoa! I travelled with my mother as she had never been to Paris before, and the location was excellent. My mother became ill whilst we were in Paris and the hotel staff found a doctor to come to our room in the middle of the night which is a great recommendation for their consideration and assistance. I would suggest to book with the hotel directly but perhaps not to order the breakfast as the menu is very limited, you can breakfast at one of the local cafe's on the block. The view from our room was an ode to Paris, my mother spent several days confined to bed, and she said that the view was a tonic for her. The lift is also small, and there is only one laptop in the hotel lounge for guest use. However the location of this hotel is quite fantastic, it is clean and cozy and is great value for money. There are many cafe's and restaurants, also local small super -markets and pharmacies...should the need arise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mizunoman
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this wonderful hotel. The location was excellent and the hotel was very clean and the rooms well appointed. The ladies in our group thought the hotel was very nice, very clean well decorated and thought the bathrooms were excellent . While the rooms were a little small, there was still plenty of room and the beds were the most comfortable we have had in Europe. It was a short walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame. Plus it was only a block from the river. The hotel staff was friendly and helped with directions and information. You are very close to some great restaraunts (in all price ranges) and the Metro is right around the corner. You do get a lot for the money at the Hotel Britannique. I would pass on the breakfast however. It seemed a little expensive ( 13 Eruo per person). All in all this is a great hotel and a nice price. You will not regret staying here if you want a great location at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: JohnZZZ098
Reviews.Content: Touring Europe with my wife and first stop was Paris. Booked in this beautiful hotel, good room friendly english speaking staff extremely good location. Will recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “You can go back again- what a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: steppingout34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotelon our first anniversary 10 years ago and loved it then. It has only gotten better! The staff are welll versed in English and very helpful. The hotel is clean and all the rooms- even the lobby bathroom, have been beautifully decorated. It is very charming and the beds are comfortable, with eiderdowns and quality linens. There is a great shower and everything is sparkling clean. Thin screen TV and wifi kept us connected. We even had a view of the Eifel Tower ober the roof tops of Paris out our window. The management even put an Anniversary card and a small box of chocolates in our room welcoming us back! And then there is the Location location location. We are able to comfortably walk to the Louvre, Ile de Cite and Notre Dame, Ste. Chapelle, one block from the Seine- you are close to everything at this hotel and we will definitely be coming again- and again- and again!

Reviews.Title: “A Welcoming, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arple
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. It is centrally located, on a quiet street yet around the corner from the Chatelet Metro and RER. It is near the Pompidou and the Louvre. The rooms are small and the hotel costs about 30 euros per night more than it should. But the people could not be more friendly. It has touches of Great Britain: you get free copies of The Guardian. The coffee is American-British style. Breakfast is 13 euros but is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this beautiful hotel were...”
Reviews.Author: Lisafrythompson
Reviews.Content: The staff at this beautiful hotel were some of the most lovely and helpful that I have ever come accross, they were happy to assist in any way they could to make our stay most enjoyable. Nothing seemed too difficult for them to assist. Would happily reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris The location was also sensational. Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Great location with FREE wifi; one or two small reservations”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Pudding
Reviews.Content: A really good location for the major sights. FREE wifi (really good). Very helpful and friendly staff. Our only serious reservations were the fact that (as mentioned in one or two other reviews) the sound-proofing of the walls is really not very good, and we had to let our neighbours know that we could hear them talking, and then it was fine. It wasn't a problem getting to sleep and the location is actually quite quiet, being off the main busy street. The only other slight reservation was the choice of English TV channels. BBC World News would have been good, especially as we were there during the UK election - instead we only had CNN (better than nothing). Facilities are very much 3 star rather than 4 or 5 but that's fine. I'd certainly think about staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best hotel for me”
Reviews.Author: Shoesy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 3rd stay at this hotel.......this time it was my first solo trip. I had reserved a standard double room and had requested a lower floor since I didn't want to use the tiny elevator. I found my accommodations just as charming as I had the other 2 times, and I enjoyed having my own little balcony. I must admit that the closet in this room was quite small, but since I was alone, I had no problems. If my husband had been with me, fitting all our clothes would have been a bit of a challenge, but we still could have managed by either keeping some items in a suitcase or creating higher piles of folded clothes on the shelves. In any case, travelers should keep this in mind when deciding on which room category to book. I'd like to emphasize the fact that the staff is very professional, helpful and pleasant. As an added bonus, I was allowed to keep my room beyond the usual check-out hour, for which I was extremely grateful. In addition, my birthday was kindly acknowledged, and that was just another way of making me feel welcome. Once again, I felt truly blessed to call the Britannique my home in Paris for 9 nights. I will definitely stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Britannique is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: barbgoodkin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Britannique a dozen times and have never been disappointed. The staff is very hospitable and they continually upgrade their rooms and buffet breakfast. I was planning a visit this spring but the volcano made me cancel my trip. I have referred a number of friends and family and they have always been happy with their visits.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of historic Paris”
Reviews.Author: MCC27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved everything about the Britannique - location, service, value. The only drawback we could notice was that the walls are pretty thin and you can hear a lot of what's going on in the next room. But, as we didn't spend that much time in our room and everything else was truly marvelous, we felt it was a minor drawback that will not prevent us from returning to the Britannique as soon as we have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rideperfect
Reviews.Content: After much searching to find a hotel to stay in in Paris within the 1st arrondissement we settled on this one. Our criteria was largely based on decent reviews, access, price and quiet. For those light sleepers who want to be in the center of Paris, the double paned windows at this hotel on the street side are incredibly effective. They are also operable, so as to let the breeze in. Good night sleep in great beds with quiet - check. Otherwise the hotel has a convenient city run bike rental kiosk http://www.velib.paris.fr/ directly outside, with subway access across the street to get you to and from the airport. 24hr concierge so you never have to carry your keys with you, great access to The Marais and the Louvre. Let me see what else...clean, quiet (I mentioned that already), Fantastic place

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: calgarypat
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Brittanique in April 2010 for 6 nights. We were travelling with our 2 daughters, ages 11 and 14, and the staff ensured we had 2 rooms beside each other, so we could easily move back and forth. The rooms were very comfortable, and a good size for European hotels. The breakfast (included) was very good, and the staff was very helpful, giving us recommendations for restaurants and transportation. They also allowed us to sit in the sitting room downstairs with a bottle of wine that we had purchased elsewhere (allowing us some private time away from the kids without leaving them by themselves), which was very pleasant. The location was also excellent, very close to the Louvre, and across the bridge from Notre Dame cathedral and many restaurants and shops. If you would prefer to be able to just walk out your door to the cafes, you may prefer to stay in Sainte Germaine, but this hotel was only a few minutes walk from there, and the price was very good and it was very clean and safe. It was also very close to the metro, making it easy to travel to other sites if you didn't feel like walking. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Calgary Canada

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, sound damping problem”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 1 night in a "classique king size room" #55. Excellent location, right in the center of Paris, lovely hotel, charming decoration and good staff. Our room was on the 5th floor, well equiped and comfortable. The only point is that, as this might be a old building, we could here our neigbors talking, so I had to go knocking at theire door. Dispite this small thing, the rest was really good!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Britannique for 4 nights. Great Hotel, lovely room with very comfortable bed. Fabulous breakfast, which we needed as we set off on foot each morning for our trips around Paris. Wonderful location, as all major sites within walking distance. Discovered a wonderful Restaurant called BAM - Bar A Manger, just around the corner with Cheesecake to die for!! Will definately return to this Hotel on my next trip to Paris. Patricia Ronayne, Cork, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location, world's most romantic place for couples!!”
Reviews.Author: billhammer
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I had an absolutely fantastic stay at the Hotel Brittanique!! The hotel staff were very warm (do not underestimate the effect of trying to speak French no matter that yours might not be good-attempt it anyway and ask them to help you with it! get a little phrase book too.) Fodor's said this too as well as rating the Hotel "most charming". The room was wonderfully clean and well done up every day. It is in a wonderful location maybe 500 feet from the Seine, 5 min. walk to Louvre 10 min. to Notre Dame. Zimmer's was a fine moderately priced restaurant about 1 minute away. Make sure you have a picnic lunch on Ile de la Cite ( little park as you go over the Pont Neuf Bridge). If you don't have a fantastic time here, don't call the front desk-look in the mirror!!!! We have been married 25 years and (even) kissed each other while riding the Metro in the morning-Paris-yes, it is that romantic if you allow yourself. Bill and Nancy Hall Perth Ontario

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, a real find!”
Reviews.Author: 28A
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable hotel in an ideal location.. The Chatelet metro station is at the corner.. but you're within easy walking distance of Notre Dame, the left Bank, the Pompidou Centre and even the Louvre. I just spent four nights there.. and was sorry to leave! The most helpful and warm English speaking reception staff, and a lovely room.; mine... no. 23.. had a balcony- on a sunny day I had breakfast sent up to enjoy there. An excellent restaurant - the Zimmer- is across the street. Had dinner there twice. (Unhappily I had dinner once at the Victoria--also across the street -Overpriced, poor food, unattentive staff, noisy TV. To be avoided.)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: need2travel_99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a hidden treasure in Paris. The location cannot be beat. Very close to the Louvre, right across the river from Sainte Chapelle. Buy your Paris museum pass and you can walk to almost everything. The metro is also close to get to places a little farther away. The location is not on a major street so there is no issue with road noise. The breakfast buffet had a nice variety and was an easy start to each day. The rooms are a bit small, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Lagunatrips
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, wonderful staff,clean rooms and a reasonable value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good and nice as everytime”
Reviews.Author: sullu_10
Reviews.Content: Nothing to say. Each time the same quality, same kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Friendly & Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Marscup
Reviews.Content: I took my first trip to Paris with my boyfriend over Thanksgiving and did a lot of homework regarding small, well-situated hotels. I looked at about 8 options, and the H.B. met all the criteria, plus they had the best price. I will ALWAYS stay at this wonderful place for my future travel to Paris. Here's why: 1) Terrific location. Very close to Louvre and to Notre Dame. The Chatelet metro stop (a main one) is right across the street. 2) The hotel staff couldn't be nicer. You know how you hear that the French are rude? Not true! We loved everybody we met. I had a lot of questions in advance, and they always got back to me within a few days with answers. Truly, I know I was annoying at a few points, and they were very good humored and kind in answering all my inquiries. 3) Rooms were fine (we stayed on 6th floor). The bathroom was awesome; modern and clean. I really only care about cleanliness and the rooms met my clean inspection. These are tiny rooms - as is common in Europe - so make sure you set your expectations accordingly. Comfortable bed and wonderful mattress. Don't bother with eating breakfast in the hotel. (anywhere in the world, not just Paris) Around the corner (out the door and make a right and then another right turn), there is a PERFECT place for breakfast. It is a pastry shop operated by Mrs. Yuehl. We loved all the ladies who allowed us to feast on pastries and cafe au lait each morning while we planned our itinerary. Charming doesn't begin to describe it. There's no fitness facility, but the H.B. is one block from the Sienne, so I basically ran along the river and had the added benefit of crossing bridges and taking it more sites. Loved it so much! Lucy from Pennsylvania, USA

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Balsher
Reviews.Content: This is a charming, smaller hotel located near the Place du Chatelet and a 5 minute walk from the Chatelet Metro station. It's within easy walking distance of the Isle de la Cite, the Rue de Rivoli, the Louvre, the Marais section of Paris -- as central a location as one will ever find in Paris. We stayed there during the week between Christmas 2009 and New Year's, and thorougly enjoyed the hotel. We arrived early in the morning after a long overnight flight from Atlanta and were able to check into the room to get a few hours of sleep. We then ate breakfast at the hotel. The room had a king size bed and one of the best mattresses we've ever slept on. Although small by American standards, the room was adequate. It featured a safe (which was too high to even see into, but worked fine), a small flat screen TV not much bigger than a computer monitor, with French, German, and BBC and sometimes CNN programming, a desk, and a small bathroom with shower (the shower had good pressure and had those sliding doors on two sides to form a square like you see on a cruise ship, no tub). It suited us fine. My wife negotiated a price of about 185 Euros a night, breakfast included. On the last night, our sink started to leak. The desk clerk couldn't fix it and it left the bathroom floor wet. We asked for and were able to get a slight (10 Euro) reduction on the last night's charge because of the problem. The front desk staff, especially, Pauline, were helpful and gave us a good recommendation for dinner one night: Au Pied de Cochon on the right bank, which is a must-eat place if you go to Paris. It's open 24/7 and hasn't closed since the 1940's. Back to the hotel: we ate a good buffet breakfast there every morning. It was satisfactory though not as lavish as some other European buffet breakfasts we've experienced. Then we'd venture out into the city, walking or riding the Metro, depending upon our destination and our mood. Because of its central location, the Hotel Brittanique was an excellent place for our visit. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay”
Reviews.Author: LolaBabyAR
Reviews.Content: This was where was stayed on our first trip to Paris. The hotel was a great choice! Fantastic location, the hotel staff was great. They even helped when I fried my converter. The rooms were huge but nicely done. The bathroom was big and clean - no tub, only a shower. Our room overlooked the street but the noise wasn't bad. They had blackout shades and we accidentally slept until noon one day! Cafe Zimmer is right at the end of the street and is a great place for dinner. If you leaned out out window and looked down the street you could see Hotel de Ville. Beware of the elevator - it is tiny!!!! We ended up taking 2 trips.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding 3-Star Paris hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BruceFraser
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in Paris that combines very good service, great location, good value, and reasonable-to-good room dimensions is a hard 'nut to crack'. Hotel Brittanique does it. We stayed four nights during the cold and snow of mid-December 2009, including an extra night due to the Eurostar debacle, and we absolutely enjoyed the Hotel as our base. This is truly a great location, the area is also not noisy, the rooms are very good, and the staff were excellent. This will be our hotel of choice in Paris for the future....we couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: C0ltsfan
Reviews.Content: Great location. Hotel is very close to Chatelet train station, a block or so from the river and a short walk to the Louvre. Also, Notre Dame and many other sites are within walking distance and some great restaurants in the neighborhood. This being my wife and my first stay in Paris the staff was very helpful and very friendly. Room was extremely clean and nice. A little small for US standards, but bigger than several rooms I have stayed in in Belgium. Pretty normal European size. Plus we didn't spend much time in the room. We stayed on the 6th floor in the front and had a great view of the city including a nice view of the Tour Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Stayed At!!!”
Reviews.Author: Calohigirl
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed at in Paris. It was definitely worth the extra money. The rooms are much spacier than most Parisien hotels with the traveler in mind (desk, stools for placing luggage, large closet, etc). The staff was very nice and helpful and the entire hotel was just beautiful. Also great location by lots of shops and near the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “A very cute parisian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mew997
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for six nights between 13th of August and 19th of August in a standard double room. The truth is that the room was small but it was very clean, nicely decorated and felt very cosy. We liked it very much. The bathroom was very clean and also the ac worked very well. I am saying this because it was very hot in Paris during our stay. Breakfast was ok. The staff was very helpful and spoke english fluently so we did not have any communication problem. Thay were also keen to reserve us a table at a restaurant we wanted and also helped us to check in online the day before we left. They also booked us a shuttle bus to the airport for the price of 19 euros per person (for 2 people is 38 euros so it is cheaper than a taxi and more comfortable) The location was ideal for sightseeing since it was near place du chatelet so almost everything was in a walking distance and if it was not you could grab a taxi from place du chatelet. On the other hand it was in a very quiet road so there were not any sounds from the outside. It is a bit pricey for a three star hotel but if you consider the good location,the cleanliness and the nice room I think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “When you hear small rooms---believe it!!”
Reviews.Author: seabreeze2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Britannique for 2 nights in a room that supposedly accomodated 2 people (upper floor, facing the front). I'm so glad I didn't have to share my room with another person!! The room couldn't have been larger than 8x10 feet...barely enough room to walk around the bed. The balcony was maybe 3x5 feet with 2 small chairs and a table. The bathroom size didn't really bother me except for the fact that there were 2 oversize terry robes hung on the hook on the back of the door, which prevented the door from opening all the way. When the balcony doors were closed and the shades pulled down, it really was dark and quiet, except for the noise from the adjacent rooms (paper thin walls between rooms). Even when the heat was off, the room got stuffy during the night, which necessitated leaving the balcony doors open until I couldn't deal with the light and noise any longer. The elevator was so tiny, there was only enough room for me and my suitcase. I had to share the elevator (without my suitcase) a couple of times with another hotel guest, which was awkward because we had to stand so close together (thank goodness for deoderant and breath mints)!! The only English language TV channel was the BBC. Not that I went to Paris to watch TV, but CNN would have been a nice option while getting ready to go out and about. On the plus side, the location was great, it was clean and nicely decorated, and the staff spoke very good English and was very helpful. The breakfast buffet was adequate and convenient, but nothing to write home about. Overall, not a bad place, just make sure you are prepared for small!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & great locations”
Reviews.Author: SusieQTraveler
Reviews.Content: Small room, even for a single, but very clean and in a great location! Go for the included breakfast, it's a good deal (British style breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: D-en-G_3000
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in 1er arr. with everything within walking distance. Rooms are not big but okay. Almost no noice from outside. Breakfast was very good but your stuck away in some basement room. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bovinda
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was carefully chosen after reading tons of reviews on TripAdvisor on the thousands hotels in Paris. We knew Paris was expensive and that the size of the rooms would have been tiny in comparison with the rest of Europe, but we also knew that a very very expensive hotel doesn't always mean good standard. And so we went with the Britannique because it was perfectly located (believe me, if I didn't get lost you won't!) very highly rated and the price was not excessive. Also we wanted a totally non-smoking hotel (not always the case in Paris!) which was also a bit more traditional in style. Everything was as we expected it, we stayed in room 51 which had a lovely balcony, very quiet location and literally a stone throw from the Sein and Notre Dame. Personell outstanding, helped us in every way they could and made our stay just perfect. The room wasn't that small at all and it was extremely clean. Also, the occasion for us was my husband birthday and they left in the room a chocholate box for him as a present! We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to request a room "in the front on an upper floor"!”
Reviews.Author: addy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel because of favorable reviews on TripAdvisor and its location [near the Louvre, Pompidou Center, etc]. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed with our room[s] and decamped for another hotel in the vicinity. The problem? Though we had booked for 3 nights in October back in August, we were shown to a small room in the back with a view of a wall. The room was very dark - as depressing as it gets. We asked for another room and were shown one on the first floor facing the street and were told that was all that was available. It was small too but at least lighter and we could see something out the window. Alas, the street in front of the hotel was being torn up and being on the first floor we had no privacy and the noise was a problem. We couldn't have the window open and at night, a street light and the hotel's own spotlight shown right in our eyes. For the astronomical price of $400 per night at the exchange rate, we were unhappy enough to search for something else. We found a room at Duo near the Hotel de Ville which though also quite small at least was on an upper floor facing the street. When we returned to Britannique and said we were checking out, guess what? A large suite on an upper floor had suddenly become available for no extra charge...Since by then we just wanted out of there, we declined. My advice is, if you are going to this hotel anytime soon, be aware there is significant construction on the street in front. Nevertheless, you do not want a room in the back. I'm sure the upper floors are better rooms - make sure you ask for one "in the front on an upper floor". We were very unlucky at this place and cannot recommend it because of our experience. I might also add that, though the lobby a couple of steps down from reception is comfortable and plushly decorated, the breakfast room has a "basement" feel and the buffet is pretty bare bones and not very appetizing, another negative for the rate.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING A TOURIST COULD ASK FOR--IF A BIT PRICEY!”
Reviews.Author: Howie36
Reviews.Content: A small period (1930's) hotel, very recently redecorated, on a quiet street 100 metres from the Seine, located between Chatelet and Mont Saint Michel metro stations. Excellent service, immaculate rooms (if somewhat compact), well isolated from street noise. Through the wall, room to room noise, can be a nuisance . Clearly very popular with Americans and Britons. A very comfortable and quiet ground floor lounge. Good buffet breakfast in comfortable dining room at E13 per person. No hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “J'taime Hotel Britannique!”
Reviews.Author: fishercarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Britannique for four nights over Columbus Day weekend. We found the hotel off of Trip Advisor and chose it based on the reviews and overall rating and we were not at all disappointed. The hotel staff was extremely nice. We had to delay our arrival a day (last minute and unexpected) and they were extremely accomodating. They also allowed us into the room first thing in the morning when we arrived and did not charge us for the early arrival. The rooms are very spacious, bed was very comfortable, we had a fabulous balcony, bathroom was clean updated and roomy, and the location was perfect. We will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms with paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: ENewberg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have lived in NYC, Chicago and SF for the past 18 years and are very use to small spaces and city noise. We read about this in advance about Britannique but thought it wouldn't be too bad. We were wrong. The walls are paper thin and the unfortunately too many people use their televisions or talk too loudly. We had to move after 4 nights. The people were nice however the music in the breakfast room was a bit bleak (not charming). For less money we found 3 different hotels on the left bank, St. Germain that were much larger, more stylish and with equal or better location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautifully kept.”
Reviews.Author: ks13
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a brief stay at the Britannique, it was easy to find and absolutely central to our needs for Paris. We could walk to Notre Dame and Le Lourve in 5 minutes. The room was small but very clean, beautifully decorated and very quaint. If there was a critism it would be that the rooms AC made a peculiar noise once turned off for upto an hour, this could be heard from other AC units nearby - but hey ho. Cest La Vie!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely hotel, warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RamblingGirl321
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay here. The room on the top floor was small, but I had a nice view when I peeked out the window. I had asked for a quiet room but realized when I got there that the hotel is at the end of a street without much traffic so generally I think all rooms are quiet. There is a Metro station just a block away and a great bakery around the corner. I was exploring cheese shops while there and got some great tips from one of the women at the front desk. (And even unloaded some of the cheese I didn't like on her for her husband!) They have a cozy sitting room where you can read and they even brought me a glass of wine there in the evening. Anick Goutal products in the bathroom which was nice. Overall a great experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bouncy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Britannique for three days as part of a multi-stop trip at the end of September. We spent a long time looking on TripAdvisor for the correct place in Paris within our budget and we weren't disappointed. Although a little on the small side there was still plenty of room for our two suitcases and everything that came out of them! We had a room on the top floor, which gave us a clear view of the Eiffel Tower (check out the light show for the first 5 minutes of every hour after dark!) and view of the rooftops of the surrounding area, which was really pretty. We were on the road side. I think I would have been more disappointed if I'd have been on the courtyard side as that didn't seem as nice; but the road side was a bit more noisy, especially with the roadworks outside starting at 8am on the dot every morning! The room was beautifully clean and well appointed. The bathroom was spotless and the shower was hot and strong. We couldn't fault the service from the staff at the hotel and they all spoke exceptional English making it friendly even if you don't speak French. My tip of the stay would be to go to a local supermarket (one near C&A just behind the hotel) and buy cheese and wine, and then get some fresh bread from the boulangerie/patisserie (just around the corner - come out the hotel turn right and right again -not open Sun/Mon) and sit on the Siene bank and have a lovely relaxing early evening watching the sun setting - we did it every night and it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and we will return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyn10s
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Britannique for 4 nights while celebrating our 25th Anniversary, It was a fabulous location to see the sights in Paris. It is on a fairly quiet street but a one minute walk to the river. The breakfast was good and worth the price if you eat a large breakfast. The windows do a good job blocking out noise and the shades make the room very dark if you need to catch some sleep during daylight. The elevator is tiny and sometimes you have to wait a while for it. We always used the stairs down and sometimes up but we were on the 6th floor. It is a short walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame. Metros are nearby. We walked to the L'Arc De Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower but it takes a while. My first time in Paris and I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JEH_CT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (relatively seasoned travelers) recently took his parents (in their 80's, somewhat limited mobility for him, not seasoned travelers) to Normandy and Paris. The Hotel Brittanique in Paris was a gem! Small boutique hotel but had everything we needed to be comfortable. We had rooms 25 and 55. Rooms were of a reasonable size (given its Europe ... need to realize they will be smaller than Americans generally used to), lovely bathrooms, a small elevator so didn't need to lug our luggage upstairs. The common sitting room was quite pretty and had a computer hooked up that guests could use. Continental breakfast was a little pricey but well done with eggs, saugage, breads/croissants, cheeses, cereal etc. The staff at the front desk was also quite pleasant and helpful (I would especially point out the very very nice and competant brunette woman from Vancouver Canada as being top notch). The location of the hotel was also quite convenient ... several nearby metro stops, walking distance to the Seine, Notre Dame and the Louvre. Several fine brasseries also nearby were nice to stop in for a later evening nightcap and cheese. All in all we had a terrific time and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cute hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights during a trip to Europe for our 3rd anniversary. Overall, we enjoyed it and would stay here again Paris was our first stop from the US so we arrived quite early and could not check in. They did have a baggage room for us to store our things in and pointed us in the direction of things we wanted. Our room was ready when we came back and was nice and clean- small but that is to be expected. We had a room with a balcony, which was a great addition. The shower was fine but leaked some water into the bathroom. The wireless internet worked well. Location is great you are literally steps from the METRO and very close to Notre Dame, etc. The staff is knowledgable and friendly. Check out was smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - this hotel is a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaGirl54
Reviews.Content: I found this gem of a hotel on TripAdvisor and it exceeded my expectations. The location was perfect - we could walk to many museums/monuments and the rest were only a stop or two away from one of the Metro lines at Chatelet. Lots of great cafes and restaurants in the area as well. Great buffet breakfast which went beyond the usual Continental fare. The staff was unbelievably nice and helpful and were most accomodating of every request. We were there for a week so we met many of them and they all treated us like special guests. We talked to another guest that has been staying here for 10 years and he says the service has been consistently great. I highly recommend this hotel for location, service, value, and the clean nicely appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanakaboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Britannique for 4 nights when celebrating our Ruby Wedding - 40 years!The hotel location is excellent, on bus/ underground routes and walking distance to Louvre/ Notre Dame, and Pompidou Centre. The hotel is very clean and reasonably quiet for centre of a busy city ( we had room on front of hotel.) We never heard any other guests. Breakfast was fine and in a nice cosy breakfast room. We really relaxed here and the staff were fantastic. So friendly and helpful, we even had compimentary English tea in the afternoon in our room. This hotel comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location .. lovely little hotel..”
Reviews.Author: getawayanyday
Reviews.Content: Excellent for a romantic break, took my wife for first anniversary. Very central - good for Louvre , Metro , St Germain. Nice and clean room 'slightly' on the cosy side. Good breakfast buffet with hot options.. Hotel organised a beautiful bouquet of flowers and champagne for the room .. Although whilst changing rooms the maid threw out the flowers which we found very disappointing and not really explained .... the replacement was not as good... Very helpful reception organised evening tickets/restaurant bookings etc ..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Britanique”
Reviews.Author: Rabor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I staid in Paris for 6 nights (from August 30 till September 5). One cannot have a better location to stay in Paris. The hotel is perfectly located for the tourists planning to get knowing Paris, especially by walking. Many Paris' beautiful places and museums are at the walking distance from the hotel: Ile De La Site, Ile De Saint Louis, Jardin Du Luxembourg, Jardin Des Tuileries, Notre Dame, Latin Quater, and many many others. We even waked to the Alexander III Bridge (Place of Invalides) - about 40 minutes one way, to the Arc de Triomphe - about one hour along the Champs-Elysees, and to the Eiffel Tower - about 1.5 hour along Seine River. Service is very good, rooms are clean. We had one unfortunate incident with somebody's dirty stocks appearing on the night table. After I brought it to reception's attention, management had sincerely apologized to me and offered a complementary breakfast. Also - for some strange reason, they do not provide the shower caps, so plan on having it with you. The hotel offers the complementary WiFi connection - worked fine, and I was able to read the news on the WEB and to check my e-mails. The room (#32 - street exposure, no balcony) was great - small, with the king size bed, and very cozy and clean. Two huge windows can be wide open allowing fresh air in. If you are planning on having several electronic gadgets as I had with me, get ready to take with you the power cord, - there is not enough power wall outlets in the room. And, obviously don't forget a few 220v European power outlet adapters (I had 5 with me - used them all for my camcorder, photo camera, GPS, and two cell phones). The room has a safe with the code lock, it was working fine, so I used it for some of my valuables and purchases I have made. It was not trivial to understand how to use the lock, so I had to figure out it myself and only then I found a small sheet with the instructions on the table. Bathroom is a bit small, but still convenient and very clean. Towels are changed every day. After you check in, you may want to ask them for some more soap bars, as we had only one prepared in the bathroom, and bar us really small. There is an air-conditioner in the room - located just above the entrance door with the regulator on the wall. It's cooling the room sufficiently. We had a chance to try it it for the couple of days while the days in Paris were quite hot (up to 30 degrees Celsius). Breakfast, the hotel provides, is not extremely good. Despite the price for the buffet type of breakfast (15 euro per person), I could not persuade myself to eat it. We tried several various places to eat in Paris (breakfast and dinner alike), even using the hints from the well known "Tom's Guide to Paris", and we found the best to be the "Zimmerman" restaurant just across the street from the hotel. Breakfast for two: two omelets (one - with bacon), one big vegetable salad, two coffees, and three small croissants - all cost about 35 euro. The weather was not very good for the last three days of our stay - clouds and rain. I regretted I did not take a sweater and a raincoat with me. All in all, it was a great, unforgettable stay in Paris, we very much enjoyed, in large part due to the hotel we chose to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Take your earplugs and eat out”
Reviews.Author: Owlooker
Reviews.Content: To start on a positive note. The reception staff were as pleasant and as helpful as it was possible to be. The location could not be better. The room was adequately comfortable and the bathroom was ok. On the negative side, had we not taken earplugs on our visit, it would have been impossible to get a decent night's sleep. We could hear everything around us from conversations to bodily functions, and on to amorous activities. This hotel would benefit greatly from investment in noise reduction - and so would the guests. The breakfast was included in the price as an "offer". This "offer" was far more valuable to the hotel as a marketing tool, than it was to us as a breakfast.
