The "variety", in addition to bread, included scrambled egg and appalling sausages. Two kinds of very ordinary cereal, two types of cooked meat and cheese. Also a limited amount of yoghurt. Nothing changed at all during our four-day stay. In short, it was unbelievably boring and, at 13 euros each, very poor value. At best, this hotel is ok and, for what they charge to stay there, it should be better than that. We shall not return.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Cawfeetawk
Reviews.Content: The good: location 1 block from Metro, included breakfast good (esp. French yogurt and pastries), pleasant bilingual staff. The not so good: Tiny room (#15), no window screen, hard bed that seemed more uncomfortable with each successive night. Free Wi-Fi is a joke; only worked if you stood with your laptop out in the hall next to the closet where the router is apparently located. Though the hotel is a couple of blocks from the Ille (location of Notre Dame, Le Conciergerie, etc) the downside of that is that the Prefecture de Police is also sited there, resulting in the blare of police sirens at all hours. Awkward round-bottomed tub with half-wall enclosure and hand-held shower meant wet floors and only the bare minimum of towels to deal with it. But the bathroom clean and otherwise ok though tiny. Several restaurants close by; especially enjoyed "Le Palais et le Robe." the artisan boulangerie, and the crepe stand across from the little park. The big downer for me was the homeless woman who nightly took up residence on the sidewalk next door by the florist.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon in Paris fabulous, made so special at Hotel Britannique”
Reviews.Author: PerthFlorence
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Paris or France before we were excited, As this was our Honeymoon I was looking for a stylish and romantic hotel close to the centre of everything, I was highley recommended hotel Britannique by friends, and looked it up on the internet I was impressed by the beautifuly French decorated rooms and the proximity to the river, I booked immediately, We did not expect to receive such a wonderful welcome. The staff at the desk were very friendly spoke english helpful with directions made us feel very special, they went out of there way to make this time for us memorable, We cannot thank them enough, The breakfast room was delightful the large breakfast very fresh and satisfying,Our room was comfortable and quiet we will be recommending this hotel to everyone going to Paris. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - couldnt be better placed”
Reviews.Author: AniD1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Britannique for 4 nights in August, and the best thing about this quaint hotel is the amazing location. Its about 3 minutes walk from the Seine, and close to one of the best metro junctions in Paris. Being first-timers in the city we were prepared to tramp up and down streets when we first got here, but it took us about 45 minutes from the airport to the hotel lobby! Excellent for walking around, and accessing the museums and other attractions in the city. They also have a nice breakfast, and staff is very helpful (uniformly so!).. plus you get free Wifi. Although a tad expensive (and the rooms are Paris-style small), we found it totally worth the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, Fantastic location, Courteous staff, Delicious Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DandMReady2Travel
Reviews.Content: Just a few steps from the Metro stop, one block from the Seine, across the bridge from Isle de la Cite (between Pont Neuf and Ave. St. Michel) -- Hotel Britannique is in a fantastic location. The staff speaks English, are friendly and go out of their way to help. The rooms were quite large for Paris standards and had good bathrooms, comfortable beds, good A/C and very sound-proof windows. The breakfast provided was delicious. Everything about this stay was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lek018
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, in the centre of Paris near Notre Dame, the Louvre, Ile St. Louis. Although our room was very small, it was very clean and pleasant, with a lovely spotless bathroom, flat screen TV and large window which you could open up for a view over the wide street below. The only drawback was the noise from the street at night but with the double glazed windows shut (it was very hot and we had them open) I'm sure this is not a problem. There is a teapot and cups etc but hot water is only available from the reception from 2pm to 9pm for some reason which is a shame as we would have liked a cup of tea in the morning. We paid for the breakfast which was very nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: KTW1
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The staff were all helpful and friendly, and the location is perfect if you are in Paris to sight see....5 minute walk to Notre Dame and 5 minute walk to the Louvre. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Irisheyes01
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique is a small, French hotel (not a chain) in a perfect location for a weekend tourist to Paris. There are many Metro stations within easy walking distance from the hotel as well as many sights within easy walking without the Metro. Just a 5 -10 minute stroll from the Louvre, Tuleries Gardens, Notre Dame and St Chapelle. The breakfast was very nice - buffet style with all you could ask for. The rooms are typically small, but very nicely decorated - the same goes for the bathroom. All the staff spoke perfect English and were very nice. If you don't want to spend your weekend in taxis back and forth from your hotel to the sights, this is the area for you and Hotel Britannique is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: DC_traveler_gal
Reviews.Content: Simply perfect. I can not say enough about how lovely the hotel was and how very friendly and helpful the staff is. Upon our arrival, even though we showed up at 10am, we were nicely greeted and showed to our two tween rooms. After reading some of the reviews in this thread i was worried about the size of the room, but to my great surprise they were HUGE , especially by European standards. We stayed in #2 and#3, which are both non the first floor, and though you miss out on a french window and flower pots, you get a lot of space and easy access to the entrance, which is really convenient if you are traveling with elderly people. Both rooms had minibar that we often used as a fridge and were nicely decorated, very clean and comfortable (as were bathrooms in both rooms). Room #3 even has a small love seat. The AC works rather well, and if you need to you can open the windows. The hotel staff was beyond accommodating - we urgently needed a wheelchair, and they have arranged for a weekly rental right away, arranged everything smoothly and even helped us out to use credit card for security deposit (the renter wanted cash). In general all our requests were attended to immediately and in best fashion. We got the rooms on special offer, so the breakfast was included. The small dining room is charming and cozy. The baked goods, cheeses and yogurts were delicious, although if i had to pay 13 euro for the breakfast, i would probably opted for the nearby cafe. Of course, LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Super convenient. You can walk most everywhere. Great hotel, and i can't wait to stay there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, good location, helpful staff. I won't stay anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: zulu5
Reviews.Content: This beautiful little hotel is perfectly located, extremely clean and has a wonderful staff. Everyone was ready to help and spoke beautiful English, which we needed! The rooms were nicely appointed and the bathroom/shower was bigger than the others I've seen in Paris. I've already recommended this hotel to one of my best friends who also loved it on his recent stay in Paris. It is quaint and gorgeous all at the same time. And the bakery around the corner is fantastic too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in a perfect city”
Reviews.Author: sukicart
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Britannique and we were certainly not disappointed. The rooms are small but very comfortable, quiet and have amenities like robes. The staff is definately 4*, very welcoming and always helpful. The location is perfect for getting almost anywhere in Paris and the neighborhood is comfortable with lots of great restaurants within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: CaptainCraig
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique is in the perfect spot for exploring the heart of Paris. My wife and I spent just a few days there but the hotel helped us make the most of our Paris experience. The staff at the front desk provided excellent advice on places to eat, things to do and navigating the city's transportation system. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. This hotel gets high marks for service well above the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: linadal1
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with small but very clean rooms. Very helpful staff that spoke English. Nice, quiet neighborhood near Notre Dame, the Seine and the Lourve.

Reviews.Title: “Truly fab! well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Eleniontour
Reviews.Content: hello, this was a truly faboulous hotel! wonderufl helpful service. excelletn location, lovely balcony, lovely room, bijoux and beautiful. no fuss and trouble. anything you need they got it! also the breakfast was lovely. no noise. excellent shower and bath accessories. clean towells changed everyday! most importantly of all CLEAN and i mean spotless! safe and well located MERCI God bless

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a small”
Reviews.Author: arthurelliot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated for touring around Paris. However, the room was even smaller than I expected. We were in a classic double, and there was enough room for a queen size bed with approximately 1-2 feet on each side of the bed - and that's it. Very tiny. The bathroom was nice, though. I peaked inside of some of the other rooms while they had the door open for cleaning and some rooms had quite a bit more space. So maybe it just depends on the room that you get. The folks at the front desk were very helpful for the most part, although one man working the night shift claimed it was impossible for us to get an extra pillow, which to me seemed odd. They got us one the next day. We had a fairly good stay, though next time I visit Paris I would probably opt to stay at a larger hotel with bigger rooms and more ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly small”
Reviews.Author: slimmer1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights of our two-week honeymoon. Perfectly located in Paris - completely accessible by foot down Rivoli to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Hotel de Ville, surrounding shopping and endless amounts of restaurants, boulangeries, Metro, etc. Staff were very helpful for directions, recommendations and even made a few reservations for dinner for us. Requested a king-size bed and received one, but it took up the room. Room and bathroom were small, but the hotel has been around since 1861; what would you expect?! Balcony had a lovely view. Don't take the elevator if you're claustrophobic - it is something like 2.5 feet by 3 feet inside. Take the stairs. Walls are thin, but again the place is 150 years old. Light sleepers beware - you're in a downtown metropolis; Paris in fact! Would/will stay again for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “lovely in the city of love”
Reviews.Author: roserandom
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay if you want a perfect location and charming, helpful staff. Even my poor attempts at french were smiled at! The breakfasts were delicious and nothing was too much trouble. there were plenty of guide books in the lounge as well as sweets! just the thing before a busy day of touristing! If you want to see Paris then you cannot go wrong staying here as your base. Will stay again when i get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Paris”
Reviews.Author: paolorotondo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a romantic athmosfere, above all it is very clean. The room elegant and quite, the staff very polite and helpful, the breakfast not too various but of high quality. Sure I'll return there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Britannique!”
Reviews.Author: HotPantsMalone
Reviews.Content: What an adorable hotel! The location is AMAZING -- we walked everywhere: the Louvre, the D'Orsay, the Marais, and Notre Dame, which was REALLY really close. Service was fantastic. It was nice that the staff was fluent in English. They made reservations for us at a restaurant we really wanted to go to, which was difficult to get into, and found us a great restaurant another night. My room was well sized by European standards and the view was lovely (on the sixth floor). We had no problem with noise, and the bathroom was actually fairly sizable. The lift is VERY small, but that's Paris for you. Overall, the place is very very charming. Hotel's breakfast was ample and delicious. I was not charged for the mornings I did not partake, unlike an earlier reviewer. I will absolutely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: pmartin500
Reviews.Content: Nice central location- close to the Metro. Rooms small as expected but nicely furnished. We had some problems with controlling the heat- the room tended to be too warm even though it was cold outside. Also, note that they will add a charge for breakfast even if you don't go.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Perfect”
Reviews.Author: yesitisI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2008 for a weekend and it was a perfect hotel for the experience I wanted. The room was spotlessly clean with a charming view of of the square and the city. The room wasn't huge but was ideal for just me. The location was great and I walked everywhere in Paris I wanted to go. Overall, I am in love with not only Paris but the hotel Britannique as well and can't wait to return to both.

Reviews.Title: “This is my Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackieFas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Britannique mainly due to the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was delighted with this hotel. Great location near the Louvre, major Metro station and a short walk away from Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter and the Marais district. I was sharing a room with my son so we had a room with 2 single beds. The room was very pretty, a decent size with ultra-comfortable beds. It looks as though it has been recently refurbished, spotlessly clean with most of the comforts we were looking for. While not large, the room was of a sufficient size that my son and I were not falling over one another and we had enough closet space. The bathroom was newly refurbished and of a really good size - again spotlessly clean. The room was at the back of the hotel so while we had no view, we also had no noise. It was easy to control heat and all the windows had good, modern blinds on them. Breakfast was great - lots of good quality food, replenshed constantly so you were eating fresh, hot food. It was a nice buffet and satisfied the large appetite of my 20 year old son. Good strong coffee. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They advised us how to get places, easiet ways of travel and booked a tour to Versailles for us. They were exceptionally willing to try and help. It would have been nice to have an alarm clock, although the wake-up call I requested came on time. A kettle to heat water would also have been appreciated although you can get hot water from the desk up until 9 pm. I will definitely stay at this hotel the next time I visit Paris. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good - even for business travel!”
Reviews.Author: Kevlondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Britannique for one night , largely based on what I had read here on TripAdvisor. I arrived open-minded, as leisure and business travellers tend to look for different things in a hotel, and most of the reviews I read were by holidaymakers. I needn't have been concerned, the Britannique comes up to scratch on most counts for business travel too. I stayed in room 22, having specifically requested a room with a balcony (I'm a smoker, and prefer not to smoke in my room where possible). The room was quite small but perfectly adequate by Paris standards, but most importantly it was spotless. Nothing turns a hotel stay into a nightmare faster than a poorly-cared-for room, in my opinion. No such worries here though. Plenty of wardrobe space, a small desk area with lamp and flat-screen TV, enough power points and plenty of lighting options. Good quality shower, nice toiletries, enough towels. The breakfast buffet was fine and included in the room price - a nice bonus. At least one English-language newspaper, just a shame it wasn't the Herald Tribune. The beds were amazingly comfortable, the linens as good as new. The whole place seems to have been refurbished recently, and the double-glazed windows with fitted blinds are great at blocking out sound and light. OK, so there are things this place could improve upon. A bedside alarm clock would be good, as would more channels on the TV (8 channels isn't much these days). A kettle added to the amenity tray would be useful, as well as access to more tea/coffee if needed (hot water available from reception, but only til 9pm). But these are only minor defects - as a cost-effective option that doesn't feel like you're economising, this place would come high up the list.

Reviews.Title: “Very warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ivyfalls
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the Tripadvisor reviews. Needless to say, the Britannique was a charming boutique hotel in an excellent location. The hotel is expertly maintained, clean and well appointed. The balcony rooms are a must. I will always remember the delightful "bon jour Madam", I recieved every morning from the hotel staff and the Bon Soiree I received every evening when I returned. Merci for the wonderful stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: STC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last July. The 1er location can’t be beat. Just a short walk to ND, Louvre, and D’Orsay. This is a charming hotel with a pleasant, helpful staff. Rooms 2, 3, 4, and 5 are just above the lobby/reception desk and don’t require use of the lift. So, next time we’re there, I’d request one of those rooms. Room 63 has a partial view of the Tour Eiffel and Notre Dame. Rooms 45 and 55 are twin bedded rooms, very nice size. We had a great dinner across the street at Zimmer. Also, within walking distance, we had our last night’s dinner at L’Escargot Montorgueil, which was so much fun, because we all enjoyed a variety of escargot preparations. We definitely recommend Hotel Britannique.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LKM2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Britannique for a week over Dec 08/Jan 09. When we booked we were told there was only one twin room left, while we were looking for a double room we decided to take the twin room because of all the positive reviews on tripadvisor. We were so pleased with the hotel, it was exactly as the photos on their website. The staff were incredibly helpful, always happy to help with advice on our daily tours etc. Literally across the road is the metro stop, we only used this once or twice during our stay because you can literally walk everywhere from the hotel. It is so centrally located. There are lots of restaurants and cafes close-by, also little supermarkets and a McDonalds. The breakfasts were great, the lounge lovely - all in all a really wonderful experience. We will definitely return to Hotel Britannique when we next visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: amarkovi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris after having spent a week there in Hotel Britannique. The location is superb,it is 5min. from "everything": Louvre, Notre Dame, Center Pompidou, shopping department stores, restaurants, bars .... we used the metro maybe twice during our stay. We used Tripadvisor for research and decided on Britannique based on reviews and excellent offer we received from the hotel: EUR 150 for a double w/breakfast. We were on the 4th floor (elevator) facing the front street. The room is not big but comfortable and well disposed - there is a double closet (with a safe) in the entrance, king sized bed (slept very well...) with a small night desk on each side, a desk with TV, a chair and a holder for the travel case. The bathroom is also not huge but you can normally move around and use it (I've heard all sorts of stories on hotels in Paris....), you get a two sets of towels and a robe each, there are shampoos, soap, shower cap - everything. The room is cleaned every day. We were there in the winter and it was very cold (below 0C every day) but the room was heated all day long, we even had to turn the heating off at night because it got too hot. The hotel itself has a reception desk in the lobby, a lounge, and a breakfast area. There is someone at the desk 24h a day and the staff is very friendly. Everyone spoke English. The breakfast is excellent and abundant: there are eggs, sausages, ham, 5-6 types of cheese, fruit, fruit salad, muesli, 3-4 types of croissants, 3-4 types of bread, coffee, tea, yogurt....and so on - you will not be hungry! The only negative side is the wifi access: there is a hotspot however you have to purchase traffic at the reception, and we could not do that either because they had some technical problems (we were given, though, a 20min. free card). I think every hotel should have a free wifi internet access, or at least offer it for a symbolic charge that could be included in the room price. So basically this is a 4.5 rating; we went to look at some other hotels we were considering and this one is the closest in real life to what is shown on their website (even better) and I would recommend this hotel for its price range - definitely a "best-buy".

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: CandNMontreal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights in early October, 2008. We had consulted the reviews on Trip Advisor.com which gave a very strong positive recommendation and we were more than delighted to find that our experience was fully in line with the strong rating of 4.5 out of 5. Our twin room was comfortable, well appointed and even though it overlooked Rue Victoria, was very quiet thanks to the excellent sound profing, the black out blinds and the thermostatically controlled air conditioning system that made it unnecessary to open the windows. We arrived early in the morning dog tired from the sleeper train from Venice; Sara on the front desk and housekeeping did everything to get us into our room and we did get into it around noon instead of 2pm. Although we had an excellent breakfast on Sunday, our last day, we preferred to breakfast at the Boulangerie/Cafe around the corner (recommended by the front desk)which served wonderful omelettes, fresh squeezed OJ, croissant, toasted baguettes, cafe americain and cafe au lait. We were greeted every morning with a cheery "bonjour monsieur dame" by the delightful ladies who provided our great breakfasts. A tip, when going to Charles de Gaulle, get the front desk to reserve a shuttle, rather than a taxi. The shuttle cost 17 Euros per person, about half the cost of a taxi ride at 70 euros or more. The location is superbly central next to the Pont St Michel and next to the Chatelet metro stop, the most central stop in Paris. We found the staff to be uniformly pleasant, helpful and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel, decent price”
Reviews.Author: jml66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon in September 2008. First, the location is practically unbeatable. It is located just a short (5-10 minute) walk from either the Louvre or Notre Dame. It is also directly next to the Les Halles Metro stop, making for easy access to just about anywhere without much trouble. The rooms are fairly small, but are otherwise quite comfortable, and are nicely decorated. Although they face a busy street, the windows are double-paned, resulting in very little street noise. The air conditioning works well and the bathroom is well appointed. The elevator is quite tiny, but this is more quaint than a genuine bother. The breakfast is somewhat overpriced at 13 Euro per head, but has a good selection. The staff is overall quite friendly and helpful. The price is quite good, especially considering this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannique is superb!”
Reviews.Author: JulieMSurrey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights in a standard double room. The room was an average size, but absolutely beautifully finished in soft beige and rich burgundy. Everything was spotless and appeared brand new. The staff were exceptionally friendly and professional, very welcoming which is just what you need after a tiring journey. I loved the location; close to shops, cafes, the Seine, Notre Dame, the Louvre etc. Situated on a very quiet street. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet which was included in our special offer price listed on the hotel's website. We would not hesitate to stay at this lovely hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: onero
Reviews.Content: The heart of Paris is the Ille de la Cite, the island in the centre of the River Seine on which stand many historic buildings like Notre Dame. Facing this island, on one side, are the numerous restaurants of The Left Bank. On the right bank is Place du Chatelet - a large Square in the centre of which is a fountain with four Sphinx and a tall pillar crowned by a golden Nike (dedicated to Napoleon's victories in Egypt.) Chatelet is also the largest underground metro stop in Paris, with lines going everywhere so it's perfect for transport. And in a little side street (Avenue Victoria) just 20 metres from Place du Chatelet is the Hotel Britannique. The Hotel Britannique, as the name implies, is a hotel catering for English speakers. It's small - the rooms are small and the lift that carries you up to them is tiny. But believe me, the word 'small' here merely implies 'cosy' (the French call it a Bijou Hotel ... and bijou means 'jewel'.) We though so too. The Hotel Britannique really is a gem, set in the very heart of Paris. We booked directly via email, asking for Room 51 after reading many positive reviews. We had an immediate reply and our booking was confirmed overnight. Everything was ready when we arrived. Check-in was fast, and we were soon on our way up in the tiny lift. Room 51 is in the front of the hotel (see photo) and turned out to be a little gem with its own balcony (see photos) and a good-sized bathroom. It was spotlessly clean, nicely furnished in a period style, and the bed was impressive and comfortable. We never had a problem nor a complaint with the room and the hotel, and we've recommended it to all our friends since. You could grumble about size, if you were the grumbling type. But nobody likes a grouch and anyway you're in Paris, in a room with a view. Enjoy. The Hotel Britannique serves breakfast, and we checked out its cosy little dining room. The breakfast looked fine - it costs about 12 Euros a day and you can choose to eat brekky daily or not, as you like. We chose not, because Paris beckoned. There are cafes all around the Hotel Britannique in whatever direction you walk. Most looked tempting, filled as their windows are with delicious pastries. For instance, walk out the door of the hotel and turn right. Just around the first corner within 20 yards are four very good pastry/breakfast cafes and two Metro entrances, But most people turn left and walk 20 metres to the Place du Chatelet which has several large and popular cafes on each corner. They all have tables outside, usually filled with tourists engaging in a Parisian's favourite habit - watching people go by. But here's a TIP: When choosing a cafe in the Place du Chatelet, you'll quickly notice the ones nearest the Hotel Britannique are usually packed, whereas the ones on the opposite side of the Square seem much less busy. This has more to do with the traffic flow and the direction of the sun than it does with the quality of the cafes. Don't be a lemming ... leave the crowds and cross over Chatelet, admiring the fountain as you go, and head for a cafe called La Mistral on the far side of the Square by the riverbank. Take a seat at a front table, and look DOWN the river past all those crowded cafes opposite. You'll see what they miss - a perfectly framed view of The Eiffel Tower - for your eyes only! We enjoyed that view each morning as we sipped our coffee prior to a day's exploring the sights. In the evening, the Eiffel Tower lights up with 3000 lightbulbs and a revolving spotlight on top. If you're having coffee at La Mistreal in the evening, wait for the hour to strike. Every hour on the hour, those 3000 lightbulbs put on their own spectacular light show - they shimmer and twinkle for ten minutes. One final word about the staff at Hotel Britannique. The cleaning staff do the rooms every day and are very efficient. Never had a problem, and the rooms have a personal safe/vault if you need to secure precious items. The front desk staff are also good people who speak English and are very helpful. The front desk is staffed 24/7, often by several people, so there's no long waits in a queue. The staff can also book tours. arrange phone calls, etc. But a little warning - the staff are great hotel people but not necessarily experts at guiding you around Paris. They have free maps, and generally live locally, so they have local knowledge which they share freely and happily. But you should always rely on your own research and street-smarts, and double-check for yourself what others tell you, so you don't misunderstand directions or get unintentionally mis-directed.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: TravelatorAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this quaint little hotel for our first anniversary trip and can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay! I read tons of reviews before choosing a hotel and decided that its location and the queen beds made it a winner in its price range. It is recommended in several travel guides and ranked very high on this site, and rightly so! We did not experience the noise problem that other reviews listed, so I would have to assume those travelers simply had rude neighbors which you can't blame the hotel for. Sarah at the front desk was so sweet and patient with our attempts to speak french. We found that all of the staff was really helpful and accommodating. Since there are not very many rooms, the staff also knew our names which we loved! The breakfast was good. Definitely a little expensive, but in this area of town the bistros weren't really much cheaper and certainly don't give you as much food. The location is perfect! You can walk almost anywhere in the city and Notre Dame and the Louvre are both within a few blocks! There is also a major Metro hub around the corner where you can catch a train anywhere in the city that you may think is too far to walk. The front desk can also book any tours you may want to take or shows you might want to see. There is also a strip of affordable stores just down the street for those of us who can't afford Gucci and the other high fashion brands located on the Champs Elysee. I will never stay anywhere other than this lovely little hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best for a first timer”
Reviews.Author: evraks
Reviews.Content: Been there for our honeymoon with my wife.. It was our first time in Paris [ definitely not the last time I hope :-) ]... The hotel is in a really wonderful place.. You can access to all Paris easily using the Chatelet metro station which is right accross the street.. Also the hotel staff was really kind and helpful.. Thanks for everbody in the Britannique.. Definitely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a First Timer in Paris”
Reviews.Author: fortune5
Reviews.Content: My husband, our three kids and I stayed in this hotel on June 18 thru 21 and back again on July 1 thru July 3. The location of the hotel was I thought convenient to all the major sites. You can walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame. The Hotel de Ville is next door and other major sites can be visited by taking the metro which is right across the street of the hotel but a major station called the 'chatelet' that connects to most of the metro routes is just around the corner of the block. There is a boulangerie around the corner in the back of the hotel where we had breakfast everyday. There are several cafes in the area where you can have your meals but excellent restaurants are reached only by metro or taxi cab. The interior of the hotel is as you see it in the pictures in their website and it is kept very clean by the cleaning staff. We felt very comfortable in our rooms. The bathrooms are modern and kept very clean by the staff. I love the Annick Goutal shampoos and soaps because this is my favorite perfume. There is a supermarcheabout a block from the hotel where you can buy evian water and other drinks. There is also a McDonalds where we had to visit once or twice because of the kids. One of our rooms was facing the street in front of the hotel (room 54) had a small terrace. On our last night in Paris, my husband and I opened a nice bottle of wine and sat on the terrace reveling on the sounds and lights of Paris. We had a partial view of the Eiffel Tower which was lighted with blue lights. The other room (room 55) was larger and accomodate three people. It had a view of the back of another building but is very clean. The front desk personnel were all very helpful and friendly. Very small elevator but what do you expect from an older Parisian building? I heard a few faint sounds from the other rooms and heard conversations next door but we did not mind. We were mindful fo the noise we made because of our children but did not hear any complaints. Have an open mind and enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sos100
Reviews.Content: Myself and three others (girlfriend, Mother, Sister) stayed here for three nights, four days over a long weekend. The hotel is lovely, and is in a brilliant location. The staff were very helpful, spoke English if and when we needed it (we tried some French occasionally for simple stuff). The rooms were lovely - clean, bright, nicely if ornately decorated. Good size for Paris (regulars in Paris will be used to the size of both hotel rooms, and hotel lifts). The hotel lift is the classic "one super-large person only" size :-) We didn't have breakfast there, so can't comment on that. Location is amazing; walking distance to basically everything. We walked over to Notre Dame, Ile de Saint Louis, Louvre, Tuilerie Gardens, Marais district etc. Took the Metro up to Montmartre :-) And to Roland Garros (French Open was on while we were there). There's a nice few places for breakfast or dinner very nearby, and the hotel itself is in a kind of cul-de-sac which makes it very quiet directly in front of the hotel. There's also a Velibe (bike stand for rentals) 20 yards from the front door. Highly recommended, and very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannique - a little gem on the Right Bank”
Reviews.Author: LancasterTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 good friends stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Britannique at the end of May and thoroughly enjoyed it. After considerable research including reviewing information on Trip Advisor and talking to my travel agent we selected the Hotel Britannique for the following reasons: Excellent location on the right bank near the Louvre and just 1 block to the Metro. There are numerous good bistro's within 1-3 blocks of the Hotel. The rates are reasonable. Ave. Victoria is a quaint and quiet street without much traffic. Right around the corner is a lovely bakery with very friendly staff that we had our coffee and pastries at every day. The staff at Hotel Britannique is very friendly, knowledgeable and extremely helpful. If you select the Hotel Britannique to stay in you too will not be disappointed, it is a lovely, quaint boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: 5492Cardinal
Reviews.Content: We recentoly spent 3 nights at this hotel. It is in an excellent location for central Paris with many attractions within walking distance and the metro on the corner. Everyone there was friendly and helpful. It's not quite as pretty as it looks on the website and a little tatty but comfortable and clean. One thing we could have wished for would have been some outside space like a little terrace or patio. We had a superior room with king sized bed, we were warned that we didn't have a balcony which we were disappointed about but actually it was a blessing as the road is quite a busy cut through and I think it may have been noisy at the front where the rooms have balconies whereas our room at the back was silent.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Kivaldo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic for many reasons. Firstly, the location is very central. It is situated one row back from the beautiful river Seine in a tranquil avenue and is approximately five minutes walk from Le Louvre and Notre Dame. There are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants in close proximity, but in reality nothing is very far away. If you wanted to venture further out, there is a metro stop on the corner of the street. The staff in this hotel are brilliant. They are all polite and friendly and really will go the extra mile to help you. Of the four staff we dealt with at reception during our stay, all of them spoke English which was a massive help. The service in this hotel is excellent. The hotel itself is very well looked after. The rooms and bathrooms are stylishly decorated and very clean. There is air-con, a safe, a mini-bar, the option of breakfast, flat screen televisions and many other services available. I would not think twice about using this hotel again if I visited Paris and would happily recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Staff, Warm Environment, and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OSUStudent
Reviews.Content: Of all places, I found this hotel in an MTV Europe travel guide book. I was looking for a place to stay in Paris after my study abroad ended in Dublin. The hotel was listed under the more-pricey options, but the comments said it was a good splurge. My main concern was finding a hotel that had an English-speaking staff, as I don't speak French. (I had a friend traveling with me that spoke French, but I didn't want to burden her with translating everything for me.) To avoid any confusion, I wanted to be able to handle all of the arrangements and the billing in English. From booking to billing, the staff was amazing. They were very quick to respond to my e-mail requests, friendly over the phone, and they were very helpful with anything that we needed during our stay there. They even helped us contact Lost Baggage at Charles de Gaulle when my friend could not get a hold of them. Our room faced the street, but it wasn't noisy at all. The rooms were well decorated and clean. I loved the antique feel to them. Some reviews I had read said that the rooms did not allow enough walking space, especially for two people. However, my friend and I had no trouble fitting our things in the room, and we still felt we had plenty of room to walk around. (Though, we had less than 4 bags in the room, so maybe someone with more than this would have trouble maneuvering around.) One thing to note--though it's pretty normal in European hotels--is that when you request twin double beds, keep in mind that the beds will be pushed together. They will have separate sheets and blankets, but they will not have the 2 feet of space between them that you would see in hotels in the U.S. But the lack of "personal space" is fine if you're staying in the room with a good friend. You couldn't beat the location of the hotel: 1 block away from the Seine, 1 block away from Chatelet (a major metro station), 1-2 blocks from a long stretch of shopping, and 2 metro stops from the Louvre. Also, the area is pretty safe, and we walked back to the hotel at night on more than one occasion. Admittedly, the hotel is a little pricey because of its great location ($400-500/night), and being a student, it might be a while before I have the money to return. But all in all, if you're willing to pay the price, this is a great hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ACanadianguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from our honeymoon in Paris and stayed at the Hotel Britannique in mid-May. From the moment we walked in the door, we were treated with courtesy and respect. Reservations were made for us at major restaurants and a bottle of chilled champagne and chocolates were provided to welcome us. The staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to provide recommendations on things to see and do, as well as a few "little things" such as a sewing kit, which my wife used to make some quick repairs on some clothing. The rooms themselves were small, but very comfortable and clean, with a mini fridge for storing wine, water and juice. Closet space was more than sufficient for our needs. The bed was a comfortable double and we enjoyed using the small terrace off our room to sit outside and enjoy the view of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is centrally located and literally steps away from the Seine, Notre Dame and the Chatalet Metro station. With the Louvre a ten-minute walk away and several nearby restaurants offering great food, I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris. Insider tip - if you are looking for an excellent tour guide in Paris, I can recommend Karen Henrich of Nuit Blanche Tours. She's a Canadian who has lived in Paris for several years and can take you to many spots the guidebooks overlook. Check out her web site for more information.

Reviews.Title: “Ah Paris ... how wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kazm0
Reviews.Content: We arrived early from an overnight train - the hotel is conveniently within 30 m of the Chatelet metro. The location (close to Notre Dame and also the Louvre) is wonderful. The street is quiet, although many sirens can be heard going through the intersection at Place du Chatelet. The hotel is just as the web site showed, romantically decorated and cosy. The lift is slow (of course) and minute but it works. The room (with a window facing Avenue Victoria) was typically (apparently) Parisien small, but it was clean, comfortable and perfectly tidied during our week's stay. Bernard, the concierge, is brilliant! Nothing was too much trouble and he is friendly and very informative. The rest of the staff were also excellent. I would definitely stay there again. It was a wonderful week in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IreneSantaMonica
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights recently and had a perfectly fabulous experience. I can't say enough about this lovely Hotel. The staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful at all times. We arrived early and left our bags in a safe room near the front desk. The lounge is charming and welcoming. The room was exactly as shown elsewhere in these reviews and just what we requested. Upper floor, facing the street. We had a balcony which I loved. The amazing windows kept out all street noises. Beautiful room, perfectly clean at all times. One of the most beautiful bathrooms I've seen, I loved the tub after a long day of walking. This location can't be beat. The river is just a couple of minutes from the hotel and you can see the Eiffel tower from the bridges. So beautiful at night. Every thing is close to this hotel. We spent all our time walking across the beautiful bridges to nearby Louvre, Tuilleries, and all the way to the Eiffel Tower one afternoon. Notre-Dame is just a ten minute walk as well. The Zimmer restaurant is very nice and just across the street. We had dinner there twice when we were too tired to go any farther. The metro entrance is a few yards from the hotel, so convenient and important as we had to leave very early in morning and took RER B to CDG and got there in about 45 minutes. Wolf , the kind gentleman who was at the desk all night, gave us a wake up call and made sure we knew how to get to the airport in plenty of time. I would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jab31151
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent six nights at the Hotel Britannique. We chose the hotel mainly for it's great location and reasonable room prices. As stated in previous reviews, the location is excellent. Many sights are within easy walking distance and the nearby Chatalet metro/RER station will get you anywhere you want to go if you don't feel like walking. There are many places to eat nearby so you won't have to hunt for dinner. The hotel staff is wonderful. Everyone at the front desk spoke English and they were patient enough to listen to my poor French. We had a room with a king bed. All the king bedrooms face the rear of the building, so there was no view, but the room itself, although small, was nicely appointed. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was good sized and perfectly clean. There was plenty of hot water every morning. One night we experienced noise from the room next door. The people staying there stayed up late, talking loudly. Several reviews have commented on noise being a problem. Depending on who your neighbors are I can see what they mean. Since we had no problem the other five nights we were there I would not consider this a big deal. We ate breakfast at the hotel each morning. Most hotel breakfasts are overpriced, but I feel you're paying for the convenience of not having to go out. The food was good with a nice selection of breads, fruit, meat cheese and drinks. I was surprised to find no orange juice, but there was grapefruit juice, milk, water, coffee and tea. Overall I would rate this hotel highly. If we reutrn to Paris I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: DublinLove2travel
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel going by the previous reviews on Trip Advisor this hotel lived up to everything they said and more. This was my first visit to Paris and I couldn’t have been more happy with what I got. The location of this hotel is perfect. It is on a lovely quiet street just around the corner from the River Seine. And a mere 5 minutes walk from the Louvre.. The hotel staff where more then helpful. They let us leave our bags as we arrived early before check in time....and the night porter even left coffee and croissants for us to have before our early departure home. We booked a standard room which was small as expected, but really comfortable and tasteful decor and extremely clean! I didn’t find it as noisy as some reviewers claimed. the odd gurgle of water could be heard and doors opening but nothing to keep you awake at night. For a first visit/ romantic get away in Paris this hotel is simply ideal and I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: slglenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here based on reviews we read on trip advisor and frommers and could not have been happier. I can not say enough good things about our stay. The location is perfect! Located across the street from the Chatelet metro stop and taxi stand and a short walk to two of the best shopping streets in Paris (beside the Champs Elysees, which I think is overated compared to the Rue de Rivoli and San Michelle). It is also a short walk to the louvre, the Seine and Notre Dame! The staff was so nice and helpful. The room was cozy and clean and always felt like returning home after a long day of walking. My husband and I would end our days picking up a bottle of wine, cheese and a bagette from the numerous brasseries located all within walking distance of the hotel! The hotel breakfasts were also a great way to start our day! It is true what they say...it really does help to learn some key french phrases and a simple Bonjour and au revoir will go a long way too!! I hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique Brittanique!”
Reviews.Author: LorraineKoertzen
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at this brilliant hotel based on the reviews on this website. Being our first time we were a bit nervous of what actually to expect. This hotel more than exceeded our expectations. The decor, the rooms, the unbelievable friendly staff just made our stay perfect. The staff are always willing to give you some ideas on where to go to give you a true flavour of Paris. They organised taxis for us and told us about some French customs and history which really helped us to enjoy our holiday even more. And after a long day translating and trying to communicate in French- with more than our fair share of weird looks - it was a pleasure to return to someone who spoke English extremely well and be able to relax a little more in the wonderful surroundings of the lounge area and reminice about your day. Hint to all travellers to Paris, if the car doesnt have a "Taxi" logo on it leave it alone, we were horribly ripped off by an unscrupulous driver when we arrived in Paris - Gare du Nord to the Hotel approx 10 mins was 105 euros, the Hotel organised us a Taxi to the Moulin Rouge which was 3 times the distance and is was 15 euros. The Hotel is literally 2 blocks away from the Latin Quarter and the Notre Dame, 1 block from the Siene river where you can see the Eifel tower quite clearly and about 10 mins slow walk from the Louvre. There is an entrance to the Chatelet metro across the street from the hotel as well, so everywhere else is within easy reach. We had breakfast at the hotel as it was easier and found the food to be great, fresh croissants, pain aux chocolate, fruits, yoghurts, cheeses, meats, boiled eggs and sausages and some wonderful coffee too. The rooms were very nicely decorated, plenty of hot water, nice TV and Bar fridge, we were in room 17, the view was at the back of the hotel but we didnt stay in the room to look out the window we were out and about all day and when we did get back to the room we were too exhausted to check the window view. Noise was never a problem as the street is a very quiet street so there was no noise from there and although the hotel was full we didnt hear anyone from where we were unless they were using the lift. We would definately recommend anyone going to Paris to stay at the Hotel Brittanique.

Reviews.Title: “First time”
Reviews.Author: letsgoFlorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Britannique at the end of Nov. We made reservations directly with the hotel on-line. They responded to our questions in a timely manner and provided any extras we asked for. A great location to all major tourist areas and one street over from the river. The staff spoke English and did not make us feel bad about our poor French attempts. Do not expect American size rooms although we did get a queen bed which was roomy enough for our kingsize taste. Nicely decorated with clean up to date bath. The elevator holds one person with a bag or two. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: daldevdan
Reviews.Content: I just arrived back from a week in Paris. I chose this hotel because it looked so cozy and comfortable. I was not disappointed. I stayed in a single room on the 6th floor that was kept immaculately clean. The staff was attentive and friendly. The breakfast was included in my winter rate and I found it delicious. The location of this hotel is also a big plus. They are within minutes of Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. The metro is right around the corner. Without a doubt I would stay here again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Merveilleux!”
Reviews.Author: CDNeh
Reviews.Content: Our eight night stay in August was delightful. Our flight arrived in the early morning and we were at the hotel well before check in time. We were able to leave our bags at reception and go for lunch before one of our two rooms was made available early for us to rest. Our rooms on the 5th floor were side by side. A double for my wife and I and a twin bed room for our adult children. Noise was not an issue for us as we were sharing a wall with family but it was apparent that there was minimal sound proofing which could be a problem if one is unfortunate enough to have inconsiderate neighbours. No street noise but no view either. We didn't see this as a problem as we were out of our rooms early and back late. More important was the comfort of the beds and spotless housekeeping - outstanding in our estimation. Our children's room had a standup shower stall while our room had a tub with flexible shower hose. If you are not agile and very fit do not take a room with tub only - once seated you may not be able to regain your feet without assistance. Poorly placed grab handle makes getting up from the narrow tubs a challenge! Good for a laugh for us but could present a hazard for older tourists I believe. Ask for the stand up shower stall if you have strength or balance problems. The electrical outlet in the bathroom accepts North American plugs. The small safe in the closet was useful. We had the hotel breakfast one morning only and it was very good but we preferred to go to nearby cafes such as the Zimmer and watch the morning street scene while we had a light breakfast. The location was perfect for us as we like to walk and this hotel is so well situated for the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Metro and restaurants. The hotel is on a quiet street and we always felt quite safe returning in the evening. Staff were friendly and helpful and arranged our taxi for our early morning departure. Excellent value in a charming, intimate hotel well situated to maximize your time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely if you dont mind being up close and personal!!”
Reviews.Author: overseassoon
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location.. Recent stunning refurb although cramped. Excellent ZIMMER restaurant across the road and fabulous bakery around the corner. Staff very friendly, helpful and apologetic when we highlighted the walls were paper thin and were kept awake till the small hours by the couple making out next door!! Tea and coffee provided in room but no kettle or hot water as this has to be obtained from the lobby - bit tricky if staying on the 5th floor

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: tbill817
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my four-night stay at this small hotel a couple of blocks away from the Seine. Although my room was quite small (and so was the elevator), it was quite comfortable. I also enjoyed hanging out in the comfortable lobby a few steps below the reception area. The staff was cordial and helpful and the first-arrondisement location was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: We-wed-In-a-Castle
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Britanique for a long weekend. It is absolutely outstanding. We travelled to Paris by Eurostar and got a taxi from Gare du Nord to the hotel, which was a bare 10 minutes away just a 7 euros ride. The hotel is very stylish and yet also very traditional, our room as expected was small, but well presented and more than adequate for our needs, plus the bathroom was truly excellent, spotlessly clean, lovely toiletries and fluffy robes. Also the bedding was changed daily- amazing. The main selling point of this hotel is the unbelievbale location for the price, literally 5 mintues from the Seine. We had bought our walking shoes with us and we were able to walk from Notre Dame along the Seine taking in the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower right up the Champs Elyesee to the Arc de Triomph. What we both really appreciated was the fact that as the weather was unseaonably mild we able to enjoy some fantastic meals in the heart of the city and walk back to the hotel along the Seine, usually around 1am and feel completely safe. It really is the place to stay in Paris, we can not recommend it highly enough, don't take our word for it, go try it for yourself, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but.......”
Reviews.Author: Ringp
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful six night stay at Hotel Britiannique. The location---as expressed in other reviews---is fabulous (especially during the metro strike!); easy walk to Notre Dame, Louvre, Latin Quarter, etc. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Our room (superior double) was tastefully decorated and very clean. Daily housekeeping was exceptional (we always leave a couple of euros daily for the housekeeper). The reading room just off of the lobby is quite comfortable and a good spot to relax, read the paper, plan your next outing, etc. We choose the optional breakfast (16 euro) on a couple of mornings, and that was plenty to hold us until dinner. The windows are soundproofed and very little street noise could be heard. BUT, the inside walls must be paper thin with no insulation! Beware that you can very easily hear in the room beside you and above you----normal conversation, footsteps, closets opening/shutting, coughing, toilet flushing, etc! This is the only drawback for this hotel and, indeed, it can be a big one for some people. It is rerally too bad, because by all other measures this place is a real "find!" FYI, nearby on a sidestreet next to Note Dame (rue du Cloitre Notre-Dame) is Le Vieux Bistro (NOT a typical touristy bistro in that area) with absolutely the best beef bourguignon you have ever tasted! And we had a very mediocre meal at nearby La Chaumiere en I'lle (Pont Marie)!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: thewildboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Britannique for our honeymoon and we loved it. The location was perfect. We were a 5-minute walk from Notre Dame, a 10-minute walk from the Louvre, and adjacent to a major Metro/RER hub that could get us anywhere in the city and beyond. The hotel itself was charming. Rooms were, typical to Europe, smaller than American standard, but definitely larger than what I expected. We stayed in room 51, which was at the end of the hall and had a balcony with a small table and two chairs. We had a bathroom with tub/shower. The front desk staff all spoke English. I would recommend designating "breakfast not included" when you book. Their buffet breakfast is lovely but very expensive at 16 Euros per person (about $24 American at the time of our stay). We partook twice but generally got a cheap breakfast of a crepe or croissant elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jennergy
Reviews.Content: A secret gem right inthe heart of the city and next to the Metro (40 minutes direct from Charles De Gaulle airport). Perfect room: small but everything in place; air-con, heavy drapes, French furnishing, small fridge, modern & clean bathroom, power-shower, comfortable matress. Best rooms face the street at the front, rear face offices! But whichever room, it's quiet. Welcoming and cosy breakfast room with very fresh continental breakfast and wonderful coffee. Receptionists extremely friendly. Spotlessly clean hotel throughout. Top of my list for a relaxed & comfortable Parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Britannique”
Reviews.Author: Ahmads
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique was amazing. It's clean, immaculate, quiet, and comfortable. Our room was small by American standards, however, it was big enough for two people, and I believe it was big for a Paris hotel. Our room was at the top-most floor, with a small balcony that faced the street. The bathroom was spotless and in superb condition. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's only a 5 min walk to Notre-Dame; 12 min walk to the Louvre; and less than 1 min to the River Seine. Right across the street from the hotel is the way to one of the Metero (subway) stations-"Chatelet". My husband and I spend four days in Paris, and by the second day were using the Metero to get arround. We even took the Metero to Versailles (making one metero station change) to see the famous palace. It is also surrounded by lots of cafes that are open late in the evening. The staff was very helpful. There is one person in particular who wasn't too friendly, however the rest were very pleasant. It's a small quite hotel with lots of charm. One staff member (an older gentlemen who mostly worked in the evenings) in particular was extremely helpful. He spoke excellent English, and helped us identify metero stops, and gave us tips on how to read the Metero map, etc. Our last day in Paris, we checked out early in the morning and left our luggage at the hotel until the evening. I booked the room using the hotel's own website, and got a great rate. Do try their website first when you are booking a room. The hotel is a good 30-40 min drive from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Ocelottravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights a week ago. It's a lovely hotel close to many of the major sites. A terrific value too, considering the USD. The room and bathroom were larger than expected, and all was very clean and classy. I would definitely return. Only two criticisms: one of the hotel staff at the reception desk had an attitude problem (the rest were very nice, helpful and patient with my non-French); and the hotel charged us 15 euros commission to call a taxi for the following morning's departure, but which was described to us as a 'deposit' on the taxi fare. Otherwise, all was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous position”
Reviews.Author: UkYoungretired
Reviews.Content: Two of us (young retired) just spent five nights here. Really pleased with the postion, just 3 minutes from the River Seine. Very impressed with the cleanliness throughout. Staff varied, some extremely helpful, others not so good. Would stay again but request a room on 3/4/5th floor, as lower floor rather dark. We didn't like this, and they did move us when it became possible as they were very busy. Breakfast plentiful. Thought 16 euro a bit high until we saw what we would get for 8/10 euro round the corner. Had breakfast every day there. No complaints at all. Liked the little extras such as bathrobes, nice toiletries, hairdryer. Bed linen changed every day which impressed us. Overall, very pleased with our stay, and would certainly consider staying again. However, would try to get a better price as I think we paid the top rate.

Reviews.Title: “Just Exactly What We Wanted & Expected”
Reviews.Author: AlandDiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in mid July in #12. The location is incomparable - easy walking distance to every site we wanted to visit on this trip. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and welcoming. While I had expected to hear some noise, based on other reviews I read before our trip, we only heard one couple walking in the hall one evening as they walked toward their room. Other than that, we heard no one. We met several couples in the lobby over the course of our stay. Each was a repeat client. We understand why and will definitely stay here the next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: bcgiftgirl
Reviews.Content: Can't really add much to all other postive reviews written. Lovely hotel, excellent location, friendly & helpful staff with excellent English. Cosy, pretty & clean rooms. Across the street from RER & Metro station. Walking distance to so many Paris attractions, shopping & of course, restaurants. Too many to name. Go explore & have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic, Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Sunshine26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago on our first visit to Paris and were delighted with it. The location is great (it is within walking distance to Notre Dame, the Lourve and the Orsay Muesum). The hotel was charming, elegant and chic, our room was small but we knew to expect this from European hotels, and it was very clean with a lovely bathroom. The hotel was renovating when we stayed there but as we were out all day this did not bother us at all, the staff were polite and best of all did not laugh at our terrible French. This hotel was fantastic and we would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Britannique c'est magnifique”
Reviews.Author: sleepwalkingsiren
Reviews.Content: Our room looked like you expect a romantic hotel room in Paris to look. I didn't feel like I was in a hotel in Texas. The decor just felt like Paris. It was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, we were never disturbed by noise, and best of all, we were within walking distance of major attractions (Notre Dame, The Louvre, etc etc). There were wonderful little cafes close to our hotel. I can't say enough good things about the location. The rooms are a respectable price and you get what you pay for. If you are worried about having a pool or a panoramic view of the Eiffel Tower, you will not find it here. But....that short walk my fiance and I took when we turned a corner....it was a moonlit evening and there it was in all its glory, the Eiffel Tower. Neither of us had ever seen it before. It just took our breath away. So we shared a romantic kiss on the street as one should do in Paris. Off the balcony of a hotel room is nice I suppose, but the Britannique is a little jewel. I hate to even put a review here in a way because I am tempted to keep it all to myself. It's a romantic hideaway, not a touristy hotel. I can't say enough about it and I will always stay there when I go to Paris. There is nowhere else for me. I was first intrigued when I saw a business woman's comments. She traveled alone and said she felt safe there. Not having been to Paris before thought it an important consideration. It was exactly as she said. I never felt worried or afraid about the location of the hotel. They were mostly quiet little streets with friendly people. I wanted to rent the room permanently.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mtngrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Britannique for a week in early July 2007. We had two rooms, #11 and #15, and paid 173 euro and 199 euro. Room #11 had a queen bed while room #15 had two twin beds. Both rooms had large windows that opened to the street. The queen room had a stall shower in the bathroom while the other room had a bathtub shower with a half glass wall. Both bedrooms and bathrooms were in pristine condition and the rooms were very nicely decorated. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms had individual thermostats (including a/c). The hotel has soundproofed all of the rooms. We did not even hear noise from the street. Each room had a very large closet with lots of hanging space as well as shelves. Bathrobes are provided as well. The windows have a darkening screen for at night. It is hard to describe. It is hidden when not in use, but all you do is pull the string and the shades are built into the window and they roll down and make the room very dark (and quiet). The rooms had mini bars, and a nice tea set to have coffee or tea in your room. There is a nice lounge to relax in, with beautiful decor and very comfy sofas. The breakfast room is off of the lounge area. Breakfast can be taken in this room or delivered to your personal room. Breakfast was more extensive here than in most hotels. Lots of miniature croissants, etc along with fruit, cereal, sausage, meats, and scrambled eggs. Coffee, juice, tea and milk were also provided. The location of the hotel is excellent. The metro station/taxi stand is across the street and sort of kitty corner. The hotel is a block from Rue Rivoli and the other direction a block from the isles. Very central location which allows you to walk most everywhere. There are numerous shops and restaurants all around. The hotel was very good about making restaurant suggestions for us. The night before we left, the hotel arranged a shuttle for us to the airport. The shuttle arrived right on time and we were very pleased with the service. This hotel is great in so many ways. Location, helpful staff, and beautiful rooms. I would highly recommend the Britannique to anyone who wants to feel pampered in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJeff
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great hotel. If there is a better hotel in Paris for the price I would be surprised. Everything about this hotel was great. My wife and I stayed here for a week in July, 2007. The room was nice and it was quiet. The staff were very friendly, helpful and spoke english very well. Close to everything including being surrounded by really nice restaurants. We have recommended this hotel to close friends who are traveling to Paris in Sept. so that says a lot! Don't miss out on this gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huskieinrooland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early June 2007. It is clean and convenient with friendly staff and a great location. The hotel is minutes from Notre Dame and the Lourve and is only steps from the metro and train station. You can get anywhere quicly and easily from here. The rooms are "European small" but nicely decorated and certainly excellent value. Bathrooms are clean and our room had a nice balcony and quaint view. Staff are helpful and friendly and can take care of small details for you. There are a number of restaurants and cafes in the area which will more than satisfy you. I would suggest this hotel to travelers to Paris! Its great value and Paris is a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect setting for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Helsie
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Brittanique and it really lived up to everything we were after. A charming place with friendly, helpful staff. The room was nicely decorated with a lovely bathroom and the cutest little balcony (complete with pretty wrought iron table and chairs) overlooking a picturesque but quiet street. Location wise it was perfect with all the major attractions within walking distance and a 2 minute walk from Chatelet metro which takes you straight up to Gare du Nord and most other destinations. My only grumble would be the noisy cleaning staff in the morning but then it was 10am so it acted as a good alarm clock!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hans50
Reviews.Content: A wonderful small Parisian hotel on a lovely street, close to the Seine and museums. Walking up to this hotel in June was a treat, surrounded by flower venders, plant shops, and pet stores. The lobby and lounge was cozy and quaint, the staff extremely helpful, and the breakfast buffet a treat. Our room was large by Parisian small-hotel standards and was quiet, but the "view" was non-existent. My wife and I agreed that this is the best hotel we've found in Paris at the three-star level.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ninde
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming little hotel in May for three nights. Our room was really pretty, just like the pictures on the hotel website promised. Really romantic in all ways. The location of the hotel is suberp and just by the river Seine and near the best shopping places. We did not enjoy the hotel breakfast, so I cannot comment on that, but there are plenty of restaurants nearby to enjoy a really decent priced breakfast. Service at the hotel was also friendly and helpfull in all ways.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfactory hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonKiwiCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Britannique for two nights for our wedding anniversary this year, and it under-promised and over delivered. Despite there only being two rooms left when we booked we got a very sweet little room on the sixth floor (room 65), and though we were told that there were no non-smoking rooms we never noticed any smokers' smell. Being on the top floor and in one corner meant that we never heard a peep from any of the other guests. The hotel is in a wonderful location for visiting Notre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, the left bank, the Latin Quarter etc., and very handy for the Metro (Chatelet). After reading a few other reviews we decided not to pay for the breakfast at the hotel. There are so many cafes around the hotel and we had no problem getting a very good breakfast for about half the €15 that the hotel charges. All in all a perfectly good little hotel in a wonderful location. Only the price of the rooms stops it getting 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “29th most popular? hard to believe”
Reviews.Author: robg9000
Reviews.Content: OK, the positives: the LOCATION - about equally near the Louvre and Notre Dame. You'll find yourself crossing over to the left bank several times. We looked in the Latin Quarter but couldn't find anything there but it's a much more happening area than the Chatelet area. the SHOWER- many have only tubs or some kind of makeshift shower. the neutral: the STAFF- they were helpful and spoke English for us, but gave absolutely terrible restaurant recommendations (Entrecote, in particular. We found Le Petite Chatelet on our own and it was heaven on earth) and semed to think that our nightly requests for ice were going above and beyond. the negtive: ROOM SIZE - the bed took up 75% of the room (#17) the VIEW - none, even worse, you're so close to the building next door you feel like you're in a fishbowl. the VALUE - the discounted rate was still like $300 US when all was said and done and for that amount of $, you shouldn't have to store your suitcase in the bathroom for lack of room anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Bijoux but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days in April. The rooms were small as expected in Paris but spotlessly clean and nicely appointed, everything you need really. Bathroom gleamed and hot water a plenty. Lovely breakfast area and sitting area The staff were OK some more friendly than others but cracking a smile is obviously quite rare in Paris so overall pretty good. Best about the hotel is the location, right in the heart of Paris . 5 mins walking distance from Notre Dame, Pompidou, Louvre, Seine, Metro, Batobus, Les Halles, Town Hall, RER trains, Rue de Rivoli shopping. Couldn't wish for more. Worst about the hotel, thin walls. You can hear everything through the walls so if you dont mind the odd conversations and bonking noises coming through its fine. Breakfast was not worth the euros as there are better cafes that do breakfast within a stones throw. All in all I would recommend this hotel highly for the location, comfort and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: IandP
Reviews.Content: After our disastrous time with hotels on our honeymoon in Rome last year it was with some trepidation I booked our anniversary break in Paris. I certainly needn't have worried. I thought the location was excellent when we got off the train at Chatelet only a few yards to walk from the RER/metro. On arriving our booking for 5 nights was quickly confirmed and we took the lift to the fourth floor. The lift was small but that is pretty standard across Europe. The room was exactly as it looked in the pictures and yes those fluffy bathrobes certainly are hanging on the bathroom door. A card and chocolates wishing us a happy anniversary really was a nice touch. The room was comfortable, clean and everything worked ...................maybe that's a hangup from Rome! Copious amounts of hot water were available and the shower was powerful too. A small minibar in the room was stocked with reasonably priced beverages. On the days it rained there were umbrellas available to guests, again just a little thing but it makes a difference. International newspapers, or at least "The Guardian" were also available free of charge at reception. The staff were always pleasant and helpful which makes a stay much more memorable. Not being big breakfast eaters we took our morning coffee at one of the numerous cafes in the area, so cannot comment on the breakfast buffet available, maybe next time. As mentioned in other reviews the location is excellent for exploring the sights in Paris and being so close to Chatelet it makes everything you could wish to see easily accessible. We had no problems with noise and are already planning another trip to Paris where we have now found the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: RouseysTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights, March 22nd and loved it!! Very close to the Metro, eataries across the road, Notre Dame 2 minutes walk! Rooms lovely, with excellent bathrooms and very,very clean. We found all staff friendly and would recommend this hotel. Beds very comfy and romantic, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: tvlmonkey
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location, a minute walk from RER/METRO station(Chatelet). Nice neighborhood and walking distance from pont neuf, notre dame and Louvre. Rooms are Moderately sized with superb decor. Cons: Thin walls between rooms, no soundproofing, You can hear everything that is going on in other rooms

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hotelguruoslo
Reviews.Content: I had to come to Paris for work, so my partner came down and we made a weekend of it. I booked into the Britannique mainly due to its proximity to the RER (intersection of the line from CDG and the line to La Defense), proximity to the Marais (one of my favorite areas in Paris), and the reviews on TripAdvisor. As a frequent and very traveller, I have to say that I was not disappointed with this hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly - something of a rarity in Paris. English seems to be all that is spoken there. The room was small, but the bathroom was quite large and very clean. Like KaryL (see a couple of reviews down) we stayed in room 17 on the first floor. Noise wasn't really an issue for us, but we may have provided some entertainment to those in the neighbouring room (apologies to those people)! We didn't do breakfast there as there was a reasonable bakery around the corner. I recommend the full breakfast at the cafe on the corner of Rue du Rivoli. Same price as the croissant 'breakfast' as the hotel and very good. Typical Parisien service though. All in all, i would recommend this hotel for couples and singles that want a good location and a comfortable, friendly escape from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelin'Girl13
Reviews.Content: We only spent a night at this hotel. The hotel is really pretty and well kept and the front desk was very helpful. We actually got to the hotel late in the day and wanted to tour around a lot, so we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but the bathroom was a good size and the sitting area in our room was perfect for the luggage storage as we tore around trying to refresh before more sightseeing.
