Walked around, went to the Louvre, did a river tour, had dinner at a great cafe by the hotel. (All of it was really close and convenient - no cabs needed.) Afterwards, went back to the hotel. Contruction was going on around the hotel which was somewhat annoying to have workers polls outside the window, but that was in August of 2005, so I'm sure they are done by now!! We had to leave early the next morning, so we didn't get to stick around for breakfast, but it was definitely a hotel (overall) that I would recommend. Very clean and nothing felt old or worn out(decorations and furniture). I did think it was a little overpriced, but it is in a great location and it IS Paris afterall.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the location”
Reviews.Author: cosmodada
Reviews.Content: We went for the Thanksgiving weekend : The Good: 1. Location, Location, Location- Steps from Chatelet metro stop. Walking distance to Notre dame is about 10 minutes, to the Louvre about 15 minutes, Rue de Rivoli (for shopping) about 2 minutes. Partial view of the Eiffel tower from our room on the 5th floor. 2. Friendly staff. 3. Tons of Cafes around the corner. For a killer Creme Brule and espresso try the Cafe Zimmer right in front of the metro stop. Sit outside and you can sip your morning coffee with a view of Notre dame. 4. Clean room and super clean bathroom. That's one thing I loved, the cleaning staff did a great job. 5. The price - 4 nights set us back about 620 Euros, not bad for a double with a view. 6. Walking distance to a supermarket (super marche) on Rue de Rivoli. Great to get water, cheese and bottles of Champagne. The Bad: 1. Small rooms. Very cozy - good if you want to snuggle with someone. Frankly it doesnt really matter since you are out most of the day and are only back to sleep. 2. Expensive breakfast @ 14 Euros. So ditch it and walk to any of the cafes around the corner for that omelette and mustard combo. 3. No iron in the room. You have to go down and use the ironing room. Overall - The good outweighs the bad. Go for the location, the cleanliness and the choice of cafes around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but OH the noise”
Reviews.Author: KaryL
Reviews.Content: Like others have noted, the location of this hotel is superb. You can walk to many places on both the right and left bank, and there's a good metro....Chatelet....around the corner. Yes, the breakfasts are overpriced, but so are they all, and there are cafes down the street and a wonderful patisserie with great chocolat around the corner. Like others, however, I must report that the walls separating the rooms seem to be paper thin. You can hear everything that goes on....someone snoring so loudly you think it's coming from your room; a mother trying to wake her sleeping, jet-lagged child with a "sweetie, wake up." (You know she is not yelling that.....but we could hear her plainly). We stayed in a lower "superior" room, so extra expense is not a solution. Our solution if we stay here again? Travel with someone else & ask to stay in adjacent rooms on the elevator side (curiously, we heard nothing from the elevator shaft, which adjoined our other wall). There are only two rooms on that side, so all you would hear is your friends...although that could lead to other problems!! It's a shame, because the other charms and amenitites of this small hotel are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Britannique THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: PepsiWoman
Reviews.Content: Never being to Paris and never booking a hotel from researching the web this hotel was the "best". I booked it based on the comments from trip advisor ( which again, I never used before but will before every trip). The hotel was very very clean. I stay in the double superior room with a double balcony and my girlfriend in a single with a single balcony - small compared to American standard but very very comfortable.We had a double closet - half to hang things and half shelves. In room "safe", in room mini refrigerator - great for expensive water/soda. The bathrooms were very very clean and charming - OH the best thing terry bathrobes hanging on the back door, which is great after the night time hot shower after a day of walking. In the lobby we only spoke/saw to Americans, so I felt it catered to Americans. The location the best, 2 blocks to Notre Dame. Metro stations all around. We did not have the "breakfast" for 14 Euros - great pastry eat-in "cafe" for less money. Bistros/Cafe/Resurants all over, you will not starve. We had a lifetime experience. Don't be afraid to take the Metro or RER. The Open Tour bus was a great way to get a feel for the city - you get on and off at certain stops and you get ear phone for a guided tour. Go and ENJOY !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: parkbench
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 week stay which included 3 nights in Paris at the Hotel Brittanique. This was the perfect Parisian hotel, close to everything. It's a short walk to Notre Dame, Latin Quarter, tons of cafes, etc. It is beautifully decorated and has amenities such as hairdryer, make-up mirror, washcloths, lovely soaps and bubble bath, etc. We'll stay there again when we're in Paris. J&D, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielleGB.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Paris and I miss it already. We really enjoyed this hotel because it was very centrally located to everything. We were with in walking distance to the Louvre, Latin Quarter, the Seine, Champs Elysees and the metro. We walked to the Eiffel Tower but that took a little time. If you are up for a leisure stroll I would recommend it. As for the hotel, yes the rooms are tiny but very clean. There is a great charm to the rooms and the lobby. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. I popped in to some of the other rooms while they were being cleaned and I noticed that the front rooms on the sixth floor have a great view of the Eiffel tower. I did not see this mentioned in any reviews of the hotel. There are great places to eat within steps of the hotel. We ate breakfast a few times at the boulangerie around the cornor. This establishment won awards for their bread and croissant. In addition, we discovered a great creperie across the street that can be deadly. The banana and chocolate crepe is to die for. There are many other places to go to as well. We met a lot of Americans staying at this hotel both young and old. We are in our early 30's. Stay here you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “More smile please”
Reviews.Author: I_love_SF
Reviews.Content: It is a nice cute hotel with great central location. The rooms are not big but it is comfortable and clean. The decor is very nice with a romantic touch. The breakfast is very very good and highly recommended. I would have rated this hotel above average except for one thing, one of the staff. I was kind of shocked by the unfriendliness of a certain staff. Especially after I read all those reviews about how great the service is. Most of other staffs are very helpful but everyone there seemed to lack smiles on their faces. The service issue became even more apparent after I stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile and felt like a king there. My recommendation for this hotel is that if the management care about the reviews and ranking, they should get rid of this person. It is awful to have one bad apple destryoying it all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Les68
Reviews.Content: The Britannique is an excellent, small, quaint hotel located in the exact center of Paris. You can quickly walk to many Parisian attractions, including Notre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, Latin quarter, Les Halles, Louvre, and the 6th arrondissement. The hotel itself is located right at the metro Chatelet, and this is the major hub for multiple metro lines serving the entire city and the suburbs. It's a busy metro stop, lots of people and lots of walking, but it is very convenient to the hotel. The cafe Zimmer across the street is a well-known Parisian establishment, and the cafe around the corner does have an excellent croissant. The loud Rue de Rivoli is just around the corner, but the noise doesn't make it to your room. The hotel is spotless, absolutely spotless. The housekeepers take excellent care in providing quality and clean linens every day, in polishing everything to a gleaming shine. The room safe is a great way to protect valuables. The closet is very large and has shelves as well as hanging space. The rooms are small, but ALL PARISIAN ROOMS ARE SMALL! Unless you book a $600 room, your room will be small. Same for king sized beds. They are almost always two beds put together, but I've slept in them and they are not at all uncomfortable and you do not fall through! Anyway, the bed was very comfortable. There is a little noise that came from people above me showering, and the last night there was a couple of young guys next door making all sorts of noise at 3 a.m, but after I knocked on their door they calmed down. The concierge told me I should have contacted him and he would have done it for me. Breakfast was expensive, but it was a LOT of food. Meats, cheeses, eggs, sausages, breads, pastries, cereals, juices, coffee, tea, chocolate, you name it. HUGE amounts of food for a French breakfast. It would be great if they gave you an option of just croissant/bread/coffee for less money. But, the breakfast was consistently excellent. The staff was pleasant and remembered our room numbers, called taxis for us, helped us whenever we needed it. All speak excellent English as well. It's really a very good hotel and very well located. Any troubles it has would be experienced in any hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great”
Reviews.Author: nearandfar2
Reviews.Content: Location is the best thing about this hotel, as most other reviews note. It is in easy walking distance (and we are not big walkers) of Notre Dame, the Louvre, and some other top attractions. The Metro is at the corner, and the RER (line C, Vick train) to Versailles is just across the bridge on the left bank, about 3 blocks away (beware of con men in the station trying to "help" you buy tickets). There is a good bakery close by for breakfast (right from the door of the hotel, right at the end of the block, on the near corner of the next street, Rue Jean Lantier). There are also a couple of good enough cafes near by, although we found the food got better and the price came down as we moved away from the the river. We liked a bistro on Rue de Reynie, a few blocks notrth of the hotel, called Bistro Romain (or something close to that). Stay away from the cafes right along the Seine and those across the bridge on the Ile de Cite. The prices are very high, even for Paris, and the food so-so. Also near the hotel are an ATM machine (you'll need it given Paris prices) and a MacDonalds on the Rue de Rivoli if you have an urge for a Big Mac. As for the hotel itself, we were well pleased, although a few things left it short of great. Our room was well decorated and reasonably equipped (good TV -- even with 3 English language stations (BBC news, BBC prime, CNN), a safe, and A/C that worked). The bathroom was good, and all was clean and taken care of. Our room as a "superior king) at 193 euros, but still quite small. A standard room size must be tiny. Our room's (#17) window faced a wall, which was too bad. Avenue Victoria is quiet and picturesque, so a room overlooking would have been better. Unlike a recent reviewer, we had no noise issues from the halls or adjoining rooms. We didn't ask much of the staff, but they were helpful in getting us a cab to the airport and making a reservation. Speaking of taxis, on the two occasions we took a taxi to the hotel, the drivers did not know the hotel by name. So keep its address in mind. There were a couple of drawbacks to the room. The king bed was really two twin mattresses with a sheet over them, which made for an uncomfortable middle. Not the best idea for a supposedly very romantic hotel in a romantic city. The plugs were odd, and there was no place to plug in our converter to keep our cell phones going. The bedside lamps were below the level of the bed and had only decoarative 40W bulbs, so reading in bed was not possible. With these caveats in mind, we would recommend the hotel. We gave it 4 stars (4.5 would be closer), but it falls just sort of a 5 .

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Meg22
Reviews.Content: This small, cosy and charming hotel has a great location one street back from the Seine, a couple of blocks from the Louvre and the Jardin de Tuilleries, and a short walk to the Left Bank. The excellent staff are friendly and very willing to help. Our room was small (as in most hotels in Europe) but very well set up with a comfortable bed, attractive decor and a good bathroom. The guest lounge area is also very attractive and welcoming. Just across the road is the excellent Cafe Zimmer, where the meals are medium-priced and good (you must try the Bertillon icecream - to die for!!). All in all, a wonderful experience in the fabulous City of Light. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: k8isgr8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real treasure! I've just got back from a 4 day stay with my fiance and we had the best time. From the moment we entered, the hotel simply radiated charm. We were greeted in a positive and friendly manner by the delightful reception staff, one of whom is actually British, which was a real help for us (her name's Kelly, she's brilliant!) Our room was more than I could ever have dreamed for- small, yes, but so delightful that we hardly noticed. The whole hotel is impeccably clean and well maintained and the lounge area is one of those places where you genuinely can snuggle on a comfy sofa and lose yourself in a good book. The breakfast buffet in the morning is possibly one of the most impressive I've seen and is well worth a try. The bagage storage room was also very handy when it came to our departure. Our taxi (organised by our new friend, Kelly!) arrived bang on time, and sad as it was to have to leave this little haven, we came home with that warm feeling of having made some new friends and found a new home in the truly fabulous city, which is Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This place is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: siska39
Reviews.Content: I love hotel Britannique. It is by the Seine river and very close to Notre Dam. The room is small, but very cute. I love the old decor yet it's not dark and seedy. My boyf and I stayed there for 6 nights, we had no complaints. The staffs are helpful& speak English. The area is not too touristy, and if you walk few metres you'll find a subway station and a taxi stop. You need these two in Paris. You can't just stop a cab on the street there. Plenty of restos and cafes around it, very safe as well. I just think it is un necessary to waste your money on chain hotels if you can get cheaper deal at a sweet local hotel like this. Plus, if you care, it has AC in the room...(very rare for local hotels).

Reviews.Title: “TREMENDOUS HOTEL...GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: IDGNBTT!
Reviews.Content: Our entire family, consisting of six adults and two children, ages 8 and 11, stayed here for four days in June. It was exceptional in every respect....cleanliness, location, personnel, ambience and price. We booked our four rooms predicated on Trip Advisor reviews and these reviews were "Spot On!" The hotel is ideally located within walking distance of the Seine, Louvre, Notre Dame and the St. Germaine. We started everyday with coffee, juice and decadent pastry right around the corner from the hotel. The rooms are well appointed and beautifully decorated. They are small, but certainly functional. The front desk personnel are some of the best we have encountered in over 35 years of travel to Paris. They recommended two restaurants, which were exceptional and exactly as advertised. You can spent a great deal of money for rooms in Paris, but you won't find the total package for this price and location. A REAL FIND!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Centrally-Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: W&Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hotel Brittanique in June 2006. The Hotel Brittanique is in the 1st Arrondissement, near the Chatelet Metro station, so it is convenient to everywhere in Paris. It is within walking distance of the Louvre and Notre Dame. The location could not have been better. The hotel is very pretty, and our room was wonderful--spacious and well-decorated with modern amenities. The air conditioning was especially appreciated, since Paris was going through a heat wave. Breakfasts are not included, but there is a patisserie around the corner and cafes nearby. A great place to say in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in The Heart Of Paris”
Reviews.Author: JerryandPatty
Reviews.Content: Great service coupled with an ultra clean room and terrific air conditioning make Hotel Britanniqe a gem. Our five night stay was made all the more convenient due to the hotel's proximity to the Chatelet Metro stop which is literaly accross the tree lined street. In addition, since Chatelet is on the RER line it's possible to take the train direct from Charles DeGaulle thereby avoiding a hefty taxi fare. (just be careful to find your way to the Rue Victoria exit since Chatelet is a major hub) Our room (#17) was well appointed with a beautiful bath and, although it did not provide much of a view, was quiet since it did not face the street. After searching Trip Advisor we took a chance based on the reviews and were not disappointed. If you're looking for excellent value in a great location you can't go wrong with this hotel. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannique”
Reviews.Author: gvblaw
Reviews.Content: Hotel Britannique exceeded our expectations. The rooms were small but very clean and the air conditioning worked. The hotel staff was very helpful and the location was excellent. I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!! Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: suzidoucha
Reviews.Content: What a location!!!! It was so exciting to be able to walk everywhere - nothing was too far away. We had the junior suite and absolutely loved it. It was charming, large enough by Paris standards, very comfortable and wonderful. We did not eat the breakfast at the hotel and like other reviewers found a wonderful place around the corner and had cafe au lai and a croissant for a fraction of the price. Another wonderful thing about this hotel is that right around the corner (along the Seine) there are blocks and blocks of florists and pet stores which I enjoyed stopping at. I recommend getting a room facing the street - it gave me so much pleasure to look out on the street and observe Paris whenever I wanted to. One more thing - there's a great Chinese restaurant right across the street which I strongly recommend if you don't feel like walking one night. In conclusion - I TOTALLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AND AM SO GLAD THAT I CHOSE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannique: It Should Be Much Better Than This”
Reviews.Author: Nocciola
Reviews.Content: After all the glowing Trip Advisor reviews my wife and I decided to book a room for our second visit to Paris. In all honesty, we do not understand what all the fuss is about. We opted to reserve a superior double room which cost a bit more than the room we reserved at a hotel in the St. Germain des Pres district on our last visit a year ago! The room at the Britannique was not worth it at 168 euro. The room was not just smal: it was tiny! We felt very claustrophobic. The shower reminds me of a prefabricated type of shower, not pretty at all, but just functional. As for the location, well, we preferred being across the river on the left bank as it had more charm than to be near Chatelet this time. Not much char at all. Also there are not much restaurant choices nearby the hotel. As for the staff, well, they were present. They weren't rude nor were they very welcoming. in short, we won't be returning to the Britannique as we really find that there much more nicer hotels that offer excellent value on the other side of the Seine (left bank).

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful setting for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a late review--my husband and I stayed here for one week in May 2005 on our honeymoon. We highly recommend it--excellent location allows for easy travel to/from the airport and all major sights. The staff is very polite, and the lobby is lovely. Our room was clean and stylish, if a bit small. We were overall very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: oxfordman
Reviews.Content: we just got back from paris and staying at the hotel a month ago...i cannot imagine how a hotel could possibly be in a better location to walk to all the sites...within a mile of any direction you have it all...the room was very clean and the bathroom was cleaner...we had a room on the second floor overlooking the front street and with the window closed there was no noise and unlike others we heard virtually no noise from other rooms...also our room was plenty large for the two of us the staff helped me on every request like printing out maps and giving directions...they even had a tin of candy waiting in our room knowing it was our anniverssary...not only would we stay there again but we have told several others who we met on our adventures about the hotel...our son is in europe for the summer and it is too bad he can't afford to stay there there are several restaurants nearby but the one around the corner across from the bakery was very good and an experience

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience”
Reviews.Author: shkazi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel in May 2006 with our baby son (who is just seven months old). Without doubt, this is an excellent place to stay. Everybody was so hospitable there. They went out of the way to help us on several occasions e.g. restaurant bookings, airport shuttle bookings, luggage storage for a couple of days out-of-Paris journey. They even arranged a luggage carton for us and a packing tape. The Hotel First of all it is not a luxury hotel and may not appeal to those who are used to five and four stars. It is a small 'boutique' hotel, which is charming and very well run. Staff will spoil you with their positive attitude and hospitality. They are fluent in English. Once inside the hotel, you will find the lobby area and especially the library room (or waiting room whatever you may call it) cozy and aesthetically decorated. Hotel offers free maps of Metro, Bus & RER. Get the one which has a 10% discount card of Printemps and keep it for shopping at the departmental store. Herald Tribune is available at the reception. CNN and BBC are available in the room. Room We booked their superior room, which was larger than the normal double bed room and had a bathtub + shower combination. It was a good decision & well worth the extra Euros. The bed was perfect (king size) and the mattress was comfortable. The room was of an appropriate size (not small but was not big either). Baby crib was comfortably placed in the room. There was sufficient space in the cupboard and around the room corners to accommodate our 4 pieces of luggage (2 large sized suite cases and two cabin sized bags). Even after all these things had consumed room space, we could still navigate within the room and on its sides. The rooms are spotlessly clean and very well decorated. They are definitely cute and appear exactly as shown on the hotel web-site. The wash room is lovely, it is very very clean and comfortably sized. Location The location is central & very safe. Chatelet Metro Station is just round the corner (it is one of the major tube stations and several lines pass through it including the one to Disney). Versailles RER is across the river, past the island. Taxi stand is also close by. Key tourist sites are within walking distance (Notre Dame, Louvre, Orsay etc). Several bus stops are nearby. Just behind the hotel is Rue de Rivoli, which has several stores and boutiques. McDonald fans can also eat 'Maxi Menus' on this road, hardly 1 minute walk from the hotel. There were three French restaurants nearby, which seemed good as they were full with people at the dinner time (unfortunately we could not eat in any of these places). We came late in the evenings (around midnight) and always felt safe, both on foot and on metro. Breakfast Yes it is expensive at Euro 14 a person but it is delicious. Different varieties of Cheese, juices, scrambled egg, breads of various sorts, croissants including the chocolate filled ones, ham, sausages, mixed fruits, tea, coffee, milk etc. It is a highly nutritious buffet breakfast which powers one for the whole day of sightseeing. Alternately there is a bakery round the corner as well (however we did not try it). Child Friendly We found the hotel to be very child friendly. We asked for a quite room and got it. The outside view was not good, but you are not in Paris to stay in the room and look out of the window. It was a compromise which we had to make (i.e. between a room with a view and a quite room) and we made the correct choice. The baby slept tight every night. The hotel has given an electric point in all rooms so one can easily use the electric sterilizer. Our sterilizer needed a microwave oven and the hotel had one. It was made available to us everyday with a smile. We brought our stroller along, parked it daily in the hotel luggage room and took it out whenever needed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nstojov
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris and because of the reviews we chose this hotel, which I absolutley loved! We felt that the location was perfect! We had a room on the sixth floor facing the street. I know I read some reviews complaining about the street noise, but I didn't hear a thing from outside, maybe because we were up higher, although I thought the street the hotel is on was very cute and quiet. There was one bum that camped out in front of the hotel at night, but harmless. Every morning we went to the bakery around the corner which was delicious, we looked forward to it every morning. The metro is just around the corner along with a lot of shopping and cafe's everywhere. It is true that the hotel walls are thin and the rooms are a bit small, but we still found it to be very comfortable. The staff is very nice and extremely helpful. We found that most of the people/waiters in Paris were very nice. It really helps if you at least try to speak french. We used a guide book by Rick Steve's that was extremely handy. All together we loved Paris and we loved this hotel. If we were to come back we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Hotel Britannique”
Reviews.Author: Roscommongirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Britannique. We found the previous positive reviews of this hotel to be accurate. The hotel is spotlessly clean (we even saw the chambermaids cleaning the legs of the beds and the doors each morning!) and is in a great location. Reception staff are very friendly and helpful, especially the gentleman who works in the evening. You are right beside many major sites such as Notre Dame, Sainte-Chapelle etc with the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay approx a 10-15 minute walk away. Also you are across the road from a metro station which is very useful when travelling further afield. There are some nice cafes, restaurants and creperies in the area. We dined in Restaurant Zimmer across the road one evening and found the waiters friendly and the food good. We would definitely stay in this hotel again when in Paris, because of its good location, cleanliness and feeling of enjoying a little more of the ordinary daily life in Paris rather than staying in a large chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jackiem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights last week. Very central location for metro and all the sights. Hotel very clean and friendly. Rooms small but well decorated and very very clean. Were on 4th floor room 46. No view but quiet. Would stay here again. Cafe Zimmer across the road waited over 5 minutes for them to take breakfast order so walked out and found small cafe round the corner instead. Didnt' ahev breakfast ib hotel as 14 euros is a lot when we only wanted coffee and crosiant.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent three nights here. For Paris standards the price-quality ratio is exceptionally good. The hotel is well situated, intimate, very well decorated to create a comfortable atmosphere and the staff is very kind. Our room was small, but very cosy and pretty. The bathroom, on the other hand, was very comfortable and irreproachably clean. We enjoyed the bathrobes! The little salon next to the reception is also very warm and peaceful - the kind of place you would want to walk into when looking inside from the street.Breakfast, though rather expensive, is fantastic, with fresh juice, an assortment of attractive French cheese, ham sausages, and pastry. Although other people on this website commented on the heat and noise, we did not experience any of these problems. The room was rather hot when we arrived but we simply opened the window - and despite being very close to the reception and sleeping late in the morning, we were not woken up or bothered by noise at all. When travelling I particularly dislike arriving at a hotel and being disappointed by what it is really like, as opposed to what it looked like on Internet. With Hotel Britannique, this is defintely not the case and we feltthat we really got what we expected. We were sad to leave and will definitely come straight back next time we stay in Paris - there should be a Hotel Britannique in every city we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Bebe99
Reviews.Content: This hotel does have a great location about halfway between Notre Dame and the Louvre. It's located in The Beaubourg/Les Halles area and is only steps away from lots of cafes/bars/restaurants. It's also really close to a metro so you get easily get just about anywhere in Paris. The rooms are very small compared with American hotel rooms but standard for Paris hotel rooms. Our room had plenty of storage space so we weren't tripping over our bags. The rooms are spotlessly clean and we had no smoking odours in our room. However, the location of the Hotel is very busy and our room experienced a lot of street noise - people talking, cars, sirens etc. Maybe lighter sleepers should request a higher floor or one at the back of the building. The bathroom is nice but small - especially the shower - there was no bath. Hotel staff are quite friendly and helpful. The place does have the world's smallest lift - not for the claustrophobic. We had the breakfast one day for convenience and it is a bit pricy at Eur 14 however if you have a big appetite and like to nibble on a few different things then it may suit you well - they have sausage, scrambled eggs, bread, ham, cheese, yogurts, fruit etc. They'll also do boiled eggs for you as well. There's plenty other places in Paris where you'd pay the same for much less food. One previous reviewer said the area was a bit seedy but I didn't find this. We went to a couple of different restaurants in the area which were wihin easy walking distance and found them really good value. We particularly enjoyed Au Pied Du Cochon near St Eustache which is a bit more pricy but good for a special occasion. Cafe Beaubourg on Rue Quincampoix was really excellent value and good food. I would not recommend the mussels at Le Trappiste which is just round the corner - they weren't very good. If we returned to Paris we would consider staying here again - I thought it was good value for the location. Alternatively I would look for other hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, moderate price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the hotel. The hotel exists just next to the metro station Chatelét where several lines are available and 5 minutes walk from the Notre Dame de Paris. So the location is excellent. The room is quite comfortable, quiet and has enough space to stay. The reception staff speaks English well and friendly. Buffet breakfast fee is not included in room charge. But it doesn’t worth paying 14 euro. There are many cafe, bar and restaurants near the hotel. In front of the hotel, there is a good Chinese restaurant. I will return to the hotel at next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: hamano03
Reviews.Content: Located within minutes by foot of Notre-Dame, the Louvre, Palais Royale & Beaubourg, Hotel Britannique is ideal for tourists, especially the first-timer. There is something magical about being able to wander out of your hotel and "happening" upon a gorgeous view of the Ile-de-Cite & the Seine or the frenetic shopping strip that is Rue de Rivoli! The hotel itself is very charming but on the small side. Our room was quite cramped as was the bathroom. In particular, the shower stall was a joke; it was so narrow and had no shower door or shield, only a curtain, as to make it impossible to shower without flooding most of the room! The maid (and her mop) had my sympathies! Although well-situated for sight-seeing, the immediate area is not the most active at night, which is great if you want peace after a long day of touring the sights, but made dining out a little tougher. Of course, wandering across the Seine after a wonderful French dinner on the Left Bank is nothing to complain about! The staff was pleasant and helpful, and generally spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Just an adequate place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pdxitaly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Britannique was not a horrible experience-- but I wouldn't recommend it to a friend unless they were a smoker. I know it's different in Europe-- but I don't smoke and actually arrived in Paris with a bad cold. Our room-- the air, the bedding--everything-- reeked of smoke. It made sleeping unpleasant-- and I was told moving to another room the next day was not an option. The location is great-- we were able to walk to major sites and fantastic restaurants. The front desk staff was pleasant-- but not overly helpful. When we arrived... I didn't want to wait to take the tiny elevator to our room-- so I let my friend take the elevator and I headed for the stairs and asked the desk attendant if my room was just up the stairs. He said yes and sent me on my merry way with 2 heavy suitcases (at this point I'd been on the road for 6 weeks), a laptop and heavy backpack. At the top of the first flight of windy, narrow stairs I realized I had 5 more flights to go and bailed on my walking the stairs plan... but you'd think he'd say-- there are 6 narrow, windy flights of stairs rather than waving me off. As noted in other reviews-- a 13 Euro breakfast is expensive-- we didn't do it. We DID enjoy the view of the Eiffel tower from our room. Lisa Helderop Portland, Oregon

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. I wasn't sure what to expect from reviews, but found myself really enjoying this hotel. The staff was lovely...the day receptionist was quite sweet and especially helpful. The night help was good too, I just happened to see the day receptionist more. Our room really was very nice. And having a nice, steaming hot shower was great. We'd come from Italy where the water never seemed to ever get "hot". The location was perfect. Easy walking to the Louvre, to the Marais area, to Notre Dame, to the Latin Quarter. We had tea in the Study, which was really a treat. They carry Marias Freres tea...quite nice. From reading people's comments for numerous Paris hotels, I've realized that much of the negative comments stem from people not used to Parisian hotels. The rooms will be small (if you want larger, be willing to find a hotel for more money or look into apartment rental instead)you are in a city, so you will hear noise. Keeping in mind that rooms are small in Paris, you will hear noises from other rooms despite sound-proofing. This is not the hotel's fault though some people will give a negative rating for something that should be blamed on other guests. Yes, I would stay there again. The price, the reception, the food, the room, the location. It was all good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel... But doesn't live up to all this hype...”
Reviews.Author: rain1973
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Brittanique for 5 nights because of the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. We both felt that it was a good hotel... not great but adequate. The best thing about the hotel is its location. It's just a block away from a Metro hub station Chatelet and a stone throw from Notre Dame, the Louvre, St. Chappelle and the Marais (which tends to be our favorite neighborhood). It's very centrally located in the 1st arrondissment with great views of the Siene and Ile de la Cite just down the street. You can pretty much walk everywhere without having to jump into a cab or the Metro. It's a charming hotel. A bit "grandmotherly" for our taste at times but the rooms are well maintained and the bathrooms are spacious for European standards. The staff was kind and helpful. The breakfast was decent but for the 13 Euro price tag, it was a bit of a disappointment when there are good cafes and boulangeries a block away. We had nothing to really complain about... it's just that its an uneventful hotel. It's a great place to set your head on a pillow but as far as it being romantic, fun or interesting... it is not. Especially since it's in Paris (a city with so much history and intrigue), it was kind of a let down to stay in a space that was a bit characterless. However, if you want a place that's comfortable and relatively inexpensive, Hotel Brittanique would be a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Britannique from Feb 15-20 and thought everything about it was perfect. We had a Standard Double Room on the fourth floor that was beautifully decorated. The room faced the street but we had no trouble with outside noise at all. As mentioned in previous reviews there is some problem with the sound-proofing between rooms, however it was never enough of an issue to really bother us. We actually never heard any of our neighbors, instead it was the people above us that we could hear walking around late at night or early in the morning. The staff at the front desk were very helpful with restaurant suggestions and transportation questions to and from the airport. The most amazing thing about this hotel is its location. You are one block from the Seine, a few blocks from Notre Dame in one direction and the Louvre in the other direction. We walked EVERYWHERE from our hotel and only took a taxi at night when we were just too exhausted to walk anywhere else. If ever back in Paris I would definately stay at the Hotel Britannique again and I will be recommending it to any family or friends that travel through Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended but would do things differently next time”
Reviews.Author: rainydays26
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Overall we were very impressed with the location, quality of the hotel and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. We stayed in a superior room on the first floor with a great view of the back of hotel on the next street and their extractor fans! I was very dissapointed with this having thought that the superior rooms would have had a better view. The room also smelled smoky - had I thought in advance I would have requested a non-smoking room although that option wasn't available on booking on-line. It wasn't too bad though definitely not enough to warrant complaining. The other problem we had with the room was something that has been mentioned before and that was the lack of soundproofing. Being on the back of the hotel it was quieter than I had expected but the main problem we encountered was the very loud people in the next door room who woke us up at 5.45am when they left to get their plane! The room itself was great. Very nicely decorated and clean. Even with the radiator turned off it was very warm! The bathroom was great again very clean and it was nice to have a powerful shower that was a decent size and not a matchbox. We opted to have the breakfast in the hotel both mornings. It was plentiful with a good choice and worth the 13E. The weather wasn't great while we were there and it was easier to have breakfast in the hotel than venture out! The staff were very helpful throughout our stay. My english accent gave me away though as even though I spoke French to them they always replied in English! From checking reservations for lunch to recommending somewhere for dinner and advising us the best way to get to places they were faultless. Another recommendation for the Cafe Zimmer - we had a lovely Valentines dinner there. Location wise it was great. Only a few stops down from the Gare du Nord (Eurostar) and near a major intersection of the Metro lines. It was very close the the Seine and lovely for a walk over to the the Ile after dinner. We found the area to be ok and despite many homeless people we saw, we never had any problems with any of them and felt very safe. Overall we were a dissapointed with the view and the smoky smell in the room but were otherwise very impressed. We would definitely stay there again - just request a non-smoking room on a higher floor! A lovely stay in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: Tourist_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Britannique for 1 night in a Standard Double room (room #25) and 5 nights in a Single room (#62). The location is excellent. The hotel is down the road from Hotel de Ville, around the corner from Rue de Rivoli, a short walk to the Louvre, the Seine, laundries, patisserie, Chatelet Les Halles metro. There are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Unfortunately, there is a bit of a problem with noise in this hotel. In the single room, I could hear traffic and people talking next door, word for word. The double room on the other hand was at the back of the hotel and was completely quiet. Light sleepers should definitely ask for a room at the back The double room was very nicely furnished and was a big step up from the single room. The bathroom in the single room was tight quarters, reminiscent of an airplane bathroom and the fittings are not as modern as the double room. Plenty of steady hot water, not many TV channels, friendly staff at the reception, locked luggage room and a view of the Eiffel Tower out the window of my single room which was on the 6th floor Overall, I would stay here again for the location but I would pay the extra for a double room at the back

Reviews.Title: “Another Reality Check”
Reviews.Author: yossarian
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of business in Paris and have traveled to Paris extensively over the years. Based primarily on the reviews here, I decided to give this hotel a try for an extended weekend stay. Although the Britannique offers a decent value, I was generally unimpressed and I doubt that I will stay there again, primarily because of the excessive street noise (lack of soundproofing) and excessive smoke smell in the room. The hotel bills itself as a "Traditional Hotel housed in 19th century Parisian private mansion," but, except for perhaps the main staircase, there isn't anything traditional that remains about the hotel. The rooms have been renovated, but any traditional architectural highlights are gone - replaced with "Home-Depot" style doors, wall-paper, fixtures, furniture, carpet and moldings (unusual for a Parisian hotel). As a result, the hotel lacks character. On top of that, our room (the junior suite) could have used a re-wallpapering. However, the rooms were generally clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke English. In my opinion, there were two "fatal" flaws with the room. First, the noise. We could hear everything on the street outside - including word for word conversations of people talking, cars, trucks, motorscooters, etc. From midnight to about 2 AM, it was primarily the bar crowd returning home that woke us up every ten minutes. Then, beginning at about 6AM were the sanitation workers and shop owners. In addition, the hotel is on a busy sidestreet, and just 1/2 block from the busy Point Chatelet - meaning that there is a lot of traffic noise 24/7. Secondly, someone in another review mentioned that the hotel smelled "musky." I believe this was smoke. There are no non-smoking rooms and ours reeked terribly of cigarette smoke. Because of the noise and smoke smell, we came within a hair of relocating to another hotel. In addition, there was no thermostat in our room. To adjust the heat, we had to adjust the water valves on the radiators. As a result, we were unable to find a comfortable temperature. Having said that, when it comes to temperature, most European hotel rooms tend to have a mind of their own (even though most have thermostats). Turning to the hotel's location, someone in another review mentioned that their room had a great view. I find this hard to believe. The hotel is land-locked in the middle of a block, and the only view we had was of an ugly building across the street and a homeless person who spent every night on the sidewalk in front of the cedar furniture store next door. One block in front of the hotel is the Sienne and the Ile de Paris, one block West is Paris' main metro station (Chatelet), and a few blocks East is the Louvre. This is nice. A lot of sights are within a short walk, and the Metro will bring you just about anywhere else you might want to go. However, one block behind the hotel is the Les Halles district. Les Halles is not one of the best neighborhoods in central Paris. This neighborhood has most of the mainstream “economy” stores of Paris, and a large underground mall. These tend to attract a particular crowd – not necessarily bad per se – but not the same tourist or Parisian shopper crowd that you will see in most other parts of Paris. The high-end stores are a long walk up Saint Honore street. There are, however, plenty of cafes, patisseries and bars within a stone’s throw of the hotel. Across the Sienne on the other side of the Ile de Paris is the Latin Quarter, which I find more interesting and entertaining, and a better location from which to base my stay. Hence, although I believe that this hotel is a good value, and clean, and in a decent location, I really don't understand the hype. For about the same price, there are many worthy alternatives, with better soundproofing, in more interesting neighborhoods. This hotel will not be on my list the next time I stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Pacman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HB for 9 nights for our honeymoon in September 2005. We wanted a central boutique hotel and that is what we got! 1. Room - Small compared to US standards, but beautifully decorated, quaint and clean. We loved the red tile in the bathroom so much we copied the color scheme in our master bath! 2. Location - Excellent! We enjoyed croissants/pastries at the bakery around the corner almost daily. The Chatelet metro stop is steps away and that one connects you to most lines. At the time we were there, there was construction going on across the street, it wasn't too bad, but when we tried to nap after a long day of exploring, we could hear it. The hotel is a few blocks from the Seine, Notre Dame, St. Chappel (a must see!) and shopping. We also always felt safe walking to-from the metro to the hotel. We were fortunate enough to see most of Paris because of the great location and metro passes. 3. Staff - Nice, but not very informed on places to go. We asked for suggestions for lunch/dinner and they suggested looking at the tourist pamphlet area. They were unable to help us with reservations for dinner at the Eiffel Tower. Things to keep in mind...the elevator is TINY! Two people fit, and that is it! We never ate the continental there, simply because we enjoyed the cafes that were close by so much. For a night cap, we visited Au Trappiste a block away. Great beer selection and if you like the flavored beer - I loved the Fromboise (raspberry). We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel:- Just watch the soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Ferdinand
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip that we used tripadvisor to help us choose the Britannique. It was a lovely hotel. Very "Boutique-like" and smart, the breakfast room was nice and the breakfast good value at 13Euro for unlimited visits. You may like to choose a few other places as well nearby. Great choice of restaurants and bars and the area is very safe. In fact the location of this hotel is brilliant for getting to all the best bits of Paris. The rooms were absolutely spotless. It was one of the cleanest hotels we have stayed in. The one issue we did have was that the walls between rooms are poor in terms of soundproofing. You either have to be very lucky and get someone who goes to bed early next door, bang on the wall or use earplugs which can be bought pretty easily from places and do a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Establishment”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: The Trip Advisor reviews were on the money. Lovely quaint place. Great location near 2 Metro stops with a very helpful staff. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were very nice. The walls are a bit thin but above average for this level of establishment in Europe. Not enough to be concerned about at all. The bakery around the corner is super and the Cafe Zimmer across the street was also very good. I will stay here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from Paris and were extremely happy with our stay at Hotel Brittanique. The decor is charming, the location is terrific, and the staff was wonderful. Our room was kept spotlessly clean, and the spacious bathroom with tub and shower was much bigger than I would have expected for Paris. The rooms are not large, but I expected that in Paris when paying only $170 per night. My fiance and I had no problem with the space for two people and two suitcases. We stayed in the standard double room and had a queen sized bed, two bed-side tables, and a small desk with chair and footstool, and a flat screen TV. The view from our room was also terrific, and since the hotel is situated on a quiet street there was no problem with noise. The location can't be beat, as you are only a few blocks from the Louvre and one block from a very central metro station (Chatelet) where you can get on most of the metro lines in the city (including the train that goes to and from the CDG airport). I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend less than $200 per night who wants to stay in a charming hotel that is impeccably clean, with great service and a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Reality check”
Reviews.Author: tannins
Reviews.Content: I will try to refrain from simply complaining about this hotel, because that doesn't help anyone....but I was pretty disappointed here. Bottom line first, in case you don't want the winded version....if you have the money to book the largest room possible, this can be an acceptable place to stay...although overpriced at that level. The small rooms should be around $100...no more. Good things; The people that work here happen to be very nice. The location is very central, although a few blocks in the wrong direction at night can be scary if you're not used to big cities. Homeless, etc... The bathroom was clean, although musty smelling from no working fan. When they realized they messed up my room reservation, they did try to offer some alternatives as they became available...but none were any better than the room in which we were originally placed. Cute lounge. Bad things; Musty bathroom. They messed up my reservation (reserved for the wrong month). I was subsequently placed in the smallest room I have ever seen (the only room available). While peeking around SOME rooms seemed slightly larger, but do NOT book the standard double room if you expect to be able to fit you and your luggage in the room at the same time. Perspective, the room measured less than 8' x 8'. Again, I feel like complaining and adding sarcastic comments about one person having to walk across the bed if the other person was standing, due to lack of room to pass on the floor, but I will stop there. When I was shown a "larger" room it was about 2 feet longer, although no wider, but had no tub only a shower. We stayed in the smaller room. Our choice at that point. I was offered a discount as atonement for the mistake. When I was billed, the discount was listed as "winter promotion" so obviously a deal that was being offered anyway. And a deal that I wouldn't have been made aware of and hence would have paid more than I had to pay had they not messed up my reservation. If you travel with a back pack maybe a good option. If you have two normal suitcases, you will feel trapped if you spend more than a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and the hotel exceeded what I expected for what I payed. The location was great and I was able to walk to many attractions and the main metro line (Chatelet). I would highly recommended this hotel to anyone. The staff was helpful and polite and the rooms were cute and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Britannique is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Daffedowndilly
Reviews.Content: Chose the Britannique for our 7th visit to Paris and it is definitely the best 3 star hotel and the best location yet. Beautiful little room, exceptionally clean, lovely touches such as fluffly white bathrobes and Annik Goutal toiletries and your own safe. Wonderful view from our room on 6th floor, we could see the ice skaters skating outside the Hotel de Ville. Terrific location for eveything you may want to see. DO have the breakfast, at E13 it's incredible value for Paris. Cornflakes, muesli, fresh fruit salad, scrambled or boiled eggs, good yoghurt, fruit compote, all types of bread, rolls, pain raisin, pain chocolat, croissants, nice juices, iced water, two types of ham, little sausages, cheeses, nuttella, jams, etc. Plus point you help yourself to everything and take a teapot and make your own tea just as you like it. You won't get all that in a cafe! The little lounge with the leather and velvet sofas is lovely for a pot of tea and staff very friendly. I would not want to stay anywhere else now. The lift is no smaller than most Paris hotel lifts which take max 3 persons. There are even hotel umbrellas in the lobby to borrow. Very nice 'home' shop next door and interesting little shops in the area, but Rue Rivoli and large shops just round the corner. Le Reminet restaurant, 3 rue des Grands Degres, highly recommended. About £75 for lovely meal, good bottle of wine and coffee for two. Very tiny so need to book. He opens at 7.30pm. Real cooking, not tourist food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Location”
Reviews.Author: Trev_Karen
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Britannique after reading the other reviews from this website and it definitely did not disappoint. The room was small but very lavishly furnished, far better than higher grade hotels that you would stay in in London. The hotel was perfectly situated, and although it was my third trip to Paris, I was able to see far more during this visit than I saw during the previous two visits combined. The staff are extremely helpful and booked our restaurant tables, as well as giving us excellent directions to the various venues. The Chatellet des Halles metro is literally 10 metres from the front door, although you would never know it, as there is no vibration, noise, or hectic pedestrian traffic in the area. We will definitely be back. We couldn't have asked for anything more for the price - in my opinion a complete bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from visiting Paris in December for the first time. The hotel was perfect. There was actually nothing that we could complain about. The rooms are small, but thats what most of the hotel rooms are like in europe. The room was very comfortable and very clean. With our room facing the main street, we couldnt hear any noise from the traffic. The only time we did is when we opened our lovely french doors to the balcony. The decor was nice giving a lovely french feel. And the staff were always kind and helpful. It is in such a great location, because you are 20meters away from the main metro, and when you cross the street you are right on the Seine River! and took us only 10mins to walk to the Louvre. The area itself in which you are is beautiful. We came across some of the worse areas in Paris and Hotel Britannique in definately not in one of them. There is a very nice but a bit expensive restaurant just across the road on the left side corner called Le Zimmers, the food is very french and delicious. And when you walk out to your right around the corner is a cute little Patisserie/cafe with yummy rolls and cakes. All round Hotel Britannique made our trip unforgetable. We will be definately be staying there again on our next trip coming up next year.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value In An Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: amp94596
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at the Britannique in six years. It was nice that nothing has really changed and that it continues to live up to it's high reviews. It really is a good value and you could live off the breakfast alone. Yes the rooms are small, you barely walk around the bed in some of them. The problem I had on this visit was with noise. I had a street side room and the noise from passing cars continued all night long. I didn't have this problem on my first visit when I had a room in the rear of the building. So, request a rear room or bring ear plugs! The second thing was that the walls are thin. People coming in late or watching TV can easily be heard and we were actually woken up two nights in a row by the guy next door snoring! The desk called him and he would stop but they had no other room to move us too. Between the snoring, TV and the traffic it made it hard to sleep. Ideally you should ask for a corner room in the back of the hotel. Otherwise the staff and the service were wonderful. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “just got back”
Reviews.Author: mapmaker64
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from a 6 day stay. Overall this hotel is great. The location is perfect and the rooms are nice. The only drawback is the sound proofing between the rooms. It literally sounds like the people in the next room are in your room. If it was not for that, this would be the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: paulgiles1670
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 1nt on business in Paris. As i was choosing the hotel for my colleagues I chose the Brittannique on the back of the previous reviews. This was my 4th stay in Paris and this was the best room I have stayed in by a considerable margin. New bathroom, flat screen TV, view onto a quiet tree-lined street, good sized rooms exquisitely decorated. Friendly check in staff with excellent English who offered to help with taxis/restaurants etc. Well worth the money. A short walk or an even shorter taxi (10Euro) to all the sights but the metro is next door. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French Boutique Property”
Reviews.Author: Imready2dream
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Britannique this past Nov. 2005. Found the property from Trip Advisor. We were extremely pleased. The hotel is located in the heart of the city, in the 1st district-Close to everything tourist-wise and perfect for soaking up local french culture. Found the restaurants around the hotel to be good, but expensive. Most food in Paris restaurants will set you back some serious Euros. The hotel does not offer room service (food) other than breakfast. So make sure you bring back snacks to eat during those hungry times while your adjusting to the time change or you don't want to leave your room. We came from California and often found ourselves hungry at 3am with nothing to eat, until 8am. Asma at the front lobby desk, was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel was very clean and charming. Also, check their website before your departure to Paris. We found that they were offering a 10% discount and had our room rate adjusted because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Britannique”
Reviews.Author: edward94
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the Britannique and loved it. Believe all the good stuff you read about this hotel on Trip Advisor...it's true. We had two rooms, my husband, myself and our 5-year old in one, and our two teenage daughters in the other. Both rooms were fine size-wise, extremely clean, roomy and spotless bathrooms. The staff were incredibly helpful in all ways and extremely attentive...and the place oozes with charm on the exterior (great neighborhood...very romantic walks in all directions and as noted....next to all the major attractions); and the interior done in extremely good taste and again, oozing with charm. My husband noted the hotel is remarkably quiet for being in such a central location - another plus. Cannot say enough nice things about this place.... We have traveled extensively world-wide and are extremely picky...but this place matched our expectations perfectly. Note, I have not seen any commentary regarding the hotel's handling of young children so would like to add that we had a wonderful experience in this regard..and no issues at all. Would also like to ditto comments on Cafe Zimmer...and also try the Chinese / Thai restaurant...both directly across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelpatti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Britannique from 9/27/05 to 10/6/05. This is an excellent choice for anyone that wants to be in the heart of Paris at an affordable rate. The hotel was right next to the Chatelet Metro and within walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame, Saint Chappelle, le Seine and Musee d'Orsay. The rooms were large enough for 1-2 people comfortably. The bathrooms were a little small and I would have like a larger bath/shower area. The hotel staff was very helpful and spoke English and could understand my partial French. The interior decoration was very charming and clean, with a nice breakfast every day. I was extremely satisfied with my choice of hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Pied-a-Terre”
Reviews.Author: emmacharlton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in November Great location a stone's throw from the Seine and within walking distance from other main sites. It is incredible that the hotel manages to combine peace and quiet with such a fabulous location. Also near to main Metro station for arrival and departure and if you need to get further afield. Room amply sized and nicely decorated. Breakfast fine, but I would agree with some of the other reviewers that you could get much better value and variety elsewhere. Free umbrella stand in the lobby a nice touch, given the unpredicability of the weather at this time of year. Great restaurant recommendation: Le Reminet, 3 rue des Grands-Degres in the 5th (just across from Notre Dame) fantastic food and good wine, very reasonably priced. We managed to put away four courses of delicious food. Would definitely recommend a stroll in the Jardin du Luxembourg (followed by a warming coffee in a nearby cafe) and visit to Montmartre, go to the latter on a Sunday morning to see the artists gathered in the Square and buy a painting. If you have time, take in some jazz at the Au Duc des Lombards, rue des Lombards - it has great musicians and opens late - but just a short hop back to the comfy beds of the Britannique!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, great value”
Reviews.Author: Get out of Dodge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Britannique for 9 nights in early October and loved it; it is immaculate with great front desk personnel who will call for reservations, etc. They gladly kept our large piece of luggage for two days in the middle of our Paris visit while we visited the Loire Valley. Our superior double room #22 was plenty big for us and our suitcases; it had two sets of French doors with balcony overlooking the street (we like a view). We are sound sleepers and the double-glazed windows blocked enough street noise for us, but if you are a light sleeper, you might opt for a courtyard room. The full breakfast was a deal for 13 euros, but if you just want something light, try the bakery/salon du the aroung the corner (right, then right). We vouch for previous TripAdvisor suggestions for Au Trappist (mussels and draft beers around the corner to the left). Cafe Zimmer is good for a late night eat, but for a close and reasonably priced gourmet meal we preferred Les Dessous de la Robe, 4 Rue B. Poiree (right from front door, quick left, quick right, then on the left on the corner of Poiree). The central location of Britannique proved helpful on our first day in Paris when the metro workers were on strike: no problem, we could walk to almost everything we wanted to see. I did extensive hotel research before booking the Britannique and feel that I made the right decision. Even after surfing last-minute rates right up to the bitter end, the Britanniqe offered the best value in my opinion for cleanliness, location, and ambiance. Enjoy your trip to Paris and your stay at the Britannique!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic---and thanksTrip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a classic boutique hotel---in a nice neighborhood, beautiful and far better than many hotels. I've stayed in many boutique hotels and this is one of the best ever---reminded me of the best boutiques in San Francisco (clean, newly remodeled, very helpful and in great little neighborhoods). I wouldn't have found it without Trip Advisor---so thank you! Fantastic location. One block from Seine, right bank between H:otel DeVille (4 blocks) and the Louvre (4 blocks). New bathroom, windows that open and helpful staff---especially "Wolf" who recommended two outstanding restaurants. Breakfast is excellent and worth it if you eat big (yogurt, scram eggs, hard boiled eggs, coffee, juice, ham, fruit, breads, etc.). Then again, who doesn't want to eat in a cafe? Rooms are small, but not small for Paris. Two of us (not skinny people) did just fine. Safe, tv and refrigerator. Super clean. Some good restaurants nearby: Pastery shop/Café (Boullanger, right, then right, around corner from hotel). Robe in the Palais: right then right from hotel. Menu is a blackboard, very french (not the place to order a diet coke). Excellent pesto salad with Mozerrella and sliced meat. Cafe Louis Phillipe--down along the Seine past Hotel deVille across from bridge of same name. Excellent dinner of Salmon and Beef Bourgionne. Desert of profiteroiles and brownie with custard. Cafe du Pont Neuf. 14 Quai du Louvre Good breakfast stop on way to Louvre. Two options: toast, croissant, fresh squeezed 0J with or without three eggs. 11€ with eggs, 8€ without.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location for Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are correct. The Britannique is a charming hotel with a fantastic location. We walked to the Latin Quarter, the Louvre and just about everywhere. Only about a block and a half from the Seine - neat to walk to the Seine at night and watch the twinkling Eiffel Tower. We have stayed in other parts of Paris and now prefer this location in the 1st arrondisement. Our room and bathroom were spotless and the staff was very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast at the Britannique is well worth the 13 euros - they offer delicious croissants and pain au chocolat, cold meats, yogurt, toast, jams, sausages and scrambled eggs, coffee, tea and hot chocolate, milk and cereal. We also ate breakfast at Zimmer Cafe at the corner of the street and it was good but the hotel breakfast was definitely a much better value and was delicious in a charming breakfast room. Also ate at Au Trappist for the 2nd time - they have great moules (mussels) and the salmon was good also. It's located right around the corner on Rue St. Denis. Would definitely return to the Hotel Britannique and hope to do so again soon. We had another perfect Parisien trip made all the more special because my sister and brother-in-law were with us and they now also love Paris. Already talking about a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: NJASH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful 7 night stay at the Hotel- Room 52. The balcony overlooks a small one way street with a view of the hotel de Ville to the left and the top of the Eiffel Tower to the right. AWESOME The staff was incredibly helpful and polite. The breakfast, though substantial, could probably be skipped and instead grab a great croissant and cafe cream out the door right- the quick right on first block. If you dig mussels- try a late night moules de jour and a nice beer around the other corner. The metro Chatelet is right across the street and is the hub of all Metro (subway) stops including the airport.- however many things like the Notre Dame are in short walking distance. My suggestion- plan your trip around the full moon if possible- Nothing more magnificent then seeing the Giant moon creep up over the louvre from the Pont Neuf- Eiffel tour to your back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, Fine... but...”
Reviews.Author: WhiteTara
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a four night stay in this well kept, well decorated, well located, small hotel. Staff was friendly and accomodating, and my room was clean and comfy. But the room doors banged with a terrible thump, and closet doors in the adjoining rooms did too... so at busy hours I felt I was living inside a percussion school. A bit of padding on the sliding closet doors would do a lot to make this hotel perfect. I suppose the thudding outer doors are part of the fire safety rules and can't be helped as I have encountered this elsewhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom7
Reviews.Content: After weeks of research and repeatedly checking TripAdvisor reviews, I finally selected Hotel Britannique for my family's trip to Paris in August, and kept my fingers crossed. I needn't have worried - it was everything we hoped for! Great location - walk to Louvre, Notre Dame, shops, cafes, and delicious "patisseries." Our room - a "junior suite" for our family of 4 - was clean, comfortable and as charming as its photo on their website. The breakfast was more than adequate. What really made the hotel special for us, however, was its staff. Friendly and knowledgable, they went above and beyond to help answer any questions we had, from restaurant recommendations to reserving city tours to meet our specific needs. "Karim" in particular truly made us feel welcome. The next time we plan a visit to Paris we know exactly where to stay - the Hotel Britannique!

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Expected”
Reviews.Author: jbecker268
Reviews.Content: After reading many TripAdvisor Reviews, we chose Hotel Britannique, and it was everything we expected. The hotel was extremely clean, room small but nicely done, the bathroom immaculate and the staff extremely helpful with directions, calls for dinner reservations and the like. In addition one could not ask for a better location: 1 block from a major Metro stop(direct trips to DeGaulle, Arc du Triomphe, Gare Lyon, Gare Nord . . .), a block and a half from the Seine, less than 10 minute walk to Notre Dame and the Louvre. Hotel Britannique was central to a wonderful three days in Paris. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “parisian style...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Great location and beautiful little room (yes the room was very small) but each room has an individual balcony with table and chairs, comfy bed (although i do prefer harder pillows!) and a great ambience. Upon arrival into our room we were greated with a little envelope with our names and a box of chocolates, to welcome us to their hotel and to wish us a lovely honeymoon. It was perfect and appreciated. The staff were friendly and very helpful (giving my husband a sneeky look at the internet to get the cricket scores!) and the hotel was spotless. Would stay there again in a flash...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Britannique-a great find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Britannique for 3 nights during November 2004. It was our first visit to Paris, and we booked this Hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews, as well as the hotel's website. We were looking for a nice, clean, comfortable, central hotel with a middle-of-the-road price ... we're not part of the hostel crowd, but also can't swing the Four Seasons. We LOVED this hotel, and it made our stay in Paris wonderful. It has a lovely decor that is warm and friendly the moment you walk in, and the lounge area is marvelous. We had done a lot of reading prior to our trip, and were prepared for small rooms, and less than friendly front desk staff. The front desk staff were a delightful surprise - each person, no matter day or night, was friendly, helpful and eager to make our stay enjoyable. Our room was indeed small, but immaculately clean and had a very comfortable bed. Bathroom was also spotless every day, and big enough to easily accomplish the essentials (althought one at a time). There was decent closet space, a safe so we didn't have to lug lots of stuff around, and a small, flat-screen TV. A/C worked well - we like a cool room, even in November. And the best part - our room had a lovely,flower-potted balcony that looked out onto avenue Victoria ... just what we wanted in a Parisian hotel room! I can't speak about the breakfast, because we were up and out each day without partaking, but we heard other guests remarking how much they enjoyed it. Another important feature for some travelers out there - there is an elevator available to reach the upper floor that works without a hitch, although one person + suitcase is the capacity. Lastly, the location of the hotel is also perfect. One easy block from the Seine, and close to the Louvre, Notre Dame, 2 metro stops, and the Samartaine department store (great rooftop restaurant with spectaular view). Plus, a cab stand directly across the street, so it was easy to be out the door and on our way to wherever. You won't regret staying at Hotel Brittanique, unless you want a huge space, room service and the works. We weren't looking for all that ... we wanted to see Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Britannique a gem”
Reviews.Author: RickCharles
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for a long weekend getaway. We stayed here for three nights in August 2005. The staff and the room were charming and I felt the price was reasonable for the location. The hotel is in the center of the City and the Chatelet metro stop is around the corner from the hotel. Easy to get to and get around from. The a/c was a nice bonus for the warmer August temps. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They made several phone calls to make arrangements for a nice birthday dinner for my wife. The only drawback was the tiny elevator and in the middle of the day was in constant use...so you might have to climb up and down stairs if you don't want to wait a considerable time. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 night at the hotel in July 05 for our honeymoon. They gave us a box of chocolates to celebrate which was nice. Our room was nice - a bit tiny - the bathroom was very clean and recently remodeled it seemed. The staff was friendly and spoke english. We paid $140 Euro a night and this seemed very expensive for the room we got...breakfast was not included. It was pretty quiet in Paris and it was a bit off season so I wish we had gotten a better rate. It is in a good location though and easy to walk to a lot of the major sites. I would probably only stay here again if I could get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vacation_lover-7
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we chose this hotel based on it's location and the reviews on this website. We stayed for 4 nights and were very pleased with everything! The location is awesome-walked almost everywhere and metro is across the street. There are many options close to the hotel for meals. There's a pastry shop around the corner where we had a great breakfast & lunch-we also really liked the breakfast at the hotel (good food & variety, pleasant atmosphere, coffee refills!). The staff is very friendly, helpful and attentive to your needs (they even arranged a shuttle for us from the airport to the hotel which was a great help). We were in Room 15 (no balcony but large french doors/windows that opened up), some street noise but not too bad. Room was very nicely decorated and bathroom was pretty as well. Everything was very clean and neat. We had a safe in the room which was a great help as well as a refrigerator. Would definitely stay here again. Say hi to Sandrine, Asthma and Kirim for us! We miss Paris and cannot wait to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! My husband and I just spent a six night honeymoon here and loved it. We had room 52, which was AMAZING with a big (but narrow) deck with a peek-o-boo view of the Eiffel Tower, a comfortable bed, and an immaculate bathroom. The staff was incredible, and even had a note, roses, and chocolates in our room at check in. The location was unbelievable, and we walked everywhere, hardly ever took the metro. We will never stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: madge002
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day stay at this hotel, I stayed here basically on the recommendations that I had read in this web site. I totally agree with the other comments about its cleanliness, I would like to hire their cleaners it was superb, and the rooms although small were immuculated decorated, there was even a bouguet of flowers for us as we were celebrating our birthdays which was a very nice jester. The hotel was perfectly situated as stated to many of the main attractions and the Metro was literally just over the road which was a great advantage to my some times tired feet. The only down side to the hotel that I can mention was that the rooms were not totally soundproofed and we could hear our neighbours perhaps a little too well. We did complain and were moved without fuss or question, but I do feel that perhaps the management should look at the soundproofing as it may be a problem. Having said that I would stay at this hotel again but ask for a room at the end of the building which might alleviate some of the problem.
